column6: No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Dropped by here for lunch. It was pretty empty though I could tell they were getting lots of pickup orders. You can order takeout at the counter or sit down to eat. I sat down and ordered the Beijing Street Noodles. The portion was honestly pretty big - lots of noodles, minced pork, and shredded cucumbers. Didn't notice the black bean sauce but overall pretty good. Overall, pretty straightforward place with nice portions and good prices for Williamsburg ($12 for this). Would definitely recommend and try the rest of their menu.

This was a nice spot in Williamsburg that i walked into. The food was okay, they have a happy hour that is pretty good. I tried the crispy chicken wings with soy garlic sauce, a mint mojito, and a scallion pancake. The wings were okay. They were crispy but the sauce didn't do it for me. I've had better soy garlic sauce. Also, you can't take the happy hour food to go. It must be eaten in the establishment which is okay. The ambiance was cool. It was a cool mixture of hip hop, pop and R&B. They have a couple tables where you can dine in. The service was just okay. The lady at the counter was busy doing other things each time we approached the counter. So it wasn't the best service. I asked a question about one of the food items and decided against it by the way she described it. It was almost as if we were disturbing her. I hate that feeling. All in all, this place was just okay. I don't think I'll return tho. I'm sure there's better bao buns down Bedford. See pics below

Very average place for dumplings. The xiao long bao wasn't amazing and I wouldn't get it here again. The curry fried rice was also ok. The service was very meh. They got annoyed because we asked for extra utensils/plates which was kinda of off putting and felt kinda cheap.

Mr. bao has been popping up everywhere! And this location is open late so it's perfect for a bite after a night out. Fast service, good amount if seating. Food comes out hot! The buns are chewy and soft as they should be! Check this place out for a quick bite. They also offer takeout on several platforms. My favorite is the duck bao buns. They are so chewy and soft yet a meaty- nice balance.

I've ordered delivery a few times from here & it's always been so good, fresh, and relatively well priced. My personal favorites have been the shrimp dumplings (the dipping sauce is excellent) as well as the scallion pancakes - which are perfectly crispy and chewy. They also get bonus points because they're open late for those wee hour cravings!

Solid Dim Sum available until 2am. I recommend the pork fried dumplings, the shrimp dumplings. The popcorn ship had a great seasoning on it, and the green beans were perfect. Really impressive that they make everything fresh and homemade.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had an appointment in New York and stopped in here before heading to catch my flight back to Texas. I eat a LOT of Asian food, and can solidly recommend Mr Bao! Service was efficient and friendly, the food was amazing (especially the pork XLB), and they had the white peach soda I can't seem to ever find. I can't wait until we come back to New York so I can bring my boyfriend!
So good and the delivery came early! It's one of the few places that offer delivery in this area late at night!
No comment

Here is a photo of the moldy chopsticks I received with my food delivery from Mr Bao today. I obviously didn't eat the food, didn't ask for a refund just glad I saw the chopsticks. Be advised that health inspections haven't been happening regularly after Covid. Be safe out there. I'm not the Yelp reviewer type but this definitely had me

I have gotten about half the menu at this point & it's basically all good. No matter what I get, I always add the steamed soup dumplings & then usually have leftovers of whatever else I got. The braised beef is great & all those bowls have a jammy soy sauce egg that makes everything better.
No comment

Perfect place to get a quick meal before going out! I came here on Saturday night and only had to wait 10 mins for a table. Dumplings were delicious and pork and rice dish was great. Prices are really reasonable! Would def come back

Everything i got hit just right!!! The spicy soup dumplings, shrimp, pork and mushroom dumplings with the Szechuan sauce Â and the popcorn fried chicken. All come with very tasty sauces. Open late. What else you want. Eat it there hot and ready and youll be extra happy
No comment

If you're in the mood for fried food, this is the place to go. We got popcorn chicken, fried calamari, fried dumplings, and more. It all really hit the spot, although I did feel a bit guilty after eating it.
No comment
Great food, the soup dumplings are good, especially Â the pan fried ones. Rice box is nice, highly recommended.
0 stars if I could, made my stomach hurt Â and the beef noodle soup was so bad. Wouldn't recommend
No comment
No comment

I love this place starting off with duck wrap! Omg I can have this every day,very delicious second of all the spicy noodles you have to try it,i usually door dash from here so all I have to do is shake my noodle in the container and bam Â right offf with the spicy ! Hmmm the beef noodle soup love it as well but I wished they had a different type of noodle like glass noodle or a thinner noodle ,the noodles they use are to starchy and get stuck to together when put on the go container,to thick to pick up with chopsticks but over all YUMMy!

Their Braised short rid is fawking Â i got the short rib bowl with rice and garlic cucumber and side of their garlic string beans and damn ! So happy and content, the string beans are perfect never soggy ! Deff a 5 thumbs up and good packaging and sweet staff, sorry i started eating the bowlbefore the pic lol

really wanted a light meal and ordered a vegetable soup. It was super salty and impossible to drink. I have no idea where is the vegetable besides the few pieces floating on top. I paid 5 bucks for this and it is very disappointing.
Been there a once a while back, love all those small plates. Â The place is pretty small with attentive service and good food. I Â will definitely go back for more soup dumplings.

This is one of my favorite Chinese dim sum restaurants in Williamsburg I've ever been to! And I've been all over the world including to China! The Chef Special was phenomenal! Â The soup dumplings were top notch! I'm obsessed with the Chrysanthemum tea too. Kiki, our server was the best. She is so kind and polite. I highly recommend it

Super good place I came here with my friend after we looked around. I love soup dumplings so I got the pork crab soup dumpling it was super good. It's not as the best as compared to the ones I go at China town but still great

This place is totally on point re food and the people who work there are wonderful!! Â I always enjoy the experience whether sitting in or taking out. Â My personal opinion is the vegan spring rolls are tops in the neighborhood!
Amazing. Best soup dumplings in Brooklyn. Had an amazing time, staff is great- I definitely recommend to anyone who is in Brooklyn to try them out
Chef's dumplings, short rib guabao, roasted duck wrap should be on every single order. Don't pay attention to how it looks from the outside, the food is really really tasty.

Ordered take out. I got the create your own - jasmine rice, wild mushroom & salt & pepper shrimp. The shrimp had very good flavor. I was a little surprised by the mushroom. I was expecting something different but overall it still taste good. It reminds me of seaweed.

One and done. With the amount of places that serve dim sum this is not worth another try. Ordered about five different dumplings and a duck appetizer. The duck was oily and the paper wrapping was hard to distinguish. The dumpling fillings were flavorful and definitely worthy of a bit of a yummy praise however the dumpling masa (dough) was so thick and on some so mushy it was unpleasant and inedible. Overall I'd say try any of the many other spots around. (Note: my eats were pre-covid times).
Ordered the dan dan noodles, duck wrap, and soup dumplings-- all absolutely delicious. Can't believe this place doesn't have a 5 star rating! Can't wait to try everything else.

I'm so glad I tried this place again. It's not somewhere I would dine in at, but the food is amazing. I can't get over how good the braised beef was. It was succulent and the flavor was perfect. The smashed cucumbers were also sooo good. I wanted more! I liked the option for Korean style multigrain rice. The duck roll is also awesome. It's super flavorful. I came back just for that. The chicken wings are very crisp fried Korean fried chicken style. My friend raved about the dumplings - he had pork and chive and chicken and cabbage. To me they seem standard. He couldn't tell which was which but was very happy and ate every drop. I do wish the dine in experience was better. It's definitely more of a takeout place. Oh and the customer service was great! I accidentally placed my online order to the Park Slope location, and when I called to cancel they transferred the order for me. They made it nice and easy for me, which I really appreciated. Will be back!
Great fresh food. They forgot to enter one of the dishes but it turned out fine because we were pretty full by dish #3. Would definitely go back again.
Fantastic spicy wontons, hot and sour soup, and duck wrap. Highly recommend late night takeout
Everything was bomb. The Taiwanese fried chicken wrap was my favorite. Love that they're open later than most places these days.
Amazing food and the lady at the register is a Doll .. I love this place .. Williamsburg does have it all

More like Mr WOW! The food is incredible. Just take a look at the picture attached to this review. If that isn't beautiful, idk what is then. I have to say that the meat was so tender, I could just bite it off with my mouth without using utensils. I do not recommend. Less so if you are on a date. But that tells you how good that was. Maybe the rice could have been more on point but everything else was delicious.

The staff is so friendly. All the food is delicious and fresh, been there several times and it has always come out really fast. A great place to go, especially if you're gluten free, they cook many dishes with tamari and the staff is knowledgeable about many allergies.
No comment

I guess this place is part of a chain. Basically Asian fast food. The menu looks good but we found most of it really awful. The fried calamari was so greasy. The Beijing Street noodles were awful, tasteless and gummy store bought noodles. The soup dumplings were edible, but still not recommended. The service is all plastic even if you sit at a table and order from a waiter. You can do so much better in this neighborhood! Vanessa's Dumplings is similar but WAY better. M/Shanghai has much better soup dumplings.

Delivery soup dumplings are kind of a white whale and these are quite, quite good. Â Cue XLB snobs saying they're not good... Yes, I know the holy grail of XLB is typically to get the thinnest skin possible, but I don't really care, and these are not too thick. Also, I'm not going to flushing or the Bao on St Marks every time I want a soup dumpling. Â The crab and pork are delicious, get them. I wasn't a huge fan of the "sandwich" baos (including the duck others seem to like, it was glazed with too much soy/hoisin for me) or the non-soup dumplings. The best chicken dish is the sichuan (but it's not actually, it's American style kung pao/ sesame chicken with a different sauce, which is not very spicy and more sweet). Â I'll try some of the other dishes, but it's called Mr Bao, so, like, I guess start with the baos right?
I ordered fried rice, soup dumplings, a duck roll and shumai. Nothing tasted good. Lacking flavor. The rice was specially plane

Food was amazing and filling. Sorry No pic I Was hungry. I ordered Pork Bao bun was fluffy and pork inside was juicy. I also got Taiwanese fried chicken bowl with vegetable fried rice & green beans delicious. Definitely check this spot out.

Popped in on a whim cause the exterior looked promising. Dumplings were good and I would order the again. However, both the noodle dishes we got(the Dan Dan and Beijing) were flavorless, watery, and the meat was like chopped cat food. Would not return.

This place had the BEST soup dumplings we have ever had. Â The staff was very nice and they got our order together pretty quickly to-go. Â We got those delicious soup dumplings and some shrimp fried rice. Â Both were good (especially the soup dumplings - did I mention that?), and their soy sauce was also uniquely tasty. Â It had a stronger vinegar taste, which we loved. Â We don't typically pour soy sauce into our rice, but we dumped it all over. Â Great spot, great food.. we look forward to coming back.

Kinda disappointing. Nothing we ate was really that good except the duck wrap, which was good but greasy. Even the crab soup dumplings which seemed to be the thing to get were pretty meh. The noodles we got tasted like plain pasta and the memory of them is so bad I just took another star off my rating. 2/5 stars generally, 1/5 for the genre of food.

Cute shop with affordable dumplings! The pork soup dumplings were my absolute favorite! The steamed chicken dumplings were also amazing. Really big portion sizes as well. The bao buns were incredibly fluffy. Would recommend coming with a group so you can share! Come here for a more casual lunch and most important come very hungry.

Fairly new spot. Very cute and cozy. Love the ceiling decor. It was the first thing that caught my attention. Make sure you look up when you enter :). They have both indoor and out door available. The staff was amazing !!! It was my first time there and someone took time to help and explain everything on the menu. The food was delicious. I recommend getting the soup filled dumplings. It was more of an experience eating than anything. I would definitely recommend this location and will be back the next time I'm in the area !!

Love their dumplings! My favorite are the chicken ans cabbage and their pan friend soup dumplings. Great price and texture, the dough is not too thick, good amount of filling. Their bao is perfectly chewy but soft. I've yet to try their noodle or rice bowls but will definitely come back.

We stumbled upon this place while walking in the neighborhood and ordered out. The food is excellent especially the Short Rib and Fried Chicken Bao. The Shumai and Popcorn shrimp deserve an honorable mention. The Dan-Dan noodles were so-so! I would definitely come back here ... either do pick-up or eat-in if I was looking for a casual place to catch-up with a friend.

We ordered Mr Bao for lunch via seamless, and the food was FANTASTIC!!! We ordered the pork soup dumplings, the pan fried shrimp and pork bao, shu mai, the set of 3 baos (pork, beef, vegetable), and the sesame balls. Can I just say, the baos are SO CHEWY and the fillings are so delicious?!? As Chinese/Taiwanese, I'm all about authentic Chinese food. Mr. Bao definitely nailed the authenticity aspect and then more. The taste and texture of every food is so amazing and the looks are beautiful!!! Will definitely come back a lot more!

I'm doing hair around here so I ordered take out. The buns are so good! My favorite one is the duck steamed bun, it tastes good even gets cold, very refreshing. The fried chicken I ordered is not that crispy since it's take out, but still juicy.
Pretty good soup dumplings and reasonable pricing. great addition to the neighborhood.
Great soup dumplings! Can't wait to try other items! Baos are super good and super cute

The bao is really small, and it's underwhelming. The meat is really chewy and the sandwich is barely filled. Seriously a rip off! Not to mention take out took 40 minutes for one bao sandwich. I recommend going to any other place for bao.
The dumplings were quite a surprise, alot better than other dumpling spot in the area.
I ordered Beijing street noodles, it tasted great. They have both indoor and patio available.
I ordered shrimp dumplings, shrimp and pork shumai and vegetarian wrap. Everything was amazing. Delicious and fresh. The staff is very friendly too. Great experience.
No comment
Order delivery for last night, we have crab and pork soup dumpling ,chef's choice dumpling and popcorn chicken every thing is amazing !!! Love the dumplings!

column3: Columbia Street Waterfront District, Brooklyn, NY
column6: Best / most unusual dandan noodles I've ever had! Sitting on Bedford ave is a little unpleasant but there are pandemic times after all.
I like the steamed pork soup dumpling very much. It coming with yummy soup! Amazing and delicious! I also like the fried rice, my favorite food. Also recommend 48 hour Braised galbi beef.
Food was not very good. Everything tasted store bought and microwaved. Server was friendly and they were fast.
omg this place is amazing i love it i'm obsessed w how soft the pork belly is & how crispy the scallion pancake is the portions were amazing i highly recommend
The soup dumplings are great and so was everything else. Keep up the great work! Chicken dumplings were very good and quick delivery and definitely going to order again soon. Noodles were great!
After two hours and a bunch of bullshit excuses from the restaurant, they delivered our order to the wrong address. Thanks for nothing.
love this place , they have best soup dumpling and spicy Dan Dan noodle!!! Â Can not wait for coming back again
five starsï¼ï¼ï¼food is great ï¼ soup dumpling recommend.
The food tasted great and was a good deal for the lunch price, would come again!
Love the garlic string beans and mapo tofu! Great ambiance and service. Highly recommend!
Good food if you like spicy. Very close to traditional Szechuan food. The ambience is nice. Good for a group of friends.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Exceptional flavors! The Mala Hot Pot is a delicious experience. Â The Beef, Shrimp, and Tofu Puffs were outstanding Hot Pot ingredients. Â The other items were also delicious. Â The cocktails were unusual and outstanding. Â The service was attentive. Â The room ambiance is comfortable and a bit "old school".
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Excellent mid-town choice for delicious Chinese in a very chic atmosphere (be sure to make a reservation!). We started with fancy cocktails; the Good Fortune was tasty and not too sweet. The pork soup dumplings were very delicious with thick dough (just as I like it) and a hearty, soupy filling. The dan dan noodles were also exceptional. The snow pea shoots were a must order, and the Shanghai shumai were quite tasty (my friend said it reminded her of her grandmother's dishes from childhood). We also ordered the Szechuan beef, which was so yummy, but also felt very Americanized, which we didn't expect given everything else we ate. Anywho, come enjoy a wonderful meal at Blue Willow!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Heard great things about this place so I wanted to check it out. Not sure what the hype is besides the cool decor, as the food was kind of mediocre. The flavor of the spicy wontons was good, perfect anount of ma and la, but the sesame noodles really lacked flavor and was overly watery. The noodles were also oddly choppy. The shao mai was not bad, the rice was a bit too mushy but the flavor was good. The kung pao chicken was super disappointing though. Super liquidy, wasn't spicy, lacked flavor all around. Service was great though!

Updating my review to reflect the current state of the food. Since the chef changed last year, the same dishes have tasted significantly different. I no longer come back to this restaurant or order delivery from here anymore. It's just not the same. Many dishes are a shadow of their former selves. Previously some dishes were outstanding, but now they are just decent.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Amazing experience! The hospitality and the food both are so so good! I would highly recommend this joint for authentic Sichuan cuisine.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Elegantly decorated in 1920s style, the atmosphere in this Chinese restaurant and bar really sets it apart in the midtown area. The staff are super helpful with the menu and proactive in topping up your water glasses. Definitely recommend the mala dry pots if it's your first time here. Choose 4-8 different items to be cooked into the pot with Chinese spices and sauces. Keep in mind the portions are large and very filling.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I came here Friday the place was nice and the atmosphere was good. The food was excellent and very flavorful, however, Im giving this place 3 stars because couldn't enjoy my food due to the table they sat us at that had the vent with cold air hitting our food. Â We sat and had to wait 5min to be helped mins you it was busy. Â The food came quick Â after ordering which I was surprised. Obviously the food came out hot and I Kid you not within a min my soup and other food was already cold due to that vent. It was not busy at at all and plenty of open seats but nobody came by to attend when I was trying to be asked to be seated somewhere else.
No comment
No comment

To honor and celebrate Lunar new year, we made a reservation at the highly popular Blue Willow. Â It was a refreshing take on a Chinese restaurant in NY, which rarely boast nice ambiance AND food quality (unless you go high-end). Â  Although we had a reservation, Â we had to wait for 15 min to get seated. Â The restaurant was filled to its capacity and most guests were Asian (good sign!). Â Overall we enjoyed our dinner except the chicken dish (I want to say it was vinegar chicken or something like that), which had flavors that we did not find good. Â Green beans are a must try - delicious! Â Dumplings were decent but not as good as Joe's. Â It's probably worth coming back to and try few other items.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Delicious dishes touching close to home, amazing staff, gorgeous interior! Great Szechuan style dishes.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I got takeout from here tonight for dinner, and it definitely filled my Chinese food craving. We ordered the general Tso's chicken, the Szechuan beef, the garlic string beans, the Dan Dan noodles, and some hot and sour soup. The favorite was definitely the green beans but the meat dishes were good too! We were not fans of the noodles as they did not have enough sauce and left too strong of a sesame aftertaste, but everything else was good!

When most everyone there is Asian you know it's going to be good. Great flavor, generous portion sizes and not too sauced. Very glad we stopped into this authentic place. Attentive service and dark enough decor to feel you were eating alone yet in a busy restaurant.
No comment

A hidden gem. Â A place where you will get the closest to authentic cousins. Â We got several dishes (including cow intestines) which one would shy away from, but we went all-in and they did not disappoint.
No comment
No comment

This restaurant has a very nice ambiance with rich, dark colors and old pictures of what looks like Chinese nobility on the walls -- maybe something like what I'd imagine a high-end opium den to be like. Upon entering we were asked if we could keep it to two hours which we found humorous and easily agreed to. The food came out shortly after ordering. For appetizers, we had Dan Dan noodles which were very tasty and sweet and sour ribs which came up short and I would not recommend. The Peking duck and Szechuan beef were both good dishes but what was really exceptional were the garlic green beans! If you're wanting Chinese and happen to be in this area of midtown just south of Central Park definitely consider Blue Willow. I would definitely return but it's not necessarily a place I would frequent.
No comment
Great menu and great prices. I went with a bunch of friends, service was great and would definitely book again.

Vibes, food, service all 10/10. First time coming here and I absolutely loved it. Everything was authentically spicey (which I love) but there are also many options to try if you can't handle spice. I espicially loved the fish, which was so tender and came with so many veggies. Overall, great experience, would come again.

Really enjoyed the dinner here. We came with a group and did family style so we could try more items on the menu. The restaurant had really cool vintage looking chinese decor, they had long tables that were great for groups and there is outdoor seating available. The service was great and the food came out pretty quickly. I will definitely be back for the flavorful string beans, garlic egg plant, chairman maos braised pork belly (don't forget the rice) and the Peking duck!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Very good food lots of spice and flavor. Went for lunch food came out super fast and service was really good. Wife had Changsha spiced chicken and fried rice really good flavor on the chicken. I had garlic sauced pork belly and their chicken wings, very garlicky was very good but the garlic will stick with you for quite awhile, truly for the garlic lovers out there. Dark atmosphere very but very comfortable. Overall a very good experience.
No comment

If you want satisfying Szechuan food, this is a great place to go to. I got several recommendations for this place before I went and can understand the rave. I ordered their mapo tofu, dan dan noodles, garlic eggplant, soup dumplings, and shu mai. I would rank my favorite dishes in that order. I loved the flavor of the dan dan noodles with the perfect blend of peppercorn and nuttiness. The only part that could have been better is the moistness of the noodle+sauce blend. It was a bit dry. The interior design is pretty cool too. It has a retro style with a blue themed background throughout the place. It's a great place for groups to share food in family style. If you're going for lunch, one tip is to reserve for an earlier time when they just open up so that you can avoid the crowd.
No comment
No comment
No comment

As there are many Chinese restaurants located all over NYC, we decided to try Blue Willow as it had many great ratings. The food was prepared very quickly, especially for a Friday night, however it did not live up to its expectations. The food was good but not great. Portions were small as well. We Â ordered Hunan Stir Fried Noodles with chicken which had dry doubanjiang paste. Wish there was more sauce incorporated on the noodles. Kung Pao Chicken served with peanuts, peppercorn and chili peppers, however this did not pack any heat. The best dish was the Garlic Sauced Chicken however there were way too many water chestnuts. Overall the restaurant was mediocre and bland.
No comment

Fantastic spot to come large or small groups. The food is phenomenal and they have a cozy environment. Service was good and the food came out fast. The fish is a big winner as well as the pork. Definitely coming back!
No comment
No comment

Girl, get your booty to this gem of a Chinese bistro. It's spicy, and so is the food! Eddie, the bartender, is beyond. He is so passionate and mixed us a chrysanthemum cocktail with chrysanthemum ice cubes! For real. We got wood ear Â mushrooms and it was great and tangy - ya hear! Also ordered delicious lotus root with rice - my favorite. Grandmas rice noodles were ok - little spicy for my taste. Get going and sit at the bar. Pray that Eddie is there that night because he is EVERYTHING!
The eggplant and thousand-year eggs dish is soooo amazing! You gotta give it a try. The waiters mix the ingredients in front of you which is really fun to watch.
No comment

Hidden tucked away gem in a more touristy part of Manhattan. I stopped by on a whim as I was running errands on 5th Ave and was pleasantly surprised with my food and experience. Northern Hunan style food in a space that is a refuge from the craziness of Midtown - can't complain.
No comment
No comment
Food is quite good, I wish spicy dishes can be a bit more spicy! I don't eat too spicy, but the kick is missing. But flavors are all good :)
No comment
No comment

Out of all the mid-scale, modern Chinese restaurants in the city (including Ye's Apothecary, Cafe China, Chili, Cheli, Szechuan Mountain House, etc), this one might be my favorite. I absolutely loved the Xiang River Fish, and the portion is great for sharing. The drinks here are amazing as well, not overly sweet but also really unique. I also really enjoyed the Braised Pork, it was perfectly sweet and salty. Definitely want to make a reservation ahead of time as this place gets packed!
No comment
No comment

My sister and I went for lunch here during the weekday. The place is dark and cozy, I personally loved the ambiance. We ordered the Bang Bang chicken, dan dan noodles and farmhouse pork belly. Everything came very quickly and was appetizing. There was some sort of numbing ingredient in one of the dishes maybe the dan dan. It was a unique taste.
No comment

I thought Blue Willow was just alright. Sure, the interior is awesome and really cool seating spaces + fancy bar but the food we had were just average. The mapo tofu and the mala dry pot were just spicy instead of the "ma" flavor. The best thing I had from the meal was the qipao drink - maybe it would have a been a difference experience to come here for drinks only. In terms of just Chinese food, there are much better options in the city.
No comment

What a pleasant Sunday afternoon delight in the heart of Midtown. We had three dishes- soup dumplings, sautÃ©ed spinach with garlic, pork belly. It was all delicious. Plus lots of drinks ! The severs were attentive & courteous. Humming conversations. Soft music in the background. An excellent spot for family & friends. Loved it. Try it & tell me how you like it.
No comment

Blue Willow is a popular Hunan restaurant on West 56th Street. The food is very good and for the most part spicy. Hunan cuisine is generally spicy and Blue Willow does not disappoint. Even the cold sesame noodles, generally not a spicy dish, are spicy at Blue Willow. All the food is very good and well worth the trip to Midtown.
No comment
No comment
Fancy Chinese restaurant. Â Shredded beef was my favorite out of the 10 or so dishes I tried.

Amazing location with great 20th century old china town vibes. Dining room had great energy and aesthetic. However food and service was lacking. Out of the 4 items we ordered only liked two. Hard pass on the Chengdu noodles and must try the Chengdu spicy dumplings!

Came here on a Friday night around 9 pm based on our friends recommendation. Food was excellent. We ordered scallion pancakes, veggie dumplings, garlic green beans, cucumber salad, and my friends also got the salt and pepper prawns and beef noodle. We also got the pea sprouts. Everything was delicious! Service was not the greatest but the restaurant closed at 10 so we did feel a bit rushed. But overall I'd come back and really enjoyed the meal!

Food tastes ok but kind of pricy. For the roast duck, they only give 5 pieces of the wraps. If you want more, you need to pay. The waitress claimed no matter how many people in a group, they only give 5 pieces. That is so not reasonable in my opinion.

The smell alone is amazing. Such a cute outside area that you can even utilize in the winter (just bundle up). The food is amazing. Great quality and great portions. Warning: if it says spicy, they mean spicy! Order accordingly. Wide variety of drink specials, as well. Totally recommend.

Great date spot, the theme was 1920s, very nice decor and and felt like I was transported. The staff were very attentive and wait time for our food to come out was about 10 minutes. The food was good along with the presentation. However their Peking duck was average. I would come back to try more dishes from their menu.
Delicious food! I have three meals here in three days. So I have the chance to try different food on the menu. All the choices are good. And it is very easy to make the reservation. Like this place.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Amostphere had a nice touch of welcome. Comfort food and the drinks were spot on. I highly recommend.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great food and atmosphere. We were so impressed with the whole experience. Get reservations

The vibes here are impeccable. There's a constant chatter as it gets pretty busy even on a Thursday night-- reservations are highly recommended. The menu is labeled well with vegan options, and there is quite a selection of drinks. I highly recommend the cold sesame noodles, which were the perfect amount of sauce, and great nutty sweet salty flavor. They're a tiny bit spicy which added to the whole flavor profile without being painful. :) The home style tofu casserole dish is basically stewed tofu, with some bell peppers in a savory thick soy sauce base. There are shishito peppers, red bell pepper, and the fried tofu, with a generous amount of thick cut scallion. Very yummy. Presentation made it look and taste really nice but I can see it being a super comforting take out dish too. The chrysanthemum ice tea is also super refreshing and not the perfect amount of sweetness. Definitely worth a try if you're in the area and want that kind of vibey sophisticated atmosphere with nice Chinese food.
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here with a group of 10 we got a private room. The food was delicious! Everything I tried was great! We were so hungry we forgot to take pics. But We tried the Szechuan crispy beef, pork soup dumplings, chicken fried rice, yellow beef, and the spicy beef skewers. Everything was so good! The only thing I did not like was my cocktail I got the mid summer. It tasted like canada dry and ice water. Very watered down barely any alcohol and i did not taste the grapefruit. My friend said the same thing about his drink. We all agreed to come back but def don't get the alcoholic beverages here. Also we had a room by the window and it was absolutely freezing in that room. No heat! Â It was below freezing outside and we could still feel it although sitting inside! Food came fast!! Service was great. Overall loved the experience.
No comment

Pretty good dishes with nice atmosphere and aesthetic interior. Everything we ordered was very good, but the portion is a bit small and pricey. But that's most chinese restaurants in Midtown so it could be overlooked considering other spots in the neighborhood. Good for bringing big groups or family, or even a date night!

Really superb and well-executed dishes. Loved the Szechuan beef, garlic string beans, Hunan noodles and fried pork dumplings. Service was superb: we had six piping hot dishes on our table within ten minutes of ordering. Great vibe as well. Would absolutely return.
Amazing lunch. Â Even my picky teenage son said it was the best food! Â Quick service, and very attentive staff. Â We will definitely be back!
No comment
This is probably the best Szechuan Restaurant in the city. If I was on death row, this would be my last meal request.
Very good food. I would recommend. The service was top notch and i've never had szechuan food this good before
No comment

No comment
The service was wonderful, beautiful ambiance. Great food and Drink. They really deliver a memorable experience.
Middling Chinese food with standard entrees that have decent flavor but poor portion size for its upper-eschelon price tag. $18 a dish. 3.25/5 stars as a dinner spot.

Had a really excellent family dinner here to celebrate a birthday. The restaurant is somewhat tight space-wise, but has two floors (and a heated outdoor area) and so is able to accommodate larger groups (we did have a reservation). The service was pretty good, it took a while to take our initial order but after that the food and drinks came out in good time! The group ordered an assortment of noodle/vegetable/meat dishes and no one had any complaints - it was nice to have multiple vegetarian options at a szechuan place, that can sometimes be tough to find. The cocktails were all also excellent, with unique flavor options. We aren't around often but I would be thrilled to return.
No comment

The ambiance of the restaurant really screams 1980s. It feels like a Time Machine into the past in the best of ways. Beyond this, the food was amazing and the service backed it up. I will be coming back
No comment
No comment
No comment
Outstanding!! The food was delicious, authentic and fast service. I recommend start with the small plates, then split a larger meal for entree.

Great decor and good food. Â The home style tofu wa different than others I've had and delicious. Â Eggplant and string beans were not too greasy. Â The dumplings were a bit doughy though. Â Expensive for what it is but great ambiance and service.

Food was amazing!! We ordered peking duck, garlic string beans, and the qing hua jiao fish. Everything was delicious, but I will say we were not too full by the end of the meal. Sadly the fish dish did not have much fish inside and was mostly bean sprouts/vegetables. For being $32, I expected some more. Aside from that, I loved it here and definitely want to come back to try their other dishes!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I stumbled on Blue Willow while in the city. It wasn't bad. This was my first time having Szechuan style food. I enjoyed the atmosphere and the bat tender was nice and attentive. I have the Szechuan beef and noodles. The noodles had too much of a peanut sauce taste for me so I wouldn't order again. I didn't want rice so that's why I ordered the noodles. The Szechuan beef was great, just keep it mind it does not come with anything. If you want rice you need to order al la carte. I had a drink, the Remedy which wasn't bad. I like anything with ginger and it had ginger in it so it was a win for me. Good service and well prepared food and drinks.
Excellent Chinese food !!!! Â General tsao chicken Â or fried pork dumplings are a blast!
No comment

Very good and authentic food. A bit pricier but good quality and size. The scallion pancakes were some of the best I've ever had. It was so light and crispy and flavorful. The cucumber salad was good flavor but very spicy. I would consider myself to have a pretty decent spice tolerance and it was a bit spicy for me. We also got shumai which was delicious!! and soup dumplings which were pretty standard.
Amazing cocktails and superb service!! The decor and feel is a chill vibe for a good dinner with friends. Can't wait to come back! Rey, our bartender, is lit
No comment

Upscale Chinese food that is delicious. We ordered Peking duck, sautÃ©ed cabbage, salted egg tofu, mala dry pot, hot and sour soup and Dan Dan noodles for 4 people. Everything with delicious. Only gripe I have with the food is that the Dan Dan noodles were over cooked and was sticking together. Â Also to note, hot and sour soup was more sour than hot. I personally prefer spicier.

The atmosphere takes you back to the chic solitaire Shanghai back in the old days. It's mysterious, fantastic and tranquil. The food is absolutely the best and the serving is fast! It's a lovely place for dates, meetups, and social hangouts. There is even a purple tea with a very beautiful name!
No comment
No comment

We were craving Chinese food and Blue Willow was around the corner. We quickly decided to make a reservation (based on the great reviews) and we weren't disappointed! Great ambience, delicious food and good service! Was quite busy so make sure to reserve a table!

Blue Willow restored my faith in Manhattan dining. After three nights of over-hyped, over-priced, and poorly serviced meals, Blue Willow reminded me that the city is filled with authentic experiences - you just have to try a little harder now to find them. The vibe and aesthetic here is perfect. Smiles abound - as if they were privileged to host us. The food was outstanding. We had several dumplings, Grandmas Noodles, cauliflower stir fried (with pork belly). Each were scrumptious. Sooooo flavorful. We had a lovely pot of tea too. The music was hip Chinese smooth jazz/lounge. Conversation was lively. And the validation that you must go here: 80% of the patrons appeared to be of Asian dissent. My next trip to Manhattan will involve an intentional and purposeful visit here.
Very good Chinese / Sichuan food. Has water spinach on the menu which you don't see everyday. Highly recommended.
Really enjoyed this place. Â  I had hot and sour soup and the yellow beef entree. Â It was quite spicy and delicious. Â Wish it came with rice but that had to be ordered separate.

No comment
TOO GOOD!! Great music! Great drink! Try the Good fortune if you enjoy a fruity yet strong drink

Nice decoration restaurant, bring you back to vintage Chinese style, lots of options for food, I like salt and pepper prawns and braised pork. They are tasty but a bit small portion compared to the price.

We enjoyed the food at Blue Willow, so we decided to order some food to go. Everything was delicious, from the wontons to the hot and sour soup. Originally, we wanted the snow pea sprouts, but they were all out of them, so we had the option of ordering the spinach with garlic. But, when my family and I were eating half way through the spinach with garlic, we found a piece of plastic wrap inside the spinach. Next time, please have more caution with the to-go orders.

I stumbled upon Blue willow by chance one afternoon and had one of the most tastiest dishes Ive had in while. the Changsha Chicken with chilis and cashews was soon good. I ordered a tea as well and was pleasantly delighted by it. I would for sure recommend this to anyone this is looking for Sichuan food. Ill be back to try the other dishes on the menu.
Excellent Szechuan, and cocktails. The bar is a great place to grab one of the signature cocktails or a beer. The staff is really kind and service is quick but not rushed. The music is also on point!

No comment
Great food, great music, and great ambience! I highly recommend this place for lunch or dinner.
No comment
Great service, incredible food, I missed the rice noodles so much after coming to America. I was so excited that I could find such a authentic restaurant in the middle of Brooklyn

Yes place is top-notch and an ideal place to go for quality Chinese food with a authentic flair. Strongly suggest trying some of the less American and more traditional dishes will be happy you did. We had a private room keep in mind you have to spend $300 or more to be able to have this room reserved. It was very nice having to private space to be able to talk and catch up with eight old friends!
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

I came here while visiting New York City for 1 day and the food was delicious! We did not have a reservation, but we were able to get a seat within 10 minutes around 6pm on a Sunday night. I'm from Texas, so I might not be the best judge, but this was easily the best Chinese food i've every had! I highly recommend this place.
The food is delicious. You can't really go wrong. I've eaten here two or three times and it is a staple.

4.5 stars! Pleasantly surprised by Blue Willow! I always pass by it during my treks to 5th Ave and usually notice small crowds by the restaurant. So, I decided to check it out with my family and friends. The interior is very beautiful, almost reminds me of Old 1950s Shanghai. As for the food, my favorites were the mapo tofu, red pork belly, and the green bean eggplant. Everything tasted very fresh and the fish and meat were tender. The spice level was also very tolerable. Overall, very happy about my experience here and looking forward to coming back!
Really enjoyed the food ! Highly recommend the mountain fish and century egg! So good! And the remedy cocktail!

The food came out before the drinks and were just as cold. Their first excuse was that it was hot food on cold plates. Why would any restaurant use cold plates. Their second excuse was that they're busy. We didnt ask the food to come out in 3 minutes from ordering it.
No comment

4.5/5 stars. Service was quick and attentive without being overbearing. We ordered the pork belly, beef noodle, and chili wontons. The noodles were super chewy and had a good balance of spice. The pork belly wasn't super fatty and paired well right white rice. The wontons had a bit too much skin for me but the flavors were great. Would come back!
No comment

We had a reservation for 8pm - the host directed us to a table upstairs in the corner under a chilly vent. The servers ignored us for over 30 minutes despite our multiple attempts to get their attention to order food. we ended up ordering our food around 8:40. food itself was decent in quality but I was annoyed at the service especially given that we were there to celebrate an occasion and had a reservation.
Wow! Came here with friends for a birthday. This may be the best schezuan restaurant in NYC. Service is great. They even gave us a free shot! Food tastes amazing! Will definitely be back!

I understand that we are suffering the inflation problem now but this cost 17 dollar?! I finished string bean and meat within one bite. Seriously?
No comment

Went here after a trip to the Met. Delicious food. Ordered garlic eggplant, mapo tofu, and peking duck. Very delicious but the duck skin was not as crispy as I would've liked. Overall solid vibe- got to sit at the bar and very much enjoyed watching the bartender mix drinks. I ordered the Empress Wu which was beautiful and yummy!

This place is still figuring it out. First off, their Resy system is messed up and they take reservations they can't honor. We had to wait 30 minutes for ours, which is ridiculous because the whole point of the reservation is that you don't have a wait that's 20+ minutes long. They're also understaffed, but that's a common problem these days. Finally, the food is alright. The snow pea sprouts were absolutely delicious, but everything else (chili oil beef, eggplant, etc.) was just fine. Drinks came after our food. Overall, not really worth the wait and if I'd known before that the wait would be long and the food just above average, I would have skipped.
Traditional Chinese aesthetic and decor. The dishes were delicious and all had a nice touch of spice. If you love spicy food I would recommend.
No comment
No comment

We recently celebrated my husband's birthday at Blue Willow with a group of friends, and it was such an exceptional experience. The restaurant is modern and beautifully decorated, and we were lucky to be seated in a private area in the back even though we didn't request it. The food was excellent. A solid mix of traditional Szechuan with a creative twist, and it was all very well executed and flavorful. I particularly loved the Blue Willow fish (we got the sea bass), the Peking duck, and the snow pea sprouts. They have decent vegetarian options as well and accommodated my vegetarian friend who wanted to swap out meat with tofu in one of the dishes. The staff members were pleasant and friendly and I appreciated that they were forthcoming with recommendations that they personally preferred since none of us had been there before. I would definitely recommend it for a fun group outing or date night and hope to return soon.
Really cool vibe, great service and delicious food! The hot and sour soup was incredible - the best I've had!
So delicious. Love to visit this type of Chinese style restaurant with friends and go all in family style.
No comment
No comment
Great Chinese place, very authentic food. The dry pots are delicious and you can choose the level of spiciness you want. Their lychee ice cream is also bomb!

Went here for a birthday party with a lot of friends. The food was pretty quick. Also many of the options for customers to select. My favorite was the Mapo Tofu. I think the food was very tasty with the mix of spice and everything
Really really good. 120% recommend to come back for the water especially. Best water in NYC

I came here for an early dinner on a Friday afternoon with my family. This is probably the most popular Chinese restaurant on the block. I was excited to try this place since they have Hunanese dishes and I'm from Hunan. We ordered Miss Lou's Famous Beef Stew, Mountain Baked Fish, and the Stir Fried Eggplant & String Beans. It was a lot of food since the portions were large. The best dish was Miss Lou's Famous Beef Stew since it's a Hunanese dish not found in most Chinese restaurants. It's a hot and sour soup with thinly sliced beef, mushrooms, and noodles. There was a lot of ingredients and the broth was flavorful. The Mountain Baked Fish was okay but not much fish. There was definitely a lot of vegetables though (tofu skin, lotus root, bean sprouts). The Stir Fried Eggplant & String Beans was good too, very garlicky. Service was fast and friendly. I would come back and try other dishes. It's a bit pricey but the portions were large, lunch is definitely a better deal.
General Tso's Chicken was deliciously crispy and the string beans with pork were amazing.
No comment
The food is solid. Does it make me ecstatic? Not so much, but the flavor is consistent and significantly downplayed from your typical Szechuan cuisine im used to.
No comment

Found this as a happy accident our first night visiting NYC. Great food and great service. It was busy and we walked in, but were able to sit at the bar. My husband got the pork belly and rice and loved it. This was the place we talked about going back to. I had the wonton soup and shrimp shumai.

How did this place get so many stars?!? Maybe my meal was off, but we got delivery and the meal was disgusting. The kung pao chicken was a bright pink (shown in photo and even brighter pink in real life ), really off and meat was grossly chewy. We also got the lo mein, which was super stale like it was someone's leftovers microwaved three times over (see photo, though again, doesn't depict how inedible it was). In sum, the food definitely was not what was expected from the price and claims of authenticity. More like what you'd expect from a low-ranking, fast food Chinese joint.
Service beyond compare, Cherri was beyond great. This high end cuisine , no " mombo sauce ". Put it on your list and don't ruin it with social media post. Lol
Came here for New Years with my friends at a private table. Service was incredibly speedy and food was DELICIOUS. Highly recommend!!!
Very delicious sichuan food. Great ambience. Other places may be slightly more authentic though. Loved the bar vibes and the music. Super unique spot and great menu options. Love!

One of the best Chinese restaurants that I have been to in NYC. Â Everything is made for sharing, so it's best to come with a group of 4-8 people. Â The soup dumplings and scallion pancakes were excellent. Â The real treat was the garlic sauced pork. Â It was cooked perfectly and had tremendous flavor. Â The chicken ginseng soup was good, but I look forward to trying the beef soup. Â I highly recommend this restaurant and I look forward to coming back in the future.
Food was delicious and the service was great. We had a big party and they gave us our own private room.
No comment
No comment

Ordered a number of dishes but the dishes that stood out to me were the Qing Hua Jiao Fish and the Changsha Spiced Chicken. Super flavorful and addicting! I enjoyed both and was the perfect complement to jasmine white rice.

This place was just wonderful. From beginning to end blue willow showed my family great hospitality and service (our servers name was terry & he was super helpful and courteous) We had some delicious dishes, including S&P squid and shrimp, both of which I recommend. We had both fried and steamed dumplings and scallion pancake (fried is always better and scallion pancake was crispy and tasty) other dishes which we had which I highly suggest are the bass steamed w/ ginger and scallion, the crispy schezuan beef (probably one of the best dishes we had), chives w minced pork. Cocktails are a must if you live creative mixed drinks. All in all I look forward to going back and trying this place again.
Literally one of my fav places, the food and vibes are everything! The gin tonics are so good
No comment

I never trust any Asian restaurant located in an area other than their natural habitat, if you know what I mean. Greeted and led to our table. The place was dimly lit, quiet and with customers that aren't the typical. We ordered several dishes. All are perfectly cooked, seasoned well. They came out from the kitchen really fast! I was amazed. The price is as expected being in the hub of midtown. I told myself that I'm gonna bring my friends in again after this visit but without reservation in a Jan 2 afternoon we were turned down! Â So, we went to K-town instead. Oh well.. Anyway, I enjoyed the ambience, food and company. Staff is very cordial and snappy!

Delicious! Definitely get the dry pot, it's a large serving and even if you select just five items it's enough for two. Vegan version of Mapo Tofu was also very good, I didn't feel like anything was missing by it being vegan. I was hoping for a softer, more moist white rice but that might just be a matter of preference - still a five star rating, honestly even if just for the dry pot.

The food was really tasty but the best part of this restaurant was the ambience of the space and the great service. We came in a party of around 15 and had a great dining experience--would come here again!
No comment
Ordered the string beans, pork belly, steamed egg & a whole fish. Everything was delicious and loved the ambiance!

One of my favorite restaurants in NYC. All the servers were attentive and amazing. Terry was so nice and service was fantastic. Took my parents here and they loved the pork soup dumplings. If you like spice try the Yellow Beef. I'm a regular for the mapo tofu here. So good! Xiang River Fish was steamed to perfection and flavorful. Highly recommend!

I was excited to try this place but was sadly disappointed. It was buzzing for a Tuesday night. Decor has a retro vibe of a Shanghai speakeasy. We had Beef Brine Noodles Chengdu Spicy Wontons crispy shredded beef and fried rice with chicken . Â Fried rice was our favorite. The wet noodles with bits of beef were a soggy mess and bland. Â Crispy beef was definitely crispy with a sticky sweet sauce. Beef was chewy and had an unpleasant fryer oil aftertaste. Â Spicy wontons were ok. The chili crisp was good and spicy but the wontons themselves had almost no filling which was disappointing. Â We also had pan fried dumplings with pork to start . Were ok but ultimately forgettable. Â Lastly , service was lacking despite staff dashing to expedite food. No one proactively refilled water or took away dishes until we asked .
5 star vibes, 3 star food and service. Inordinate amount of dried chilis in my chicken dish.

Was really craving some Sichuan last night. The decor and aesthetics here were so great! We ordered the husband wife special, mapo tofu and the yellow beef. The food was very tasty! I thought the yellow beef was a bit too salty for me, but still had great flavor to it! The service was very speedy! My favorite was definitely the mapo tofu! I'll be back soon!

No comment

Really good Chinese food! I was super impressed by their food options! You can easily eat here as a vegetarian or someone who has a restrictive diet. The cabbage, bang bang noodles were great, chicken, and drinks were good. Everything was beautifully plated and aesthetically pleasing to the eye. Very well done! Would definitely come here again.

Food was delicious. Highly recommend the mapo tofu! Even the drinks were well made. I have to give 4 stars though due to slow service. Despite making reservations for 2:30pm my party had to wait 5-10min to be seated. Then when when we were finally ready to order around 2:50pm for the lunch special the waitress didn't come by until 3:02pm (and we had to wave her down) to which she then told us "sorry no more lunch special it ended at 3pm". I mean cmon by 2min and we were ready to order long before. We tried to reason with her but she explained that the the system they use on their iPads automatically prohibit them from giving out the lunch special at 3pm. It's a little ridiculous imo and they should give some leeway to customers, especially in these situations when customers were on time for the lunch special.

Check in for a sweet, soothing chrysanthemum tea! We got a cocktail each and got an app and mala hot pot (5 ingredients). I would say it's what you expect when it comes to szezhuan dry hotpot... also the cocktails are strong and pretty decent.
If you check in on yelp, you get a free chrysanthemum ice tea. Food was good and great service. Would come back again!

The signage outside the building is modest, but when you enter Blue Willow you are transformed from the bustling NYC streets to a calm, cozy space meant to bring people together. The menu seemed like a novel, page after page jam-packed with appetizing choices. The 7 of us decided on 8-10 dishes that came out promptly. The food was delectable and filling. The staff certainly seemed to care about their service. Would recommend this space for larger parties. The party rooms seemed so elegant.
Great food, great vibes, great drinks. Even better experience. Just remember to take it easy on the spice.
No comment
Drinks so good, try the good fortune. Amazing service and ambiance, good music. seasoned.
No comment
No comment

Make reservations. Hipster vibe with Chinese food. One of the best I've tasted. Right amount of flavor and kick. Great service and nice ambiance. Outside seating Â available. They check for vax status.
best dry pot I've had in the neighborhood :) good atmosphere great for dates !!!!!!!!
Perfect place for any size of gathering! Really loved mapo tofu and dimsum from there. Great hospitality and neat restaurant

Just had dinner, Terry served us, he was awesome and made really good recommendations. Â Absolutely LOVED the century egg, but if you're not that adventurous, literally everything is good. Â The appetizer wings, yellow beef, soup dumplings, salt n pepper shrimp, all amazing.
No comment
No comment
Excellent food at sort of high prices! Service was mediocre. Located in Manhattan on a busy street.

Very cool, old-timey vibe. Definitely authentic Chinese food. I particularly enjoyed the double cooked pork, spicy/sour fatty beef broth, and whole tilapia, but honestly everything was delicious. They also have some really good cocktails! My favorite is the Good Fortune. The portion sizes are a bit small for the price, but other than that, no complaints.
No comment
Best Soup Dumplings in town! We bring everyone that visits here. And don't even get me started on those Spicy Lady drinks. We love them, must go-to, you won't regret it!
No comment

This place is incredible from the moment you walk in! The decor is nice, the vibe of the restaurant is lively, the tea was on point, and the food was truly amazing! I had the garlic green beans which was the best I've ever had in my life. I then had the ginger steamed bass which was also flavorful. No complaints in anyway, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!
No comment

We ate there based on yelp reviews and we were not disappointed! The soup pork buns were crazy good!! And so was the gluten free Grandmas soup was incredible. The shrimp fried rice was solid, and the green beans were everyone's favorite. I will definitely eat here again.

Just awesome! Spicy and flavorful Chinese cuisine as can only truly be had on one of the coasts! Cool old-world ambience and crowd that knows and appreciates great Chinese food. Service was knowledgeable, attentive and on point. Double cooked pork, Hunan noodles, garlic green beans, fried dumplings and spicy garlic prawns were all excellent. Highly recommend!
No comment
Chengdu spicy wontons and pickled pepper chicken were highlights. Fun drink selection and a wide variety of options.

This was a really great restaurant in midtown Manhattan. If you need a quick bite and quick drink this is the perfect place to stop by at. If you're a bourbon fan I recommend the good fortune. Service was great our waiter was quick and gave great recommendations.

Blue Willow's the type of place you walk into and you feel like you've time traveled. I wasn't expecting much since there are so many Szechuan places around town but the decor is amazing and the service is fantastic. Portion wise I don't think any other spot in town can beat the sizes here - you will be full after coming here and leave with a happy and filled tummy! Highly recommend!

The 1st time we ate at Blue WIllow the food was of high quality, Â the service excellent, but the spice level was off the charts. We had to send back the ultra hot sesame noodles and the restaurant adjusted the rest Â of our meal. Yesterday we took out dinner and as we ordered we stressed extra mild. Well, the food traveled well and heated up perfectly. The beef and chicken dishes were great and enough to have a second dinner tonight. Â If you are looking for high quality Chinese food and at very fair prices, go to Blue WIllow.
No comment
Service was excellent. The waiters were very attentive. A wide selection of food. Ambiance is very nice as well.
No comment
No comment
So good! Recommend sitting inside though as the outside isn't as aesthetically pleasing/didn't see any heaters

Super good, super fast and super affordable! I got the free tea that you get for checking in but I found it way too sweet. The actual food though was so good. The noodles had a good kick to them and the calamari was addicting. I would definitely go again. Nice interior decor as well
No comment
No comment

For the location, this might be one of the better option for Asian food around the area if you can't go to Flushing. We made a reservation for a table of 10 people. It would have been nice to know ahead of time that they require a minimum spending. You may want to confirm with them before booking a rsvp. For a group if 10, they required spending minimum $350. In the end, it came out about $35 per person which wasn't bad. But it's good to know still. The decor was great. I love the Shanghai vibes it gives out. We were able to get our own table that's more private. Food came out super fast. Some food were not good and those are usually the super fast ones that come out. The steam dumpling definitely taste like it's been sitting out a bit and reheated. Part of the dumpling skin tasted dry. The fried dumpling taste better because it was skillet on the bottom and came out warmer. I wouldn't get the ginger chicken. That one just doesn't taste good. But for their better food, you need to order the dishes that require preparation. One of their better dish is the dry pot where you can customize the meat and vegetables. It's still on the saltier side but definitely one of their better dishes. Their vegetable dishes such as fried green bean and the snow pea leaves were delicious. I was impressed by the snow pea leaves as it was fresh and taste really good. You'll need some veggies as the meat dishes may all be a bit salty. Actually, I think most of the vegetables dishes taste pretty good. The chicken soup was pretty good. The other good dish is probably the Peking duck. They don't have the bao for the wrap. Instead, they have the thin mushu wrap. But still, that one was one of the better dish to get. The beef skewers doesn't taste like beef. I think the meat is tenderized and tasted like fatty pork but others thought it was fish. No one in the table ordered it and everyone guess wrong. The beef in chili oil isn't prepared in traditional way, but still pretty good. The seafood fried rice was actually pretty good too. Our waiter, Terry, Â was very helpful and friendly. He helped accommodate our requests and had lots of patiences with it large group. Overall, I think this was still a pretty decent place for food especially when you're trying to accommodate such a large group for dinner. Just make sure you order the right dishes.
No comment
No comment
Delicious spot with great vibes. The food is 1000% on point & the soundtrack was DOOOPE while I was there. Friendly staff in an intimate space. Make sure to gett a rezzo on weekends.
No comment
No comment

I got delivery from here and tried the miso soup and garlic sauced chicken. Â The hot and sour soup came in a large container and was plenty for more than 2 people. Â The chicken was flavorful and garlicky and came with broccoli and water chestnuts. Â I don't like that they charged for rice as rice normally comes with the dish, but other than that I really liked the food.
Amazing...that's all I have to say. We went twice on a 4 day trips it was so good. Even our 14 year old and 6 year old sons loved it and begged to go back.

Was looking to try this place for a while, and it was worth it. A+. The food is amazing, and the drinks are great too. The service also was top notch. Nam took care of our party of 10 with ease. Definitely will be coming back.
Don't order the Peking duck, too much fat and not good tasting. Small and tight seating, about average service.
Pretty good! Expensive, but great for a date or a night out with friends! Sweet waitstaff.

To be honest I was too hungry and the food was too good I forgot to take pictures. But the environment was authentic and quaint. While busy the service was amazing. The spicy wontons were AMAZING as was the chicken skewers. We loved the fried rice too. The General Tso's was okay - not too sweet but I wish we tried something outside of our comfort zone. Looking at what other people ordered the tofu looked delicious as well as some type of hot pot? But great experience and definitely recommend!
Delicious food and Fun ambience!!! Liked the cool guy in the awesome pink onesie!!! I'll come back to see him anytime!

Blue Willow is famous for its Mala Dry Pot, and the menu lets you choose what goes into it, which gives you a lot of optionality with protein, vegetables, and overall portion sizes. Along with this, we ordered the salt and pepper prawns. The bar tender who took our order made sure to warn us that the prawns came with the shell. I personally wasn't a fan of eating the prawns with their salt and pepper shells, but it offered an unfamiliar flavor profile that I could appreciate. The dry pot came out promptly afterward, and it was perfectly spicy enough. We ordered the pork belly, fatty beef, bok choy, lotus, potato slices, and enoki mushrooms. For me, the potato slices were the unexpected star of the dish, defusing some of the numbing spice. For two people, we couldn't finish everything, so I took some of the dry pot home to re-cook for the next day's lunch.
No comment
So good!! awesome outdoor seating, excellent food and service, flavor and spice levels on point. A picture of the food after we ate our mouths to numbness.

There are very few restaurants worth going to in this area of the city and happy to say this is one of them. I had the mapo tofu and thought it was wonderful. Also had the jasmine iced tea and liked it too. Other tables all seemed to get the hot pot though, so I would like to get that next time. If you're going to a show, this is a great pre-show meal.

The food at this place is great. However, I am writing this review because I am extremely disappointed in the labeling on the Ubereats menu. We ordered the eggplant and wontons, which both turned out to have pork chunks them. Neither of this items were labeled accordingly on the menu. If you have dietary restrictions, please call the restaurant to confirm before ordering online. Or maybe the restaurant should try to label their menu better in consideration for people with dietary restrictions.

While we weren't originally impressed with the takeout, coming here for dinner was amazing. The service was quick and nice and the ambiance was lively and fun. The Szechuan beef and pork soup dumplings (fist time trying these!) were incredible. I'll definitely be back.

Excellent! We hosted a small group in the private room. Beautiful restaurant very Cantonese. Food was magnificent!! Service a bit slow at first, but the tasty, piping hot out of the oven (or wok) made up for this! Definitely come back!

Updating this review after a second visit. Consensus among those in my party was that the food was mediocre for the price point. I have to say I too was disappointed this second time around, as the portion sizes seemed to have gotten smaller and overall lacking in flavor and presentation.
Awful. Â Worst take out ever. Â Greasy, no flavor and overpriced. Â Trader Joe's has better Chinese food in their frozen section.
Amazing price for amazing quality food . Brought a big group here and there was enough for everyone! Loved the vibes in here and the spicy lady drink was a crowd favorite!

A hidden gem in midtown, Blue Willow is the spot for Chinese classics in an elevated atmosphere. First of all, the restaurant is gorgeously decorated in a palette of dimly-lit reds and yellow, and is romantic and retro. We didn't get the best table, and were a bit wedged between two noisy parties, but the food more than made up for it. You might expect detached or esoteric dishes here, but Blue Willow delivers the familiar NYC-style Chinese classics. We started with the perfectly tangy and salty cucumber salad and an order of spicy wok-fried green beans. For our entrees, she got the golden yolk tofu, a creamy tofu casserole in an beautifully-pastel yellow egg yolk sauce that reminded me of egg salad in the best way, whereas I had the hard-to-find vegan mapo tofu, which was spicy, saucy, delicious. Our meal, paired with a couple dirty martinis, made for a nice Chinese meal out in NYC.

Outstanding dishes in the traditional Szechwan style. Be careful if you are afraid of spicy heat , they can bring the fire . Everything tastes so fresh. The restaurant has a nice decor and is located in a great midtown location. I'm a fan.

Food was delicious and was prepared just like the Bensonhurst, Brooklyn Chinese restaurants. I think the beef satay and my dry pot order were the highlights of my experience. Here, you get the beautiful ambiance and addition of fun cocktails. Overall, I recommend to come here!
The fastest service ever! Mapo tofu and Miss. Lou's famous beef stew are a must get, this is a great place for those who like spice. Decor and service were great! We'll be back again.

I LOVE this place - the food, the ambiance, everything :') the interior design is super historic Shanghainese vibes. Trendy, hip places always make me skeptical about the food (especially with Asian food) because they can draw people in with their vibes so I guess they can slack on the food but no this place has it all. Also prices are reasonable. Everything was yum but I want to point out the century egg clay pot especially. I am not the biggest fan of century egg on its own because it can be dense and is definitely an acquired taste (I grew up eating it) but I've never had it prepared this way - the server will mash the dish in front of you, it's a cold dish comprised of century egg, eggplant, and some spicy green peppers. SO good! And added perk is if you check in on yelp, you get a complimentary sweet chrysanthemum iced tea which was refreshing with the dishes especially because they can get quite spicy. Overall, I thought the food tasted authentic, service was good, vibes a plus, will definitely come back!

Amazing find in the heart of NYC, with great ambiance and authentic dishes that were actually spicy! The beef brine noodles were my favorite, fragrant and savory and being a more unique dish that's harder to find at other restaurants. The fish and yellow beef were also tender and flavorful without being too greasy. One star off for the service though, because it took us quite long to flag servers.

Cute restaurant, good and authentic sichuan food. Ordered a variety of dishes to share with friends and the fish in chili oil stood out the most. Yum! Being in midtown, prices are higher than other parts of Manhattan. Check-in on Yelp for a free tea of choice.

I was excited to try this place after hearing good reviews from friends. I had a reservation for 6pm and showed up early, but we weren't seated until 6:20-that was a little annoying. We ordered the scallion pancakes ($7), salt and pepper calamari ($13), mapo tofu ($16), and the Changsha spiced chicken ($18). Two bowls of jasmine rice was $4.50. Â The scallion pancakes were decent, calamari was good but the dish was a bit small with 6 pieces of calamari (I liked the peppers mixed in there though!), mapo tofu could have been better, and the big disappointment was the Changsha spiced chicken. Â There were fingernail size pieces of fried chicken (mostly batter though), peanuts and way too many red peppers (they weren't spicy, but the dish was more dried peppers than anything else). Â Overall I may come back if I were going with a group of friends, but this wouldn't be my first pick of a Chinese restaurant - go to Chinatown and you will get better food for less, and more quantity too!

It's in midtown...can't really expect much. Food looks good presentation-wise but is actually either bland or too salty. Extremely overpriced. Also - be aware that even though they offer a free chrysanthemum tea by checking in on Yelp, they don't actually want to give it to you unless you promise you'll write them a review. At least be honest and stop offering it as a Yelp check in gift then!! This is a Chinese restaurant catering to non-Chinese people who want an "upscale" Chinese experience. If you want real Chinese food go to the Chinatown downtown or better yet, Flushing.

Great Szechuan food for New York! Strong flavours in the best way and service was good. Restaurant was also decorated nicely inside. While not pictured, the spicy cucumbers are a must - perfect blend of salty, spicy, and vinegar. Would also recommend the Dan Dan noodles which had a delicious spicy, peanut sauce. The spicy fish was also great, but wish that the portion of fish was larger. Definitely a good option for a nicer dinner :)

Terrible service. Mediocre food. With six people they brought four glasses of water. They threw the dessert, appetizers and main courses at us in no coherent order, and did not clear plates until requested. They brought half the dessert before anything else and then the sauce for the dessert after everything else without telling us what the sauce was. By the time it was appropriate to eat dessert, it had been sitting out for forty minutes and there were no clean plates to eat it on: it was disgusting. If the restaurant closes at 10 and you want everyone out at that time, do not allow reservations for 9pm and do not make people wait to be seated. The bathroom was even dirty. I was really looking forward to this and was appalled -- it was the worst experience I've had at a restaurant in years.

When I stayed in New York City for several days, I discovered this amazing Chinese restaurant called Blue Willow. It is located in midtown Manhattan, right next to Central Park. Amid the towering skyscrapers, the restaurant has a cinematic 1920s China style decoration, which creates a unique atmosphere that combines modern and vintage vibes. It serves the best Chinese food I have ever had since I came to the United States. My favorite dish, Mala Dry Pot, has a rich spicy flavor that I thoroughly enjoyed. I have been to many Chinese restaurants, but Blue Willow has the most authentic taste. I strongly recommend this restaurant to Chinese students who miss the taste of home and people who like Chinese food in general. The fact that I went there three times in four days can self-illustrate how good the restaurant is.

It has a traditional Chinese taste. Â It's my favorite place in New York. Â I live on 32nd Street, but I come to 56th Street here to eat Chinese food . It's a bit far, but it's so delicious it's worth it.

I made reservations ahead given it was Memorial Day and I was really looking forward to returning to Blue Willow... however, it was such a disappointment. We ordered the sweet and sour spare ribs, garlic sauced pork belly, husband & wife special, Qing Hua Jiao fish, and eggplant & beans. The sweet and sour spare ribs dish was such a huge disappointment. The ribs showed up looking like they were just blanched missing the sweet and sour sauce. I've been here before and that's not what the dish looked like during my previous visits or how this should look like anywhere else. I took a bite and immediately spat out the meat. There was no taste except that porky flavor which was not the most pleasant. We told our server about it and he took the dish to the kitchen. Then he came back saying this is how the dish is supposed to look like according to the chef. It was total bullshit and we cancelled that dish. (I'm posting a photo of what it should look like and a photo of what we got for your reference.) The other dishes were alright... they also placed the wrong order for the fish and we got Xiang River Fish instead. We were in and out of the restaurant in 40 mins and didn't want to linger further after such a disappointing meal. I'm not sure I will return anytime soon.
