The food we had here was definitely worthy of 5 stars. Ordered the Peking Duck, Mapo Tofu, and the Wasabi Clams. The clam dish was unique and excellent! Duck and tofu dish were both very good. Cocktails were surprisingly good as well. Service is the only thing that knocked it down to 4 stars. Overall great experience.
Beautiful restaurant. Â Service was outstanding. Â Food was very good. Â We did not try much since there was only two of us and neither are big eaters. Â The cocktails were amazing! Â Sooooo good!
No comment
No comment
This was the most amazing and authentic Chinese food I have ever had. There custom drinks were well made. The Mai Tai was fabulous. We ordered the pork soup dumplings! Highly recommend. Will be back!
The outdoor dining service is amazing. You'll never regret if you come here. Really authentic Chinese food!
No comment
Undistinguished food. Â Worth avoiding unless uninteresting Chinese food is your thing.

Really tasty food and our waiter Debbie was very helpful and accommodating . We shared all the dishes and our fav was the Cauliflower one and the golden prawns. The busboy with the blond hair was also very nice .
Great food and amazing ambience! The Blue Willow fish is so tender and super flavorful.
No comment

A solid 5 stars! This place has the best peking duck I've ever had. It was crispy, a little fatty and very tasty. The fried rice was also pretty good! I will def be going back here to try a few more of their other dishes !
Highly recommend the cucumber (appetizer) and the Qin Hua Jiao Fish. The vibe here is awesome. They also have great cocktails using Chinese liquor as base.
Really liked the food. Dry pot could have been less salty, ask for less salt if you are ordering this
Very solid food. We got a Chairman Mao's pork belly, some veggies, and mapo tofu. Everything was very savory. I highly recommend the dessert and cocktails
No comment

Authentic tasting Hunan cuisine. Â  Was there for an early dinner at 5pm and the place was packed! Â  Â Service is a little off (no serving spoon for a soup noodle dish, and wait staff looked surprised when we called them!) but the food and cocktails were both really good. Â  Â See my pics here.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Food was solid! I'd come back for sure and order what I didn't last time, because it was that good

Excellent Hunan cuisine! Fresh ingredients, authentic food with bold flavors, sizable portions and fantastic ambiance. Great place to go with a group for family style dining. Mapo tofu was my personal favorite, but you can't go wrong with anything you order. However, I would say you can get better soup dumplings elsewhere. The menu is extensive and I will definitely be back with a larger group and empty stomach to explore more delicious dishes at Blue Willow!
I really loved their fried rice and soup dumplings! I ordered and picked up the food, so I didn't get a chance to try the food at the restaurant. But the food was still great packed!

We stumbled upon Blue Willow while walking through midtown after Christmas. What an amazing surprise! The interior is beautiful - like being transported back into China from a bygone era. And the food was exceptional. We've lived in New York for 5 years and this was some of the best Chinese we've had in a while - and all reasonably priced. We had the soup dumplings, ma po tofu, spicy chili wontons, and a fried chicken dish. The soup dumplings in particular were exceptional. Our waiter Terry was excellent. We will be back!
Good Chinese food in a nice but somewhat dark setting Â - convenient to lots of midtown events. Yummy dumplings.
No comment
Great food service and atmosphere, braised pork was to die for would recommend trying
No comment
Terry was super nice, food was amazing and ambiance was extremely homey! Food was actually sublime.
Menu has such a wide variety and every dish was delicious. Perfect for spice lovers! The three chili signs are no joke.

Amazing place. Food is perfect, and the service is absolutely wonderful. Terry was our waiter, and got our food out at record speed. The decor is cool, the soundtrack is great, and they have a full bar. Highly recommend.

I really wanted to like it but everything was mediocre. The restaurant itself is beautiful. It has an old Shanghainese feel to it and the decorations are on point. I had a reservation for a birthday dinner and I brought in a cake beforehand the day of. We got seated in a room and ordered drinks and food. We also checked in to get the chrysanthemum iced tea. For drinks we tried the empress Wu, good fortune, lychee martini, and lost in translation. The drinks were okayyy, some of them were too artificial and some had a interesting blend of flavors. Presentation was better. For food wise we got the numbing beef tendon cold plate, chengdu Dan Dan noodles, chili oil braised beef, eggplant and beans, golden prawn, ma ma peppercorn fish, and mapo tofu. My favorite out of all the dishes was the golden prawn because they have it fried in a egg yolk covering. The dishes were also on the smaller side so this was just right for 6 people. Â The issue came later on when they gave us the check but they charged us for the chrysanthemum tea so we told them and they said they'll take it off and then it took half an hour for the check to come back. In between that time another server came by with the check again and we told them again but this server said we had to write a review on the spot but the other server said it was fine. Then we asked about the cake and they couldn't find it and it took another 20 min for them to bring the cake into the room and left. So waiting for the check and getting it corrected took over half an hr.
Authentic Hunan Cuisine in Manhattan! Fast and outdoor services available. And it's drink menu is impressive! You won't go wrong with anything here!

The service was ok but the food was really bad. Literally nothing like the Chinese cuisine that our whole table was familiar with. Savoury noodle ended up oddly sweet, dumplings ended up very blend and tasteless... Definitely not coming back again.
This place is so delicious!! I had such an amazing experience. Great ambiance and even better food. Will be coming back!
Most delicious meal I have had in a while!! So spicy and flavor packed. Loved the experience in the private dining room with my friends.
We ate at Blue Willow tonight. Food was delicious and the service was great. Awesome authentic sichuan food in midtown. 10/10 recommend!

Ate here pre theater for dinner. Had high hopes after reading reviews but was disappointed and I must say after the last few restaurants we tried after using Yelp as a guide, I don't trust Yep anymore. I think the reviews here are about as valid as reviews on Amazon. Get a bunch of friends to post good things. The service was absolutely horrible. We were informed when we were seated Â that we had a 90 minute limit, which we were fine with, but then it took 20 minutes to take our drink order. We wound up ordering our dinner at the same time since we had had plenty of time to look at the menu and the food for 3 of the 4 of us came quickly, but they totally forgot my son's food and trying to flag someone to remind them to forever. Then it took 20 minutes to bring him his food while ours got cold waiting for his. It was shrimp fried rice which does not take long to cook. I will say his was the tastiest meal. My sesame chicken was average, my daughter's kung pao chicken was tasteless and while my husband's General Tso chicken was spicy as promised, it was super dry. The glass of Sancerre was a half glass. Needless to say we will not be back.
Honestly... great! It was great, including and especially the Ube ice cream! Yum yum yum!! :)
Went here for date night-- ambiance was very pleasant. Highlights were the taro cakes and beef fried rice. They have private rooms too, so would likely be good for birthdays or other events.
Very fast and helpful servers. Food was very good. They were very busy so I recommended making a reservation.

Terrible service. Â Rude, disrespectful and unprofessional. Â I've been visited this place since the grand opening. Â It was a nice place to have a decent Chinese food. Â Now the city has recovered. Â Clearly old customers or customers in general, are less important to them now..
No comment
Great atmosphere, the food was tasty and the drinks good. I love that the space is well arranged so you could bring a date here or a large group.
No comment
This place is amazing! Loved the Dan Dan noodles and dumplings. Perfect amount of peppercorn in each dish

Food is maybe a 3/10. Some dishes were hit or miss, not very authentic. Overly expensive and nothing came in a timely fashion. Tried to kick us out an hour before another reservation, when they still didn't bring us all the food or drinks. Tried to force us to pay more tip, although we paid what we thought was decent for this (18%). Definitely try other places then this. Some positives were the waiters and the decor.
No comment
Very good taste and spacious outdoor sitting. Make sure you can handle spicy or ask them for mild spicy, because it's truly authentic Hunan style!!

I wish I took pictures of the food but everything was so delicious we devoured it all so quickly! We got the sour and spicy fish, chinese watercress, fried buns, twice cooked pork, fried rice, mapo tofu, and some others that I don't remember. Everything was decently spicy and perfectly seasoned! Our waiter (I think his name was Eric) was also amazing, he gave the best service, he was so nice and checked up on us often. Definitely a must try!
Good restaurant, went there for dinner, and the atmosphere is great. Price is not very expensive either.

All the dishes were so delicious. It's hard to pick just one that was really the winner. The salt and pepper shrimp was amazing as was Grandma's soup. Everyone must try the cucumbers and garlic green beans! They are a must.
Wonderful ambiance and great service. The food was a little spicy but Very delicious. I highly recommend for anyone visiting New York.

The staff was so accommodating especially with a large group of 15 people, they went out of their way to serve us and was very enthusiastic and efficient! Had so much fun celebrating my graduation with the family and thank you for the restaurant and especially Terry haha for making this such a great night!
Excellent drinks and good vegetarian options like lao ma puffed tofu. Great ambience.

$80 worth of Hunan food delivered 8 minutes after order was placed. Everything was excellent, including chairman mao's braised pork, beef stew, snow pea shoot, and golden corn. Can't explain this greatness.

Excellent food! Best Hunan restaurant in midtown...maybe even all of Manhattan. We got the chive flowers, mapo tofu, Changsha chicken and ma ma fish. Everything was delicious and arrived super fast. Our server Terry was friendly and gave great recommendations!
We had such a wonderful late lunch today at Blue Willow. Their Szechuan flavors are the best in the city! Terry was our waiter and he provided excellent service! Â Can't wait to come back next time.
Delicious food, loved the beef fried rice and the duck. Our server Tery was so friendly and accommodating. The hostess was also so sweet and got us a spot even though it was such a busy night
Everything was amazing. Everything was impeccable. Will definitely visit again. I am addicted to Sichuan crisp chili oil

Really great ambiance and decor. The food was really good, but nothing I had was mind blowing, which is fine. The specialty thousand year egg and eggplant dish was unique and something I had never tried before. A tad too spicy for me but great flavor. The garlic green beans had the ideal crispy texture and was definitely one of the better versions of that dish that I've had.

This place has been on my list for a while now, and so glad I came here. The food was pretty solid, especially the Peking duck, it hits the spot. The Qing Hua Jiao fish was quite oily but very flavorful, tasted really good with white rice. But overall food was great!!!
Really nice place! Thanks Terry for good help! I will recommend it to my friends. You can also take your children here.
No comment

Great place to get authentic Chinese food. I came with a group of 7 and we had a private room. Everyone enjoyed the food, even those who don't typically like spicy food. The ma po tofu and the mountain baked fish were especially good. Would definitely recommend!
Great place !! Food tasty and very fresh! Try Dan Dan noodles wonderful flavor. I lived in Shanghai China four three years and this restaurant rates 5 star China restaurant.
No comment
My food was delicious I really enjoyed the service as well and I recommend Terry for a great dining experience.

This restaurant is incredible. Beautiful 1920s decor, amazing Szechuan food that delivers bite after bite that makes you want to eat everything on the table while trying to keep the spice down by chugging water. Highly recommend the garlic string beans!! The best! Also the Lucky Golden Buns & Changsha Spiced chicken are not to be missed. Really friendly staff providing excellent service so shoutout to the whole team
Terry was an excellent waiter and the food here is so delicious!!!! I love the chrystanthemum tea and mapo tofu. I wish I could eat here all the time.
Very nice and authentic. The staff are polite and friendly. Portions are not big and not too small
Love the restaurant. Really great vibes, great dry pot, and great vibes. Ask for terry, Terry was awesome with great service.

I've been here a few times now. I've ordered delivery as well as dining in. The food is very good, and the restaurant could easily deserve a Michelin star. I would rank them a clear tier above Cafe China and other more high-end Chinese restaurants in the city. I do wish that their prices were less extreme, but you do get what you pay for.
Amazing service, outstanding food!! Highly recommend! Cleaned every plate Â Terry was great!
No comment
No comment
No comment
We had a very nice dinner. I had peking duck. Very tasty but a little too fatty. My wife had the crispy beef which was amazing. The fried rice was just OK.
Excellent Szechuan and Chinese food in a great location. Â Amazing cocktails. Terry our server was great too. Â Highly recommend this restaurant.
Live around the block, come here often. The food is great and authentic as someone who has been to Sichuan. Terry our waiter was also very friendly and helpful. Will always come back!

Went here for early lunch, and got outdoor seats. So we cant rate on the place itself, which actually looks nice and unique from the outside. We ordered the tofu (a little salty, but tasted good), the fish with pickled vegetables (was good too), the shumai, and green beans and eggplants. Food was good, the portion is a little small compared to other chinese restaurant. Service was good. Recommended of you like authentic chinese food!

Decor was nice. Flavor for food was not bad at all. Only issue was that all the food that came out was not even hot. We ordered the stew and it was room temp... heard so many good things about this place. Disappointed everything served was cold...
Amazing authentic food. Servers are great. Terry is very nice! Great vibes, highly recommend. The music is also amazing.
Blue Willow always feels authentic to us and everyone enjoyed their meal. Â The spicy dishes were indeed that and the dumplings were delicious if a tad over done.
Food came out quickly and outside seating was great. Eggplant garlic stir fry was excellent. Terry was a great server!
So delicious!! We loved our waiter Terry. Would highly recommend the soup dumplings and Peking duck.

Restaurant was beautifully decorated, giving an old Shanghai feel to the space. Food was super authentic. My Â girlfriend was over the moon happy with the Hunan dishes. (She went to school in Hunan province in China). Service was superb! If you like "properly spicy" dishes (just ask them) this is also on point.
Beautiful outdoor dining area, you can tell they put thought and care into setting up a good dining experience.

Made a reservation a week before, then got hustled out 70 minutes after the reservation with the check on the table and the guy saying he's "so sorry" but there are people waiting. There was no one waiting? And there were empty tables? And any restaurant that doesn't plan for 90 minutes per table at least is doing something wrong. This was our big planned dinner for the weekend and it is ridiculous to pay this much for a meal when you aren't able to enjoy the full experience. Such a bummer.

Extremely poor Chinese food by city standards. Tried a handful of items and none were good. Would not try again given all the great Chinese food available. Â Flavors were mild or non-existent, ingredients sub par. Portion sizes small and fairly expensive. All around poor.
This place was wonderful!! Â Ambiance, food, staff all amazing!! Â Packed house on a Saturday evening but the hostess was accommodating and polite!!

I have been here twice now and tried several dishes on the lunch menu. Each one is a hit! The restaurant is authentic, authentic Hunan food, so expect some serious spicy. Outdoor winter seating during COVID is so cute with individual heat lamps!

This place is very attractive and not overly pricey for the area. But we ordered 3 dishes and ALL of them were so salty we could barely eat them. We've eaten Sichuan food all over the city, but never had an experience like this. I was afraid the chicken with pickled peppers might be too spicy, but it wasn't. It was painfully salty. Also, all 3 dishes (1 beef, 1 chicken, 1 tofu) had the same boring red bell peppers in them, no other vegetables. Left half the food, didn't bother to take it home. Nope, won't be going back here :-(
Wow, just wow. Â Stumbled in during a rainy evening mid week. Â We were able to sit at the bar in the corner. Â Fab ambiance. I could write poems about the duck.
Delicious!!! Recommending this place to all my friends. Favorites were their mapo tofu and Szechuan beef. Pumpkin Mochi dessert was also lovely

I've ordered from Blue Willow a few times and just haven't found anything that good. Maybe going in person is much better, or maybe I'm just ordering the wrong things, because other reviews are very positive.

Delicious hunan/Szechuan food - Â had the wood ear cold dish, chengdu spicy wontons and the Malay dry pot - definitely hit the spot and food was well flavored, authentic and not too heavy. Â Service was attentive and helpful as well! Â Pricier than flushing but that's understandable based on the location. Â I'll be back next time I need my Szechuan fix!
Lovely atmosphere. Great veggie options. Fab cocktails. Love the fringe lamps and decor.
Great food, drinks and atmosphere! Definitely would come back again! Missed the chairman mao's braised pork this time but will be back for that. Flavors were authentic and food was high quality!
Great place for team dinners! Good for big groups. Their cocktails are also really great.

Make a reservation beforehand - it gets packed. Very cool, retro atmosphere. Really enjoyed their dry pot and creative cocktail drinks. Their soup dumplings, however, were so sweet that they didn't taste like traditional dumplings. Overall, cool place to try but not worth going back.

I had dinner with my friends there for my birthday last night. It was incredible food. Terry was our server and he was very helpful. We all loved our friend there. I would highly recommend this place!
Great cherry Manhattan, and great green beans!!! Would go back and get more entrees next time

Delicious food! We ate here multiple times during our visit to NYC. A few of our favorite dishes - the smoked hunan bacon with dried turnips, mala dry pot, Changsha spiced chicken, and century egg clay pot. We'll definitely be back when we're in nyc again!
Food arrived really fast! I was wondering if the chili will be overwhelming, but it was actually not as spicy as I expected. Recommend getting their clay pot dishes

A beautiful restaurant with truly delicious food. We love the Chairman Mao's braised pork (which has a hint of spice but is pretty mild), and the Golden Yolk tofu, which appears to be one of their specialties. I think my husband gets the pickled pepper chicken, which is HOT and burns my tongue unlike anything else. It's super spicy. We've also tried the Golden Corn, which is delicious, but I'd recommend for a larger group rather than a party of 2.
We came here for my girl friend's birthday. Terry our server was so amazing! Food was so good and the service was spectacular! We will definitely come back!

Overall ambiance of the restaurant is amazing. From decor to dim lighting. We tried the dry pot and it was great. Flavorful and displayed well. Reasonable prices. Our party of 5 ate and drank for under $200 . Only reason I don't give 5 stars, it took longer than expected to receive our drinks (came after our appetizers) but it was a Friday night and busy. Would definitely go back to explore other items on the menu!
Food is incredible! Could've easily walked past not knowing it was here. Don't miss this place! Terry was our server and gave great recommendations. Aesthetic was beautiful and unique.
Love the ambiance, attentive service, food was great and very authentic. Definitely would come back

My GO TO Chinese restaurant in NYC. Excellent atmosphere, authentic Hunan food(all my friends love it), great service, more Â importantly their cocktails are sooo delicious! Try their green pepper fish and Peking duck, my favorite! 10/10!

Went back again for the Dan Dan Noodles, the Spicy Chili Chicken on skewers and I was blown away. Â Your taste buds are going to get electrified. The noodles were placed on a thick pool of peanut sauce and topped with minced pork and scallion. The chicken was topped with crushed peanuts, chili oil, and other spices. Flavor was through the roof !

I order delivery from here all the time - My go to order includes chairman mao's braised pork, general Tso's (I know, so basic but its good here!) and I was OBSESSED with the sautÃ©ed cabbage. I wld literally order just the sautÃ©ed cabbage for dinner but I'm crushed because they changed the recipe recently and added peppercorn or something because now it just numbs my mouth and makes everything else taste weird :(

This is hands down the best Chinese food that I've had outside of China! My son is vegetarian, so we mostly stuck to dishes without meat and it did not disappoint. We started with veggie potstickers that were simply amazing and then moved to the Century Egg and Eggplant and Puffed Tofu. Â Again...both were delicious and the spice on the tofu was so good without letting the heat are over. Â Two days later, we are still talking about it - it's that good!

Great Hunan style food! Definitely never had green pancakes that are so fluffy! Their Mapu Tofu and dumplings were great too - just beware of the pepper corn. 4 stars because the peppercorn was a bit too overwhelming after some time! Could not feel the taste after a while;) Would recommended reducing the level of spice!
No comment
Great Chinese in midtown. A little on the pricey side but the portions are big and the drinks are good

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Love this restaurant! Food is authentic and the ambiance is perfect!! Terry, Joseph and Mark were such good servers. Def recommend!
Blue willow was well worth the trip... all the dishes met or exceeded our expectations.
No comment

Food was delicious. Service was pretty terrible...so giving 3 stars. It was packed on a Sunday night. We had a reservation and were seated promptly but no one came to our table for about 20 minutes other than to give us waters. Finally my husband went up to the bar to order our drinks. Every time we wanted to order something we had to flag down someone to come to our table. We had about 5 different waiters over the course of dinner take our order and drop off food. No one ever greeted us, walked us through the menu, asked if we were ok, how was the food, could they bring us anything else, did we want another drink. It's almost like they forgot about us. BUT the Dan Dan noodles, soup dumplings and salt and pepper prawns were amazing.

We visited on Sunday(come before 6 because they usually busy after 7.) This is my first time in Blue Willow and YOU have to go! It's the big spot with amazing food. The service we received was so amazing and we will definitely be back again. The server is amazing! She made us feel welcomed and gave us an amazing experience. And she recommended great food to us and we definitely LOVE those!!! And I love the Eggplant, beans and braised pork there:) Â If you can eat spicy this is MUST TRY and they have a lot of foods here. We will come back again!

The menu looks incredibly promising, but the food falls so short at Blue Willow. First of all, the food does not come out hot. Every dish we received was lukewarm, and we had to ask for the food to be reheated. Second of all, we ordered the snow pea leaves but they failed to cut off the ends of the vegetables, so the dish was incredibly fibrous and stringy, rendering some pieces inedible. Lastly, the dishes were not well seasoned. The snow pea dish we ordered was too sweet - it almost tasted as if the leaves were soaked in sugar. Would not recommend, especially because the restaurant is quite overpriced.
The absolute best meal of our trip. Cannot recommend this restaurant enough. The Chili Oil Braised Beef and Spicy Crispy Wontons are must tries.

This place is great. Cute inside, cute outside option. Not too many food options but I think there's enough to be satisfied. Their house wine was great. The service was fine, not the most friendly bartenders but could've just been an off night. I'd go back
Beautiful bar. Love the owners! Great wine recommendations and friendly service. Flattering lighting and they also have great food!

Just came across this place and was able to sit in their outdoor dining area set up like a ski chalet - adorable. Food was also beyond good (got the grilled cheese with arugula gouda and hot honey and soup of the day - butternut squash) and oh wow. Insanely good, very cute vibe, will definitely be coming back!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The people working there are professional and kind. Â The food has a lot of options and the quality is very good. Â A great spot for lunch i highly recommend it, a lot of mix and match options. The outside doesn't make it look like a food spot looks more like a boutique, Â but I will definitely be visiting again.
Delicious food and fast customer service. Will definitely go back. Hubby ordered the hot vegan and mine came with braised pork. Both were delicious.
Just moved to BK and just testing out the local flavors. I really enjoy the offerings for base (soba noodles black rice, etc) as well as the mains (braised pork, kung Pao, orange ginger chicken)
The Food here is good and at a reasonable price too. The customer service is amazing along with the nice orange ambiance
Amazing food! I love mixing the chili oil with the food. The veggies are fresh and the meat is seasoned well! :)
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We went here on a whim and were pleasantly surprised. We got the guacamole with plantains, elotes, birria tacos and huitlacoche tacos. The food was fantastic! We enjoyed it all. The cocktails here are great as well. I had the besos calientes margarita and my girlfriend had some watermelon gin cocktail. We both loved what we had and would come here again.
The food was OK. Drinks were OK. Prices were insane for what they offer. At about 25 percent cheaper this place would be good.
No comment
What a gorgeous little place! We had an awesome dinner last night - delicious food, service exceptional (thank you Brenda) and fabulous hostess (thank you Darya). Can't wait to go back!
No comment
Such a cute place that serves authentic Mexican food and delicious cocktails!! I had the Chilaquiles and they were soo good!!
No comment
No comment

Such a hidden gem, the drinks, food and setting are amazing here. It also smells like Palo Santo wherever you are in the restaurant. When you get to the front door of the restaurant, it literally just looks like a cute little shop that just sells cactuses but it's like a speakeasy restaurant. Once you pass the little cactus area & the host at the front greets you, you walk straight into the bar, then the indoor seating room & outdoor area. They played bad bunny while we were there and it was such a vibe. You can tell everyone there was having a great time. The food & drinks were all delicious. I had birria tacos and about 3, maybe 4 different cocktails, enjoyed shared flights of mezcal and we shared churros for dessert, yummm!
No comment
No comment

The decor is so beautiful and sets a wonderful vibe especially when it's nice and sunny out. Love all the skulls, cactus and thoughtful design. Food and beverages are average. I'd come back for a fun brunch but not for dinner, food is so-so. 3 shots of casamigos will also cost ya $60.00 for half a tall shot glass as an fyi.

Everything in this place was a 10/10 including food and drinks also staff. Overall laid back place and chill vibes for a date or with friends to catch up. The decor is nice and bright. Ordered elote very spicy and good in flavor. Got the birria tacos omg soooo good the comsume is very good and different has nutmeg. Also got the huitlacoche tacos and the barbacoa they were amazing really good! Too 3 Mexican places I've been too and I'm a tacos fan!

I fell in love with this small cute place immediately! The drinks were amazing, although we only went in for an appetizer it was also good. We had the Guacamole with plantain chips. The decorations in this speakeasy is pretty cool as well. The customer service was good. We will definitely be back!
Great drinks and food. The Besos Calientes are a masterpiece cocktail. We came here for the churros but enjoyed everything else. Very nice ambiance too.
No comment

I've visited this spot a couple times and it has yet to disappoint. Wonderful service, great cocktails and delicious food. This last time, our server was Pierre and he was informative with his suggestions and attentive with the drink refills lol. I had the Birria Tacos - SO good. The menu stated the order came with 3 tacos but the chef threw and extra one in cuz I'm cute, lol just kidding... I believe it was a special they were running for the day. Didn't have dessert this time but the last time, we had churros and they were amazing! I'll definitely be back when I'm in town.
No comment

5 star atmosphere. Beautiful outdoor and indoor area. Love the dia de los muertos figurines everywhere. The birria tacos were excellent, drinks were ok (strong). Was a little disappointed by the dessert.

10/10 had a great solo date here. Bartender took care of me. I believe they had HH for 2 for 1 on the Paloma & some other drink(s). The food was great!! It wasn't crowded when I went & everything I ate was delicious. I will come back again!

Super cool bar and restaurant that's hidden behind what appears to be a storefront of a literal cactus shop. I came here with a group of coworkers a couple weeks ago and we were pleasantly surprised that it was Taco Tuesday, which meant each order of tacos came with four instead of three. The food was very good, but fell short of great. The margaritas were strong and very tasty. A little overpriced for what you get, but definitely worth checking out if you're nearby.
They got both orders of food wrong, and when they gave me the "right order" it was still wrong. Went to the bar after for a drink and they took 15 minutes to attend us. Dont travel for this place.
Three stars for the decor and Â ambience, after spending $109 my party of 2 left starving ..on out way to fill up on some where else

Celebrated my birthday here, it was a great time. The food is good and drinks are even better and the people of this establishment truly care about your experience. It was day three of their business however it did not feel like they were new or inexperienced. The decor is pretty cool too and very different from other places

Fun new speakeasy with spacious outdoor, bar, and table seating. Outdoor has some small tables with heat lamps. Waitstaff were really accommodating to a big group and service was fast. They do take reservations for tables so call ahead if you plan on going on a weekend. Drinks were also fantastic and their signature cocktails are incredible if you love mezcal and tequila! Favorite drinks of the night were the Smoky Royale and the Besos Calientes. Lots of great Mexican food options both for small bites and larger meals. Highly recommend their tacos and guac that comes with plantain chips.

We went to have dinner at the Cactus Shop after my friend recommended it and we are so glad we did. The host was super nice and asked to see ID, I was flattered since I'm way over 21. We waited about 15 minutes to be seated at our table. We ordered birria flautas, pollo papa quesadilla, birria tacos and churros. Everything was delicious. We also ordered skinny margaritas and lemonades. The service was great and our waiter was super nice. The water guy was also nice and brought us napkins and filled our glasses of water. Overall our experience was great and we will definitely go back. I shared with my neighbors at 1S1 and soon find out that one of them was there as well.

Great Â addition to the neighborhood! The food is great, drinks are excellent and vibes are on point. The staff is super nice. Great place to meet friends for an after work drink or wind down on the weekends. Couldn't love this place more. Even my 2 year old begs to go to "Cactus Bar" lol.
No comment

This place is a hidden gem! The aesthetics, service, food and drinks are all amazing. I got the birria and the cauliflower and my friend got the pork carnitas. They also have a taco Tuesday deal- 4 tacos for $12! Will be back!

I'll start by saying the margaritas were great. Unfortunately that was the only redeeming part. The birria tacos (in a part of BK with many great birria options)--in addition to being overpriced, had very little birria flavor and the meat was tough. The kicker: we ordered churros for dessert, and they came out cold and hard as a rock. The waiter actually told us that they were made at the beginning of the dinner shift, then tried to convince us that they are "supposed to rest for a while" and be served cold. I told him I lived in Mexico for a while and this was not the case anywhere I had been. He finally admitted that he agreed with me, but the "chef was very sensitive about his food" and would not take feedback or make a fresh batch. I am embarrassed for them.
this place was so cute! both the food and drinks were amazing. the plantain chips and guacamole is a must. i wish i could have tried every marg
Came here last night. Great simple ambiance. Food was really good and the cocktails were amazing. Magician was a cool touch too
Cute, low key place for drinks and tasty appetizers. The restaurant is beautiful. The appetizers were surprisingly filling too.
The food is delicious and the atmosphere is amazing ! I recommend the birria flautas, guac and tacos !
I love the ambience, service, drinks, and food. My favorite is the brunch (guacamole, aguachile, huevos rancheros, and churro waffles). 10/10 recommend this local favorite.
No comment

What a great experience! The decor and layout is beautiful and picture perfect. The hostess and staff are inviting and pleasant. The outdoor seating is special and dogs are welcome. My party was seated right away. The food is equally spectacular. We had the guacamole and huevos hanceros both authentic, well seasoned, and delicious. My wife had what I felt was the best Paloma ever. Ambiance is perfect for a large party or intimate vibe. This place is a must try for the amazing cocktails, food, creative decor, and music (I love a restaurant/bar that has good music)! Highly recommend.

I'd love to give this place four stars. The good: great ambiance, great vibes, great and friendly service. The food is just lacking. The Al pastor tacos were not marinated at all. It wasn't that the marinade wasn't flavorful. There was no marinade. It was cooked pork. The carnitas was ok, it was marinated but was tough and stringy. They do not have salsas, just hot sauces. The aguachiles had not been cured in lime sauce very long at all because the vast majority of the shrimp were still grey. When it has cured in lime juice for even 30 minutes the Â shrimp will turn orange like it does when it is cooked, and the texture hardens similarly as well. This was not the case, and is actually kind of precarious/risky. The tostadas they served with the aguachiles was also stale. They are new so maybe they will make some improvements and changes. But given the quality of restaurants they need to compete against, I wouldn't really recommend this to friends or come back here based on the quality of the food. Everything else is great though.
Cute concept, easy to run up quite the bill here. Drinks were great and vibe was nice
No comment
No comment
No comment

Had a great meal here with a friend! I think this would be a great date spot, the chairs were super comfy, the lighting was perfect for a date and felt intimate. My one complaint was the table next to us was a group of 5 and they were taking photos of each other all night with the flash on and were SO loud but that is certainly not the fault of the restaurant - did make me think it could be a good group dinner spot as well. We had the charcuterie board but with no meat, I imagine the meat would have been nice but friend was a vegetarian. Also got the pesto pasta with nice thick noodles that I LOVED the cook and texture of it. We also got the pistachio dessert that was so unexpectedly amazing, I wasn't sure what to expect but it was almost like a thick pudding pistachio bottom with a moist cake on top I think that might have been my fav dish of the night!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had the chance to catch up with a friend here on a Saturday afternoon for lunch. Since moving to the area I've walked by Bacan and always admired the minimalistic decor on modern vibe you're able to distinguish solely from walking past the restaurant. I couldn't think of a better opportunity than this for a friend who had never been to Williamsburg! We made a reservation beforehand and were seated inside. They've also got outdoor covered seating which is probably ideal on a perfect weather day. When it came time to order we did a few rounds of aperol spritz's accompanied with their diavola pizza (fancy for pepperoni). Overall an awesome dining experience due to attentive staff, good vibes, and tasty dishes!
No comment

Incredible atmosphere. My friend and I came to BacÃ n simply due to the good atmosphere after a day of walking around Williamsburg, Brooklyn. The food was decent. I felt like the gnocchi could've had a bit more flavor and the bruschetta bread wasn't as fresh as it could've been. However, the service was good and others seemed to be enjoying their food-- so might've just been a one off experience. I liked the music they played and the dim lighting/comfortable seating

Incredible food, even better service. Jet made my girlfriend and me feel at home and took great care of us. He even surprised us with a tiramisu since he found out it was our anniversary. I'll definitely be back and HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!

The ambience and decor is really cozy and modern but the food is expensive for the reeeaaallly small quantity you get. Although the food tastes good, it's just not mind blowing enough to justify the price.

Came here for a weeknight dinner with my wife. We shared the kale salad, the seared scallops, the cacio e pepe ravioli, and the black squid ink gnocchi. I had a couple glasses of wine including a sparkling Mongarda Prosecco and the Frug Gruner Veltliner. My favorite items were the scallops and the gnocchi. The staff was very amiable. There was one gender neutral restroom which was very spacious.
No comment
No comment
No comment
After serving us water in dirty glasses, I don't think you have a leg to stand on. Very rude, condescending bartender. On New Year's Day, no less.
No comment

Went here last Thursday with a friend and had an amazing time! The tapas style menu is so fun to share. We had the suppli, gnocchi, uovo, tartare, polpo and taglioni - everything was so good, would 10/10 order these again.
Really nice ambience, really good food. We got iced coffee, the caprese pizza (fresh mozz and crisp focaccia), omelette (SO good), and burger. Would definitely recommend.

In one fell swoop, this place has overtaken all of our regular spots in the neighborhood. Food is incredible, traditional with a twist. Drinks are delicious and creative. And the vibe is great. Exactly what you need to get a dose of Italy while in the city whenever the urge hits. Phenomenal!
The best bacon egg and cheese sandwich in Williamsburg. Great brunch items. Â No long wait like other spots in the neighborhood. Great coffee.

We moved a block away from BacÃ¡n and we feel so lucky to have found this place. You're immediately greeted by the warmth yet fun that this place exudes -- they really got it right with the decor and music. The menu is perfectly curated for shareable bites and everything is executed to perfection. Â We started with this complimentary squash bite that was unexpected but was delicious nonetheless. Our server was so kind to be considerate of my dairy allergy. The polpo (octopus) was so tasty in a tomato based sauce and the pastas were plentiful and homemade. I ordered the cicchetti (smaller portion) of the pici (pesto pasta) and my partner ordered the agnolotti in the regular portion. The pici was completely vegan! The service was so attentive but what really showed was the passion this team brings to their craft. Perfect for a date night and can't wait to return.

Highly recommend this spot. I went for a glass of wine after a stressful day and felt very at ease. The staff is very charismatic with a gentle manner. The mood is very chill with great music and candles everywhere. A place to feel romantic with good quality food and drinks, even had the pleasure of meeting the owner. Will be coming back soon!
Cozy candle-lit interior, memorably delicious house-made pastas, great rotating wine list, and really friendly and excellent service! So good!

If you can't deal with the line up next door at DevociÃ³n, cross the street to BacÃ n. We did, and it was a very happy accident! Â We'll skip that nasty line up from now on. Â Bacan's Americano is Â exactly like that perfect cup you remember from your first trip to Italy. Made me realize how I miss a classic Italian roast. If the coffee is this extraordinary, I can't wait to try their food!

Amazing new neighborhood gem. This is the passion project for the two guys who run it. You can feel it in excitement over their menu and wine selection and in how they run it. Best part is they don't do wine by the glass, they'll open amazing quality by the bottle ones for you. Can't wait to go back with a bigger group.
My friends and I came in last minute without a reservation and the staff was so kind and welcoming to accommodate our large group. We had a delicious happy hour.

Confused about why this place has 5 star reviews only. Went here for dinner last night and we waited a bit past our reservation time, which is fine on a Saturday night in New York. I'm surprised that no one offered us a drink menu while we waited, but whatever. Let's get to the food... honestly subpar. The gnocchi appetizer was borderline nasty and extremely chewy. The broccoli dish came with 4 pieces of broccoli lol. And the burrata had some strange fish on it. Burrata and fish - not a great combo. I've never not wanted to finish a burrata dish at a restaurant before. The polenta fries were inedible (they took this off our check which is kind, and we didn't ask for them to do that). And the pasta with pesto sauce was eh, okay. Since there are so many amazing Italian restaurants in Williamsburg - I definitely won't be going back here. Go somewhere else.

Very solid brunch experience. A+ cocktails. The sandwich with bacon and eggs (I forget what it was called) was awesome, the bun was like a fluffy biscuit. Had a toast with truffle Parmesan and poached egg that was great too

Went to this restaurant hoping to find a great spot in the neighborhood. Meatballs are okay, best part of the meal was the pappardelle. Within less than an hour of us being there, they were moving tables to connect to ours - very evident they had a larger group coming in. Not even 30 minutes later they had us get up from our table so they could seat others. Very strange and uncomfortable. Won't be returning.

orange wine was great, started promising. ordered agnolatti cichetti that came literally in 4 Â small pieces and cold. other warm cichetti we ordered also came at a lukewarm temperature, and everything was too salty! hoping for another visit for a better experience.
No comment

No comment
No comment
The worst! Waited a decade for host to come and get me seated. Shashlik wasn't properly cooked, meze plates wasn't tasty at all, waiters were inattentive.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Another outstanding meal. The meat is absolutely delicious. The sides are to die for and the drinks have a kick! Come here if you want to enjoy a delicious, unique, fun experience for your mouth. You can savor every bite.
Great restaurant in the mall. Each kabob comes with 8-10 sides including an excellent babaganoush. The whole grilled fish takes top honors.

Naked Tomato is the more formal restaurant of the Miznon chain. While the food is very good, the service is actually more in line with a fast casual chain restaurant than the formal restaurant it is supposed to be. The cocktails are good, but the wine list is very limited. The meal starts with a selection of mezze (hummus is extra) and then you order skewers. The mezze are good, not great but the skewers are excellent.
Delicious food but very slow, not so friendly service. A great option if you're already at Hudson Yards but I wouldn't travel specifically for the restaurant.

Awesome choice for a quick workday lunch in Hudson Yards. Great deal on endless mezze and skewers (if you don't order an entree per person, there will be a $25 charge for the mezze). So delicious and the pita is amazingly fluffy.
No comment
No comment
Great ambience. Â Food was good. Â Just got the pita. Â Was not a fan of how they drenched it in sauce and food sliding all over the place. Â Would comeback though.
No comment
No comment

I love the concept - like many restaurants in Israel, the meal at Naked tomato starts with a ton of small dishes - like different kinds of eggplant, peppers, labne, beets, cabbage, etc. these come with THE most delicious, warm pita. Â You can get all of these small dishes refilled. Â The small dishes come with any choice of main dish. Â I tried the lamb kabob, which is usually the most delicious dish at eyal Shani restaurants, but here the lamb was really undercooked. Â Husband got entrecÃ´te and also didn't love it. Â We agreed that the small dishes are the show here. Â Great service. Â Anyway, we would definitely come back! Didn't give five starts only because my husband and I both had issues with the meat preparation.
No comment

Food was very tasty and interesting different concept. A bit pricey as others reference. Servers are very friendly and bubbly but what I found a bit frustrating, it was not uncommon that they were out if things or no longer making them. Either that night or its been removed. Or maybe I just asked for the wrong things? So they will ask you which sides you would like refilled, and then too often the response is, "We don't have any more of that. Is there anything else you would like refilled? Sorry we are out of that one. Is there anything else...". How abt start out saying what you are out of? This happened with my cocktail choice. And also the request for the shrimp. And many of the sides. When you hit on something they had it was like a buzzer went off. So unlimited refills sounds great but....

One of the best meals I had in NYC!!! Besides the abundant number of small dishes/mezze provided (all free and refillable with skewer orders, mostly veggie based), the skewers was delicious and had a good portion. The service was amazing as well - our hostess led me and my partner to see the skewers in a display case before ordering to get a sense of what they are. I order the Abu Jasmine cocktail - definitely on the sweeter side (orange juice) and had a lot of alcohol content. Would 100% go back and recommend!

You order two meat skewers at this place and with them come like 20 side dishes. We thought they were going to be small dishes but they were all fairly large considering how many there were. Everything was tasty but we felt like the amount of side dishes was overkill (at least for two people). I feel like they should warn parties of less than 4 that it's a literal ton of food. Otherwise great meal. Felt bad a lot went to waste though.

The naked tomato is built for groups and sharing. Â The waitstaff is energic and extremely enthusiastic about the joys of the naked tomato! The menu is simply (and is actually called "Simple Menus"). Â You order a main dish and they take care of the apps. Â I was with a party of five (Baily, Claudia, Charlie. . . (any 90's pop culture peeps out there?) ). Â We ordered 5 kebobs, all of which were delicious -- with the duck being extra special. Â The real prize, however, comes before the main dish, when warm pitas arrive accompanied by countless small plates of delicious goodies, all designed to help you make the perfect pita.
No comment

Insane. I can't even describe the food... the tahini... the hummus and THAT PITA! Service was meh but the location decor atmosphere and food made up for it! Check this place out for sure, the menu changes Eve try day!

Absolutely delicious seafood, beef, or chicken skewers. And with the price of a skewer they give you all the veggies you can eat and the veggies are incredible and make the meal. Don't order extras because they bring you as much veggies as you can eat and there's so many kinds it's delicious. Beads, potato salad, spicy cucumbers, spicy carrots, hummus, everything is delicious. Two thumbs up!
No comment

We visited on a quiet night, only two other groups in the restaurant. The staff member who seated us and explained the menu and then took our order, etc, was a very pleasant young man. Â After that the service went down hill as the young woman assigned to service our table was virtually absent and we had to seek her out to get our small plates replaced. We waited Â more than 10 minutes for Pita (surprising in an empty-ish restaurant). We felt like she was doing us a favor, a 180 from the 1st employee we dealt with. Food was good, particularly the mezzes but only 5 pieces of grilled octopus on a skewer for $39 was a surprise. Â  Please note that when we were about to pay the check the 1st employee asked how our meal was and when we discussed our disappointment with service he offered to bring us a glass of wine but we were already about to leave. Â Would we go back, let you know after we try Laser Wolf in a few weeks.

Came to this establishment yesterday with my family. Â We have since been extremely sick due to food poisoning (symptoms includes shivers, fever, "the runs", loss of appetite). Â While I've been a fan in the past, this experience makes me question the cleanliness and preparation of their food (specifically the small plate salads).

Great spot to stop while shopping in Hudson Yard as there is both a cafe and sit down restaurant. Great service here and the food is incredible. With one entree, dishes of appetizers decided by the chef is included in your meal with fresh, warm pita bread. However, each member in your party must order at least one entree as the amount of apps given per party is extensive. Definitely would recommend the lamb main entree :)
Great Israeli food. Brazilian was amazing. Great salad. Grest service and presentation. Good drinks but very very weak on red wines.

Outstanding food & it would be darn near impossible to leave hungry! Unique setup of many tasty appetizers brought out at the beginning of the dining experience and then followed by excellent shaslik (chicken or lamb skewers). Service was very good and the location in the Hudson Yards complex is wonderful! Enjoy!

I'm in nyc with a customer and we had a great time. Service was great and attentive. Menu selections are Â diverse - ordering small plates to share and then kababs with a selection of meats. Awesome quality of food!

We were accidentally running into this restaurant while looking for a place for lunch after visiting Vessel. Â This was our first time to have Israeli food. Everything was so good, it took us by completely surprise. Besides the unbelieved amount of small dishes they offered, we ordered octopus shishlik and duck breast. Octopus was excellent but duck was a little bit over cooked. This place is built for sharing so next time I will definitely bring a big party to here.

This place was very disappointing. Their system is ass backwards, as well as their service. Solid advice - please examine your itemized bill. Â They implement false charges and the little saving grace was, they were able to rectify that potent problem without having to escalate the erroneous issue further - in my situation fortunately. The quality of the food was okay ; Definitely not delectably out of this world and not the polar opposite, feces on a platter. Â The ambient concept was suppose to be a "hip and classy" vibe but the place provided "empty energy" and was a bit vacant and desolate. We couldn't wait to leave - it was just repelling, unwelcoming, unwanted energy. As I finish this review, I also was not encouraged to generously tip as well as I normally do (22-25% in most cases) based on my experience. Â Lastly, Naked Tomato is a fucking stupid name for an Israeli/Mediterranean restaurant/eating establishment. Â (Due diligence was done, and we did not blindly dine at this spot expecting Italian food).
No comment
No comment

Condescending rude manager. I'd say stay away from this restaurant, especially if you're local New Yorkers. There are so many Mediterranean restaurants in the city that can serve as great tasting food as this one. However, this is the one that ruins your experience with their operations, services, and to top it off, with the manager. After our meal, we went through 40 minutes of 5 iterations of bills as they could not figure out the exact charge for our table. And when the manager finally came out, she was extremely arrogant and her first question (not an apology!) was, "there is only $1 overcharge we did on your check, what is the problem here?" although this was after their 3rd bill that overcharged 4 more drinks!! So it really did it for us. When she added further to say "we have 2 servers covering all tables so there can be confusions but this is how all restaurants are nowadays" we were thrown off at how arrogant and unprofessional she is as a manager. And she asked us to take out our own calculators, yes!! she did!, to confirm her last bill was correct, we were very very upset. This is not what you want your customers to experience at your restaurant. I do not recommend this experience.

No seasoning on the skewers and just bland. One skewer is $40 or more with like 3 unseasoned pieces (I ordered the octopus, which were 3 small pieces), and the rest on the skewer are just onions and jalapeno. My friend and I were the only customers, but waitress lacked any service and was drinking on the job, not even trying to hide it. Had to remind her about our drinks several times. Did not mention that the skewer stick was super hot. So I burnt my finger. Would never come back.
Delicious food and I love the concept of having a variety of dishes. We will definitely be back and bring friends

On our way to the Naked Tomato, we read the 5 reviews that added up to 2.8 stars, and decided that it's probably out of jealousy. We came in, wanting to give the place the best reviews possible. Unfortunately, the food was really not tasty, the mezzes were unsalted, lacking flavors and really disappointing. Service was one of the worst ever!! Definitely not in Eyal Shani's league!! The pita bread was wonderful, I'll give it that, but I'm NEVER repeating the experience..!!!

Great customer service & food!! I came here with 7 friends and we loved the interactive games on the board!
No comment
No comment
No comment

DokoDemo brings a fun twist to authentic Japanese street food. It was my first time going here and the cashier was extremely helpful by going over their most popular dishes. The decor is fun with a chalkboard Mural right by the kitchen and the music they play on the speakers brings it all together. Would definitely go again if I'm ever in the EV area!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of my favorite spots to get some yummy jap street foods. I'm sad they no longer have the okonomiyaki dishes anymore. Wonder why they stopped making it. Usually order the takoyaki and ramen rice. Tried their new fried chicken bowl last time as well- the seasoning was delicious- wish it was crispier though.

Oh how I wish they had this restaurant in Jersey. Â I got the fried rice with chicken (medium spice level) and I'm still craving more. Â Portions were good, staff was nice! Â My friend had the chicken bowl. Amazing!!!!!! Â I enjoy spots like this; small and reasonable prices! Â I'll be back someway, somehow!!!!! Â This is one I'll never forget!
Fried chicken bowl recommended. The server took our order quickly. And the place is nice with four tables to sit and eat. Would come here again!

I've been craving takoyaki for the longest time. I was really excited when I found out this place served them . I ordered the original . However, my excitement turned into a big disappointment. There was barely any octopus in the balls . Each piece was completely smothered in sauce . They also put way too much pickled ginger . I felt like the pickled ginger overpowered everything .

We didn't have high expectations given it was in a college student area and prices were cheap. However, the food was extremely salty and barely had any other flavors. The takoyaki was covered in too much sauce, and I couldn't taste anything else. The yakisoba was not very good and very simply stir fried in soy sauce. Picking up your order was pretty confusing because they call out the food item, but there's only 4 things on the menu.. We asked if it was our order number, and the guy was kind of rude. Seating, ordering, and the vibe was very college cafeteria-like. If the food was better, I wouldn't have minded..

I cam for the okinomiyaki, but was disappointed to find out that it was no longer on the menu. But WHATEVER because everything else looked hella good. Â Tried takoyaki for the first time and it was worth the wait. Tender and softer than I thought it would be. It was really neat being able to see how it is made. Â The yakisoba Â with tonkatsu sauce was not much to look at, but it was surprisingly packed with flavor. Â We didn't go overboard so we could eat later, and an order of the 8 takoyaki and yakisoba was enough to chase that hungry feeling away for a few hours. Â If you want to stuff yourself between two people, order one more thing. Â They have high top tables with stools for family style seating. Â It is a pretty small place. Â Service was great and the food was amazing and easy on the wallet. Â Great Japanese fast food.
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment

Solid and quick lunch spot that put its own spin on Japanese cuisine. Chicken was tender and marinated well, the add ins were solid, but I would recommend getting the spiciest option if you enjoy spice. I got medium expecting a little kick, but it was mostly just more red pepper flakes. Overall a solid spot

Inthe search of delicious takoyaki, my friend and I found our way to DokoDemo. The restaurant has dim lighting and a casual atmosphere. We ordered the Original Takoyaki (8 piece) to go and equals a little over $1 a piece. It was made fresh and quickly. It carried well through the subway and tasted yummy.
No comment

Came here on a whim on a Friday night and surprised to see every table full around 8-9pm! It looked cute and comfy inside so I decided to try it out. First of all, the staff are so nice and welcoming - they answered all of my questions and were willing to explain lots of things. I tried the soy sauce yakisoba with chicken and was a big fan but wished it was slightly bigger portions (or maybe I was just hungry!) you're able to choose the protein, sauce, and any add ons you want to put in. They also have ramen rice which I want to try next time and takoyaki which they seem to be known for. Definitely a small hole in the wall restaurant but it made my night so I think all Japanese food lovers would enjoy!!

I've come to DokoDemo twice now and I love this spot! It's a small restaurant, so there's not much seating, which is okay because we've always managed to find a seat. The food is always super fresh because it's served as soon as it comes off the pans. The takoyaki is always great and I love how you can customize the heat level and what you can add for toppings.
Hands down my favorite restaurant in the city. I've been going to DokoDemo for YEARS now and I always get their takoyaki or yakisoba!
No comment

Yum! Quick service and tasty food at a great price. I tried the takoyaki made with shiitake instead of octopus because... well I've never had siitakoyaki before. It was delicious, fresh, flavorful, and a mix off all my favorite tastes and textures. Definitely recommend stopping by. Can't wait to try their ramen rice and yakisoba.
Food here is awesome!!! Menu is simple yet all of them taste excellent! I highly recommend this place.

Found this perfect japanese bar upon yelp research and could not wait to try this place, so I decided to check it out after work. They sell japanese style street foods that are very affordable in price considering NYC. I ordered 2 Octopus Takoyaki Â ($8.95 each, recommend) and Shrimp Soy sauce yakisoba ($11.95, little bit salty for my taste), as well as Kara-age ($8.95 recommend) with 3 beers ($6.95 each) which came out to be ~$70 including tip and tax. Â I recommend checking this place out if you want japanese street food with some beers:)

DokoDemo is a small shop tucked away in St. Marks where I believe the owners/employees are Japanese from reading prior Yelp reviews. They were super welcoming and have accommodated both indoor and outdoor seating. Â The menu is quite simple but the theme DokoDemo seems to have is for simple Japanese comfort food and they definitely get 10/10 stars for that with their takoyaki. Â They make it fresh right in front of you and wow is it delicious. Please don't delay in eating them and just savor every bite while it's hot. Â I can't describe exactly how takoyaki tastes but what I will say if you've never tried it and want to, definitely visit DokoDemo because their takoyaki precedes any other versions I've had. Â I definitely see myself visiting with friends and trying the okonomiyaki and yakisobabas well.

Came in for the first time looking for some comfort food and the fried chicken bowl definitely delivers. Ordered online for pickup and got there a little early but they were super quick anyway. The guy who handed me my food was also really cute :)
No comment
Great value and great taste! Miss the okonomiyaki here, but the yakisoba is still really good. Good vegetarian options too.
No comment

I got a very well seasoned okonomiyaki with strong flavors of mayo, sauce, ginger and lettuce. Its so very fresh! Pork addition is extra $0.75 but wow wow wow... worth every penny. It's not the dry stuff but the melt in your mouth kind of pork stuff that food dreams are made of. Â They sell an okonomiyaki burrito on the menu but you gotta ask for the okonomiyaki; which is not on the menu. I think it's like around $15 bucks but it is worth every succulent morsel of savory goodness. The portion was smaller than i wanted but was just enough to curb the hunger pangs. It opens at 11:30am I think and closest subway stop is F to 2nd Avenue or 6 to Astor place. If you want to pretend you are in streets of Japan without going there; this is the place in the city. Kind and attentive staff.

the food here was delicious. the portions are perfect and the prices are cheap. the noodles were well cooked as well.

Surprised how good this mishmash of Japanese ingredients was! A little too salty, but otherwise delicious + medium is the perfect level of spice (and the rice was the perfect blend of overcooked crispy bits and fluffy bits). Recommend the chicken over the pork. Will be back to try the takoyaki!

Wow poor DokoDemo. This place used to be so delicious and I would get it every other day for years. After covid they cut costs for sure. Most of the original staff is gone, tiny portions, meat was undercooked and I basically got the food container tossed at me in the most unjapanese way. Having been to Tokyo, I can say the only place this place would fit "authentic Japanese street food" would be at Japan, Oklahoma
Pretty good variety of takoyaki and other eats. Â Yakisoba, ramenfried, fried chicken... Would have been good if they had udon too.... Nice and clean.. Great service...

came here after japan fes. in terms of takoyaki price, it's pretty good for nyc and cheaper than nearby japanese restaurants. However, a little disappointed in the original takoyaki. There's not much flavor and just "saltiness". Good amount of octopus filling and the wasabi one has a good kick

I tried the chicken okonomiyaki here for the first time after a recommendation on a date. The service was good and the food came pretty fast. The food was pretty good. No real complaints. It was also more filling than I expected it would be. This is my first time trying this dish but it definitely isn't my favorite japanese dish so I am not sure if I would get it again but that's just a matter of my taste. I'd probably give it a 3.5.
I keep coming back here despite it being about a 10min walk away. I've had almost everything on the menu and every time am thoroughly impressed with the quality and flavor of the dishes.
I got the Yakisoba noodles with chicken, Upon eating I find two huge pieces of raw chicken in my meal and when I told the workers they just hit me with a " damn that sucks".
Favorite takoyaki place in town. all their plates are made to order freshly. inexpensive and good food!
Passed by one time while trying to find another restaurant and this place has solid food and a solid atmosphere. Definitely will come again!
No comment

Food quality was good, the reason for the low rating is the discriminate/selective service on menu items. We came in around 12pm and my friend and I both ordered beef bowl - it was very delicious! However, we were hoping to also order some takoyaki to share but unfortunately we were told the item wasn't available. As we finished our meal and we were on our way out (30 mins later) a customer came in and to our surprise was able to order takoyaki! Very disappointed at the selective service and why we were denied to order such item!
Awesome spot for takoyaki! I found the location super cozy too
No comment

The food was absolutely delicious and it came fast. Best of all, we came in late, at closing, and yet, the staff (led by Ned along with Masa and Rick) was so gracious to us. They made us feel welcome and didn't rush us. Ned even came over to help us think over our selections. We will be back!
No comment

Meh, I had high expectations for this spot as I love Japanese street food (okonomiyaki, taiyaki). I wasn't a fan of the flavors. I only tried the okonomiyaki, but I found it very heavy compared to other ones I've had in Japan. They put some kind of fried crisps on top, which I wasn't the biggest fan of. I wish they at least served pickled ginger with it! Also did not come with bonito flakes. Maybe it was a regional speciality that I haven't had before, but I still found it too heavy to finish.
This is the place to go for affordable Japanese eats. The takoyaki is delicious and so are the stir fried yakisoba plates. Can't believe that food this good is this affordable.
No comment
No comment

Came here for lunch and ordered the veggie okonomi-yaki. However, I was given the pork one instead. The okonomi-yaki itself was way soggier than expected. Service is friendly and efficient, but not sure I'd be back again.

So glad this place was open on Christmas Day! It hit the spot and satisfied our craving for Japanese food! It was very well done, they used pork belly for the okonomiyaki, the octopus in the takoyaki was fresh and the batter was delicious. The chicken in the "fried chicken bowl" and "chicken yakisoba" were so tender on the inside and crispy on the outside! The noodles in the yakisoba was different from what we've had before, it tasted like it was hand pulled (very fresh)! Â It was our first time trying this place and will definitely be going back because we love okonomiyaki and takoyaki and have not found a place that does this well (before coming here)!

Love the staff! Food was amazing and I would definitely go again. Try the takoyaki and the soba :)

Stumbled upon this place while waiting for my show at the New York theater workshop. It's quick, casual, affordable, and delicious! Not the healthiest but they make it fresh right in front of you. I like how you can chose spice level, protein, etc. wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again but would recommend if you're in the mood for Japanese street food and in the area!

Not my cup of tea. Went in on a Saturday. The place smelled very good. However, even upon seeing my food, I was disappointed. The presentation of the yakisoba was underwhelming. I got the sweet beef yakisoba and chicken Takoyaki and both fell flat for me. I didn't finish either. The over cooked, mushy texture tasted very cheap to me. Won't be coming back. The ratings were so high, which is what brought me in. I was very disappointed in my food. The customer service was good. But that couldn't save my experience here. Wasted about 20 bucks on the these two items.
No comment
It is so incredibly rare to find Okonomiyaki in the states and this place crushes it at a reasonable price. If you want to some Japanese comfort food, look no further.
No comment
Ramen rice is comforting, still on the fence to be calorie-worth though. Everything is sold out on a Tuesday at 8pm? Boooooooo

I apologize for this 4 star review. Everything was great until the 3rd time I visited. I got regular fried chicken. Guess how long it took? 45 stinkin minutes... Now I understand the place was very busy at the time. However I could see the chicken sitting in a strainer in plain line of sight. Other than this complaint I would recommend this place, and the food is good.

DokoDemo was an absolute gem of a find. The food was fantastic, affordable, and prepared right before your eyes. In an intimate and cozy indoor eating space, I felt like I found where the locals go to eat. It is a great spot for ramen rice, and their beautifully curated menu encouraged me to try new things! Everything was absolute perfection and was extremely delicious. Will definitely come back! Super friendly staff made you feel welcomed and they make simply amazing food!

Been here multiple times whenever I'm around, and customer service was always spectacular. A very nice place to grab a quick Japanese snack. The takoyaki and okonomiyaki are delicious!

No comment

Had the tofu fried rice. Tasted REALLY good and portion size is awesome. Already looking forward to coming back to try other menu options! They're also really accommodating if you've got any dietary restrictions!
No comment

Paid over $10 for takoyaki. It was extremely salty, with a single tiny piece of tasteless octopus (which is typical but still), covered in almost nothing but batter. Same quality as street food if not worse, but for higher price.
No comment
No comment

Dokodemo has plenty of seating and a cute "patio" with benches in the front outside. I had the okonomiyaki and takoyaki. The okonomiyaki was very good but the texture became too much for me. It is slightly crunchy on the outside and mushy on the inside. I like the crunchy topping which gave the pancake a bit more texture. The okonomiyaki is cut in half. Half was enough for me along with the takoyaki. The takoyaki was also good. Better than some of the ones I had in the area, but it is a bit more mushy than other places' takoyaki. The takoyaki and okonomiyaki was too much for one person; mushiness overload. I would suggest sharing them with someone.
No comment
No comment

Awesome manager and awesome food. Everything is dished out super fast and every-time I visit there is always a homey vibe. The workers work super hard and are always doing their best to craft the best version of every dish on the menu for customers.

No comment

Small hidden gem that can easily be missed in the busy city. Checked in on a wednesday around 4 and the place was quiet. The workers Â are friendly and they speak japanese. The food was fresh and the preparation was entertaining while i waited. I got the original takoyaki and it was juicy and reasonably priced. Would def come back and try other stuff on their menu
No comment
The food here was so delicious, we really loved it and will surely come back! If only the wait could be a little shorter, but worth it!

This is a really cute little place to eat. It wasn't busy at all when we went here on a weekend morning. The items are pretty cheap and affordable. We ordered the takiyaki octopus balls and then yaki soba noodles. Both were pretty tasty. Hubby really liked the yaki soba noodles, plenty of flavor, and piping hot from the pan. We also got a Japanese pancake to share. The pancake was soft and all the flavors blended well together. So yummy! Good for a quick bite if you're in the area.
No comment
No comment
The food was fantastic and price was reasonable. They clearly put a lot of care into their work.

Decent spot and not too hard to find. Walkable from subway stations and quite a few seats and tables. Nice food and some drinks. I like the takoyaki but the rice was fine. Free water on the side. Nice service and it takes some time so no good for when you're in a rush but it's fine. Staffs are nice and good attitude. Quite organized and clean place, they do have a restroom for the customers to use. Nice place, kind of like comfort food but not too special or too memorable.
No comment
No comment

Great pit stop if you're in the mood for Japanese street food. Spacious and clean interior with a bathroom. Credit card accepted. We came to snack on some Takoyaki balls and they were made to perfection. Expect to wait about 10 minutes as everything is made fresh. Extra crispy on the outside and soft in the inside. Seasonings on top are great and plentiful. We can't wait to try their other dishes.
Best takoyaki I have tasted for a while! The fried rice dishes are pretty good too, and the prices are reasonable, definitely will be back!

We were craving some takoyaki so we walked quite a ways to try this place out. I usually go to Otafuku for takoyaki. Dokodemo has a good selection of alcohol. We went with some nigori sake on this cool winter-like day. We started the meal with cabbage and cucumber salad - soy, garlic, bonito flakes. It was simple yet tasty. Â Next we had the 10pc takoyaki which they brought to our table when ready. I was apprehensive about the chunks of onion inside but it turned out to give a nice crunch in contrast with the soft octopus. Shaking shichimi on top help enhance the overall flavor. If I'm in the area I would come back.
No comment

The food is delicious and really well priced. If you're looking for a quick meal that fills you up, this is the place to go. Their beef bowl was one of my favorites (until they took it off), but the other dishes are savory and delicious as well.

column3: Town of North Hempstead, Long Island, NY
column6: I have mixed feelings about this place. I will start by saying the okinomiyaki is delicious and my partner loved it. But it's bittersweet because I used to LOVE the yakisoba but they've changed it since and it's not so good anymore. They don't have enoki mushrooms Â in it anymore and mine was oversauced and the beef was Â a bit tough. I'm sad because I was so excited about Â it. So come get the okinomiyaki but maybe skip thee yakisoba.
No comment
No comment
The food is sooo good, well priced, and ready relatively quick! I live nearby and probably order from here at least once a week if not more!! Completely recommend!
No comment
This is the best okonomiyaki place in NYC. Love the service, food quality, cooks and location. This a must try and a favorite. Â Eat it and repeat frequently

Its a nice place I will say. However the fried rice had something like ginger in it & I hate it. It was literally throughout the whole dish. Should've let me know something so strong was going to be in the dish.
I'm so glad I finally came in here. It's so unassuming. The yakisoba is delicious. The noodles are so chewy and so fresh. The flavor is amazing and the portion size is large. Love this place.
I just come with my friend and we order Takayuki and okonomi yaki we add spicy Â is so good they make fresh and we can see them how to make it the restaurant very clean and nice Â thank you

Came in for lunch the other day. The staff are really friendly. Greeted me when I walked in and was smiling the whole time. I got the yakisoba with chicken. It was good but on the saltier side. I will probably ask for less soy sauce next time. Â They made the food right in front of me so it was sizzling hot. Good portion and cheap prices. Will have to check out their okonomiyaki next time.
I am sooo glad I discovered this place. I had been looking for good Japanese food in the neighborhood and heard of their ramen rice. It was to die for!

So the flavors were all there, some better than the others but definitely present. What's not there was the value. Everything we ordered felt as if they've tacked on 25% extra in price as to what's deemed reasonable. I cannot believe the sukiyaki omelette is $5+, okonomiyaki is $9.50, takoyaki is $8+, and chips are $2.50. I seriously think they mark up everything just so they can pay the rent. I spent over $30 and was only half full. Considering the food does taste good and their location is not your typical East Village then yeah, this is an acceptable joint to stop by if you're peckish. And it's pay day.
okonomiyaki was so good! Got it with pork belly :) usually I feel like takeout stuff doesn't taste as good but this tasted amazing!
