Ordered a pork Okonomi-yaki and Takoyaki. Â Okonomi-yaki has less batter than other places in the area so it's more loosely formed but still has a nice crust on both sides. Â The pork could be crispier but otherwise pretty good. Â The outside of the Takoyaki tasted slightly overdone (little burnt) but also have it a nice crunch when bitten into. Inside was nice and creamy with big chunks of octopus. Â It was topped with a light dusting of bonito flakes instead of a pile of bonito shavings which is custom. Â Overall not bad and a good spot for a snack.

Hmm... I'm kind of disappointed, sad even. I had assumed (incorrectly) based on reviews that DokoDemo would be able to deliver something close to what you'd find in Japan's street food culture. That is not the case here. The takoyaki has no tako (well maybe just 1% tako and 99% batter). The okonomiyaki is not condensed or "glued" enough together. Should have known since they called it Japanese pizza. Might even mention that bonito flakes were absent from all offerings.

DokoDemo is great. The okonomiyaki and takoyaki are yummy and the prices are very reasonable. I really liked watching the chefs make the okonomiyaki and takoyaki in the back.
Best okonomiyaki in manhattan, flabbergasted as to how few folks know about this place. Anyone Â who loves Japanese style bar eats, give this place a shot, I guarantee you will keep coming back

Great for fast food Japanese dishes! They prepare it right in front of you and has a flavor you'll remember! Nice selection depending if you want your food mild or spicy! Will have to back to try more out and all the other selections!

I love takoyaki so I am always looking for a new place to get takoyaki. On my way to dinner, I stopped by to get takoyaki and the food was pretty good and it came out fast. My review is purely based on takoyaki! It wasn't the best one I had but it was tasty and the place looked clean and nice. I would come back again.

Love DokoDemo for lunch! There's rarely a wait and the Japanese street food is good and large portions. I've had their Pork Okonomiyaki ($9.95) and Spicy Ramen Rice with Pork ($10.10). They make everything fresh so there is a wait for food; but you can also call ahead to pickup.
SOOOOO GOOOOOD!!!!! I had never had anything like this but i recommend the okonomiyaki it was amazing!! also the little fried octopus. Cannot say enough good things about this spot.
No comment

A bit disappointing, maybe I was expecting a bit much. I knew it was more like a take out shop without waiting service. The staffs were nice though. I thought the menu was pretty cheap but when we got the food, I had realized it wasn't too quality and wasn't worth it. The takoyaki was nothing unusual, just plain takoyaki that's sold at other Japanese restaurants. Only difference is that you can see them making which is pretty cool. Yakisoba was the one that was really disappointing. I thought it would be really good as I saw them cooking noodles and stir frying with the sauce with freshly cooked noodles right away but it was just so bland with barely any vegetables or other ingredients. It just literally noodles with some sauce stir-fryed. I can see this place being okay for take outs and deliveries but unpicky eaters.

Fast and delicious rice and noodles. I usually get the soy sauce and medium spice. Isn't going to blow your mind but is very reliably delicious. I need to try the okonomi pizza next time

This was my first time being here as a friend suggested to come try this place after a photoshoot. Really small cozy place to be. It was also my first time getting Takoyaki with octopus in it and it was amazing! I absolutely loved it! Â I would recommend this place if you want something light but still filling!

Love the food here always fresh and I always leave satisfied. Honestly my favorites yakisoba joint in the city. The okinyami so fire and the Ramurice so gooodddddd 10/10 would recommend.

Wow! A taste of Japanese street food at a very reasonable price! Went with a friend who visits Japan every now and then, and this place really brought back memories. The "squid balls" and scallian pancakes were great. But please keep in mind there is a level of acquired taste here. You really have to be "into" this type of food. The scallian pancakes and their rice/noodle dishes are a bit ginger heavy, which the 18 year old me on the past would probably hate. But either way...this is probably one of the best affordable Japanese food you can have in the area.

I LIKE the food, specifically for the okonomiyaki as it's nice to have someone else cook it for me since you have to chop a lot of cabbage. However, the last 3 times (I've been there 4 times) I've been there they haven't had any batter around lunch time. Like isn't that your specialty???? Â I want to give you a better score and I want to take other people there but every time I do you're out of the stuff I'm taking them there for... do better.

I was so excited to try this Japanese street food place. I went to Dokodemo twice since I found out they serve Takoyaki balls. Unfortunately I had a stomach ache right after eating there. The second time my friend also had the same experience. The food is good but wouldn't go back.

Pretty solid Japanese-style streetfood. Â We ordered the takoyaki, which was pretty solid. Â Pretty large chunk of octopus in each ball, but the batter tended to be on the slightly creamier/soft side, which was different than what I was expecting. Â I will probably revisit the scoring after trying the okonomiyaki. Â :)

Not only are these guys the nicest human beings ever in food service, the ramen rice haunts my dreams because it's so fucking good. Holy shit. I love love love their food.

Takoyaki and yakisoba were really good but was disappointed a bit in the okonomiyaki. The taste was great but lacked the crispiness and thicker layers I was looking for. A nice casual place with quick and friendly service.
No comment

This place has been on my list for a while and I'm so glad I finally got to try it! The food is freshly prepared right in front of you and the staff are all so friendly and nice. My friend and I split the vegetarian ramen rice and the Japanese pizza (both pictured below). We loved the Japanese pizza, but wish there were more vegetables in the ramen rice and less ginger. The restaurant overall is in a tight space so know that you will likely be sharing a table with a stranger.

Fantastic the okonomo is amazing. Quick service and very nice folks they have sake and bear but it's pricy

we were searching for okonomiyaki and stumbled upon DokoDemo. It's a cute little place and was super quiet when we went, even though it was a weekend afternoon. The takoyaki were totally delicious and the okonomiyaki was great Osaka-style fare.
No comment
The takoyaki felt very soggy. Although you could order extra crispy, I don't think there would be much of a difference. It was not worth $9 for the small amount of fillings in the takoyaki

Fresh and affordable takoyaki in the East Village. Â Compared to other places, the takoyaki costs either 4 for $4 or 8 for $7. Â The interior looks very modern and have stools instead of tables. Â The takoyaki here is very fresh, as you can eat it a minute off the takoyaki grill with all the toppings. Â You can taste the ginger, the vegetables they put inside, and most importantly, you can feel the octopus, but the taste of the octopus was a little bit off. Â If you like some spicy, add some takanotsume seasoning to taste. Â Inside of the establishment, there is a free water available and you can see them making the food. Â I would probably go here again to try the okonomiyaki or the yakisoba or even return for fresh takoyaki. Â Again, very fresh Japanese snack food at affordable prices!
No comment

I ordered a spicy chicken okonomiyaki -- not spicy at all, delicious nonetheless. You will experience lots of textures in your mouth. My friend ordered ramen rice and takoyaki. Her comment on the ramen rice: "I can make this at home with leftover rice and ramen." Agreed. We were both satisfied with the takoyaki. Great sauces.
The food was okay, but just okay. It was like the Japanese street food you can get at other Japanses restaurant in East Village, like Kenka, with actually higher price. The choices were limited.

DokoDemo serves some of the best Japanese Street food in the East Village. Skip St.Marks and walk a couple blocks here where the food is clean, delicious, and traditional. The takoyaki balls are a umami bomb along with their japanese pancakes and noodles. Come here for a snack, drunk food, or lunch.
No comment

Great place to go if you want a steaming plate of some fresh yakisoba. One of my favorite Japanese dishes, definitely coming back when I'm craving fried noodles. A few high tables available for seating, stopped by for a quick dinner on Monday night and not too busy.
The Takoyaki balls are fresh-made! Looove the crispy outside and creamy inside. Another must-try is their Ramen Rice! I love the soy flavor. And the Okonomiyaki with cheese can be the next level!

Fast quick japanese food made by actual Japanese people! The okonomiyaki was great but the octopus inside of the takoyaki was a bit tough to chew. This was probably because it was not freshly bought and probably refrigerated before being used in the cooking. The pricing is decent and all of the food is made after one orders. Will probably visit here again!

Always a sucker for teppanyakis and DokoDemo is certainly serves quality street food. Of all their offerings, I would recommend their okonomiyakis, takoyakis, and yakisoba (in that order). Everything is made to order in front of a glass panel so it's nice to be able to see the love and care they put into your food in front of you.
No comment

Great little spot in the East Village. Excellent takoyaki and yakisoba. Â Made to order. Fresh, hot and delicious! Welcoming vibe and good tunes to boot. Authentic Japanese street food experience. Â Highly recommended. Coming back to try other items on the menu next time.
Delicious. No wait on a Sunday night. Best takoyaki I've had. Plum wine and beer available. Nice staff. Upbeat music playing. Nice laid back atmosphere.
No comment

Solid food, quick service and always seating. This place is priced decently for street food and has a concise menu that focuses on takoyaki, yakisoba and okonomiyaki. Personally, I'm lukewarm about the takoyaki -- wish it didn't crumble as fast and held together better when I start eating it. The pork yakisoba is quite delicious though and matcha chips are worth a try IMO.

Delicious, you can watch them make your food from scratch. It takes about 5-10 mins but it's fresh. And that's what's nice to see. Taste wise, the okonomiyaki was fresh, fluffy and flavorful with amazingly balanced flavors and crisp veggies. I could eat 5 of them easily. The takoyaki was great but can't hold a candle to the okonomiyaki when it comes to overall deliciousness. They are great for an on the go food!
No comment

I stopped by for a quick snack in this unassuming little restaurant and came out having enjoyed an amazing plate of rice and noodle ramen. Â The food had so much flavor and the ambience was quaint and cozy. Â It's nice for a quick bite or a sit down meal with friends/family. Â I saw so many different people walk in and out of this place - I knew they were on to something!
No comment
No comment
No comment
The ramen rice was delicious. Not sure where the ramen comes in. I'd describe it as delicious fried rice Japanese style. It's order on the counter pick up your food. Great value for delicious food.

Went to Dokodemo on their opening night and I see great things for this new East Village gem of a restaurant. They have a simple menu with a couple offerings that all make for a well-rounded tasty meal. The food is made to order and is very fresh, and you can see the chefs take personalized care in your dishes to provide an excellent dining experience. Â I had the beef yakisoba and the shrimp takoyaki, and both were fantastic. Â The beef yakisoba had a very clean refreshing feel to it; not oily or too much sauce. The shrimp takoyaki had a soft texture that bursts with flavor. Overall, both items were very satisfying and I'd definitely order them again! Â If you're in the East Village and want to try Japanese street food, this place is one to visit!

They have the best takoyaki!! The takoyaki are fluffier than pillows and delish. I will be back to try their yakisoba and ramen rice dishes. Service is always great and there is ample seating so it's good for a casual lunch too.

We heard great reviews about this place and was surprised that it was not packed when we came on a Saturday evening. We ordered 8 takoyaki with octopus and they were good and delicious. It was better than the ones we had in toronto but too bad they were on the smaller side. We didn't didn't try anything else and left still a bit hungry.
No comment

I came here after reading all the rave reviews. The owner(?) was very friendly and gave me recommendations on what to order. I ended with the ramen rice with tonkotsu base, chicken over rice, and the takoyaki balls with octopus. The first few bites were great, but as I continued eating, I realized that the food was very salty. I guess this is street food and maybe is meant to be shared. Â If I come back, I would order the dishes with the sauce on the side. Â They put way too much on top.

This place makes yummy Japanese "street" food. They specialize in Takoyaki, Okonomiyaki and Yakisoba. The place was not crowded. I prefer it to be this way , but I am sure it will become popular soon. I think it's a great place for a snack. The prices are not too bad, mostly under $10 (unless you add things). Takoyaki was my favorite. Sukiyaki Omelet was delicious but my stomach couldn't handle the heavy oils from the fatty meat.

My friends and I came here for a quick bite before our bar crawl on a Saturday night. The place wasn't too packed and it was very inexpensive and fast to order! My order cost around $12 (Ramen Rice and a coke) and was ready within 5 minutes. We were able to find seating albeit we had to rearrange the chairs a bit. It was a bit squished but nothing to complain about! The actual food was very delicious! I like that you can choose what spice levels you want and they have Sriracha and pepper flakes if you need even more spice. They have a bathroom, which is super tiny but it was clean and served its purpose. Overall, kind and efficient staff, yummy and affordable Japanese cuisine!
No comment

Incredible, I live in the neighborhood and have been 8 or 9 times now. Get the same thing every time.... tonkotsu yakisoba Â with pork and veg. So flavorful, creamy, savory, and great portion. Go for lunch, dinner, or late night snack. Unique in the village and really delicious.

My friend brought me to this new Japanese pancake place. Their okonomiyaki, Japanese style of pancake is fluffy. I loved their pork one. However, my best is their sukiyaki omelet, steak in omelet. The egg is fluffy and the steak was well seasoned. It's good combination! I'll definitely come back eat them again!
No comment
No comment

A friend mention there is new takoyaki place settled, so came by give it a try, Ordered beef omelette, takoyaki, and okonomiyaki, the omelette is the best, taste just right!!! Â every bite is so juicy, n flavory, takoyaki is HUGE!!! Not like any other Japanese places, but its little salty, but it's all good. Will come back visit again!!!!

I was skeptical at first because I had never heard of this place but the service is pretty good and they make Â the food when you order it, the takoyaki was really good and I liked the mixture of textures, it was a chill place to enjoy lunch with a friend.

I have been craving Japanese street food for so long and finally had a chance to fulfill my craving at Dokodemo. I came here for lunch and was surprised the restaurant isn't more busy. I ordered the beef okonomiyaki. The portion was a bit small, but definitely enough for lunch if you're not a big eater. It tasted very similar to what I had in Osaka, with cabbage and runny/soft batter in between. The whole thing is topped in okonomiyaki sauce, mayonnaise, dried bonito flakes and tenkatsu (fried tempura batter). The copious amount of tenkatsu really made the dish and I especially loved the crunchy texture in every bite.

Takoyaki here is amazing! We got the 8 pieces for $8.50. Order up at the cashier and sit wherever you want. There's not that much seating, maybe enough for 20 people. They make the takoyaki upon order, so it's super fresh and you may have to wait a bit for it to finish cooking. We waited about 10-15 min for ours. Trust me, it's worth it. It's juicy, full of flavor, and filling. I'll be back to try other things in the menu for sure!

I came here with a group of friends and we all got the ramen fried rice and it was amazing. It was so interesting and unique that I can't wait to come here again. It is kind of small but it is a great place to get and affordable meal with a great portion size. This place has made it on my restaurant list.
I came with friends tonight for the first time. They taste just like what u get in Japan. Â Will come again for some more.
No comment

I came here midday with a friend to try it out. It wasn't busy. Â We ordered the beef stir fried ramen and the chicken japanese pizza and they were just okay. Â I had really high expectations from the reviews but it didn't wow me. Â There was a really strong ginger taste from both of them which i didnt really like. Â I think there was like shredded lettuce or something that gave it a little crunch on them but it didnt really taste good because it was like hot lettuce. Â But overall the place is a nice little spot, nicely decorated and clean. Â The service was great and the food came out super quick.

Love at the first try ^^. Very delicious Takoyaki and Okonomi-yaki Pizza. They serve mostly togo but having the food just right after its done is fabulous. Love the atmosphere, clean, and friendly staff. Definitely recommend!

A new spot in the East Village, DokoDemo is a great spot to stop by for a snack before a night out drinking or eating. I had the octopus okonomiyaki and it was delicious. It takes about 15 min for each order and everyone there is so friendly. I would definitely come back to DokoDemo in the near future.
Ordered the noodles with beef and got extra chicken. It was good, a bit greasy but also a bit dry. Â The packing was pretty good.
No comment

Authentic and super yum Japanese food! It's perfect for lunch or snacks when you're hungry. The owners are Japanese, and their pricing is really reasonable! Love yakisoba, Japanese noodle with soy sauce! Sukiyaki omlet is gorgeous, and it's less than $5. Really great pricing! Will come back again!

Came here couple days ago, ordered yakisoba with pork and Takoyaki. Takoyaki was mediocre. Tasted too burnt like deep fried, same taste as some local restaurants, not special. I had better one in the city. Of course Takoyaki is way much better in Japan especially Osaka.. Yakisoba was better than Takoyaki, but the portion was so small. I was hoping a big size, kinda pricy with a small portion. Well if you want to spend same money and get enough food, I think there is a better choice in St' marks.

Amazing hidden gem located in the East Village. Dokudemo is, at is core a true delicatessen. The moment you walk in the door Its a Rush of amazing aromas, flavors and Sensations... hits you in the face like a Bruce Lee front kick. This delicious noodle shop is definitely a place to enjoy when you are in the city. Open Late till 10:30, so after a late rough day at the office, you know you can still have something to look forward to.

After coming home from an extensive trip to Japan, I was craving Okonomiyaki more than anything I've ever craved in my life, Dokodemo has satisfied that craving time and again. It is the real deal. Everyone working here is very kind and the food they serve is very authentic. I couldnt recommend a restaurant more in the city. Get an Okonomiyaki, get some takoyaki and you'll see why.

Nice bite to eat in east village. It's a serve yourself styled place, kind of fast casual. I tried the pork okonomiyaki, which was pretty flavourful. Serving size is on the small size. For a fast casual place the wait was not super quick, it took 15ish minutes to make.
No comment
No comment

I found out about this place on Yelp while trying to check out new business in the city. This popped out and the food they have is one of my favorites so i decided to give it a try. Me and a friend got takoyaki, pork okonomiyaki, and cabbage with garlic and soy sauce. The takoyaki was very crispy, maybe a bit burnt but it was good. The okonomiyaki was delicious, the cabbage was shredded to bits and the crunchiness of the cabbage went well with the batter and pork. The cabbage was why I took 1 star off. I loved it, but it was too salty and too garlicky. They add lots of bits of garlic and soy sauce so I had to drink water once in a while. Maybe a bit less garlic and soy sauce may be better. Overall, I find this place worth to visit more than once and I would definitely come back. (That's because I didn't get to try the matcha potato chips)
First time here. My friends and I had the ramen rice, yakisoba, and takoyaki. All were very good. Will definitely come back.
No comment

Got the pork fried ramen, beef okonomiyaki, and octopus balls. The pork and beef was mostly fat with some gristle, very little meat. The octopus was fairly chewy. Mediocre overall. The fried ramen was the most flavorful.
No comment

DokoDemo was a random find in the city around Saint Mark's late on a Monday evening. There was no one else in the restaurant but there were some loud men right outside the door, drinking. It almost threw us off. Luckily, we still ventured inside. The takoyaki octopus balls were flavorful and quite large. I shared an order with my husband and it hit the spot. We split the okanomiyaki which was more than enough for us. Since it was our first time there, the workers were very kind to answer our questions and gave us suggestions.

I ordered soy yakisoba with pork. I don't know what to expect. There were four flavors to choose from and whenever i order yakisoba from other countries, there are no flavor choices. It was okay for me. Nothing too exciting about it overall. Staff was nice though. Also, if you will be eating in, be prepared to smell when you get out. The strong stir fry smell will stay with you until you get home.
No comment

Staff was really nice and the place was clean. The kitchen area is open so you get to see them make your food. Food was delicious but a little too heavy for me, and I would ask for less mayo next time; it was overpowering the okonomoyaki a little. Most places put too much batter and not enough filling but Dokodemo has a little too much filling for the amount of batter so it didn't hold together super well (better too much than too little in this case). Didn't get the takoyaki but it looked really good, so I'll be back

I stan for this place. Food is made fresh and quickly, and the ramen fried rice is something i love DEEPLY and never knew that i needed. Spacing is limited so i highly recommend takeout, but the bathroom is clean and the staff is incredibly kind. Definitely a new favorite for me!
No comment

Don't usually give reviews but this place was great. My wife and I ordered the Yakisoba she had it with beef and I choose octopus. The soba had a great texture and a great chew to it. We had also ordered the Sukiyaki Omelette and that was our favorite. The flavor and then texture of the omelette was sooo good. Best yakisoba joint in NYC hands down and will be back for more

The food was delicious! We had the Rice Noodle bowl w/ beef and the octopus balls. Really flavorful but not spicy and had umami...so good! We stayed until closing and before we left, the owner Shin asked how we enjoyed our meal. Really nice guy and especially appreciated his friendliness and passion for his business. We'll definitely be back.

I just love it here SO much. The okonomiyaki and takoyaki are so authentic and tasty. We try to visit Japan each year and when I'm not there I miss the country and the wonderful food so much. DokoDemo really transports me back to Japan. If I lived closer I'd beat there every week!

Ever since Otafuku went downhill I have been looking for a good alternative. Doko demo really delivers! Everything is super tasty! Tako yaki, yakisoba and especially the okonomiyaki. Also serving drinks now.

Great place, got sweet chicken yakisoba and pork okonomiyaki, and it was amazing. Heard about this place like a year ago and have been trying to get here since. Food is great, staff is cool. 10/10 would snack again.
No comment

I had a great meal at DokoDemo! This is a fast casual spot-- which is important to note, as the cool signage makes it look like it could be more formal. We tried a few of the really fun dishes, like the mixed fried rice and ramen which was my favorite, the pancake and the takoyaki. All were really delicious, inventive and flavorful. I look forward to returning soon-- it would be the perfect meal to nurse a hangover.
No comment
No comment

So freakin down with this place. They have a tiny menu, but everything on it is delicious. Such fair prices for great ingredients. To top it off, it's usually very quiet during lunchtime, so it's an ideal place to relax and eat some great food during the week.

Love the Osakan foods here. The okonomiyaki was very savory and full of ingredients, takoyaki was both flavorful and incredibly hot (it aint fresh if it doesn't singe off a few nerves), and the omelette was delicately rich (does that make sense?). I only wish the portion was a little bigger but that's a testament to how good it is.
No comment
Excellent japanese street food. Love their fried rice and takoyaki balls with calamari. Very reasonably priced and good portions, I love to pop by this place when I'm Downtown.

Big fan. Simple, no fuss food and it just delivers every time. Consistency is underrated, but if you value that then Dokodemo is going to be a good fit for you. Lunch is relatively inexpensive and that's why it's my go-to most days.
Ordered the yakisoba, ramen rice, okonomi-yaki, and takoyaki to share. Â Enjoyed them all. Â Clean and very fast.

Small, modern location that offers some great food! It offers a good variety of Japanese cuisine with many options to customize as you wish. Decent prices as well. This is a small restaurant with a modern yet relaxing atmosphere to bring friends.
No comment
Having lived in Osaka, I'm particular about Okonomiyaki. I'm not exaggerating when I say DokoDemo is in my top three favorite okonomiyakis I've eaten anywhere.
Nice little spot in the east village. I like the chicken yakisoba best! Much better than most yakisobas i've had so far. Good job.

I came here around 4 pm so it wasn't that packed. I got the okonomiyaki for about $9. Service was fast. Food took about 10 mins. The okonomiyaki was delicious! The sauce was very tasty and they give you a decent amount for what you pay. I just wished they put more bonito flakes :( They barely put any on. It's good for when you wanna grab a quick bite near NYU campus.
Very very good okonomiyaki (Japanese pizza they call) place in nyc. Probably the best in the city.
Okonomi-Yaki is one of those dishes that looks much better than it actually tastes, but the one here was awesome. Highly recommend.

This place is so reliably good! The okonomiyaki and yakisoba are so fresh and good. Their new ramen rice is so good I ate the whole thing in one sitting. We get it to go and then walk over to Washington Square for lunch in the park. Highly recommended!

I have never tried authentic traditional Japanese Yakisoba but compared to the ones offered at various "authentic" chain restaurants, this by FAR hits the ball out of the park. Not only good music, ambiance, decor, the staff is amazingly friendly and welcoming. Good food plus good service? What more can you ask for.
Tasty food, need more of these gems in NYC. Fresh food prepared as you order with kind faces behind the counter. Yum
Great ramen rice! Good branding and clear menu. There's 3 big tables for 18 seated in the restaurant. Takeout or eating there
The ramen for rice is pretty good and the price only about $11 .its tiny and kind hard to find it the place

Went one time, loved it. Returned a few days later and got a pretty bad case of food poisoning. Such a shame because the first time was so good. Writing this review on the toilet because I've been stuck sitting here all day.

Since discovering Okonomyoaki in Japan I have been looking for a go-to spot in NYC. Look no further. DokoDemo does a great job making this meat and cabbage omelette (I went with the shrimp as my topping). The chef - a friendly guy from japan, told me he opened tons of these stores in Japan and now is trying it in NYC. I would say that in Japan they also have noodles, so its a little lighter of a meal in NYC. Nevertheless, for the price (Under $10) it was a great meal in a very chill atmosphere, no frills seating. Anyone walking toward the east village should stop by here for an authentic Japanese experience.

This is a really fun place to eat, in a sea of places that are too serious, too complicated, or just boring, dokodemo is really outstanding in how easy and consistently satisfying the food is. i'm not well versed in the "authenticity" of japanese cuisine but i've had my fair share of it, and everything here is made well and packed with flavor. although there is a sort of fast food structure to the flow of the place, the quality of the food is well beyond what you would expect. food is made to order and very fresh, the takoyaki is among the best i've had (piping hot, creamy, nice chunks of octopus), the okonomiyaki is my favorite thing there, it's layered with so many beautiful textures, and the yakisoba has a great balance of flavor (not too sweet). I'd also recommend the cucumber salad to those of you who like cold fishy salty flavors (i certainly do). Also, the staff here is so nice and are really invested in making sure everything goes well for you. And on top of all this, it's BYOB!

Hidden gem in East Village specializing in Japanese street food . Been meaning to check this cute little place out for a long time and finally went in after our 100th time of walking past it. We got the mochi okonomiyaki umami pancakes (Japanese savory pancakes made primarily with cabbages and grated potatoes/yams) according to the chef's recommendation (super nice and friendly staff)- it was chewy and delicious! Also got the 4-piece vegetarian Takoyaki (balled shaped wheat batter, typically filled with vegetables and octopus pieces). It was incredible and the fish flakes were moving due to heat when they first carried the dish out, which we found extremely adorable. They taste amazing too that we ended up adding 4 more Octapus Takoyaki. The garlic cabbage was very flavorful and crisp though not as wow-worthy as other dishes. With all those the two of us only spent about 20 bucks- cheap dishes, fantastic deal but do note the portions are relatively small since they are all street foods. Maybe hungry humans should also consider getting their ramen!

The food is delicious -- I recommend the chicken ramen and the sake. The service is quick, the prices are more than fair, and the staff are wonderful, friendly, and warm. One of my favorite places in the neighborhood.

The absolute best place for fried Japanese street food in this city, hands down. I brought two friends who had never had takkoyaki or Okonomiyaki before, needless to say they were impressed and have fallen in love with the place. A first bad experience with this kind of food can ruin it for life so I'm glad I found a place to introduce Â and enjoy this food

The place is pretty cozy. Ramen rice and the takoyaki were delicious. takoyaki is pretty hot so don't put a whole takoyaki into your mouth cause you're gonna burn your mouth. can treat the burn with the beverages though. 10/10
The vegetarian Okonomi Yaki tastes great and the staff was super helpful and asked several times how the food was. Will definitely be making a trip back here

I was there twice and very pleasant visits both of them! I am an Osaka native so, Okonomiyaku and Takoyaki are my staple food and I will give them two thumbs up!!! I tried Takoyaki, Shurimp Okonomiyaki and Shurimp Yukisoba and Beef Okonomiyaki is my favorite so far. Keep up your good work! Will be back very soon!
Delicious but not pricy. The cook was friendly, love! The place was quite easy to find and the neighborhood is lovely.

Ordered out one of their Okonomiyaki - fairly tasty overall - liked the sauces used and the ingredients matched with it - potentially doesn't look super pretty but its tastes great! My only thing was that it was kind of soggy (probably due to it being takeout) - would try again though!

This is a cute and casual place for a quick dinner. My friends dragged me here because my friend is obsessed with any Asian street food but it was actually way better than I expected. I usually stay away from street food because it can so often be super heavy and oily but the okonomiyaki is actually mostly cabbage and though it has a rich taste (esp the pork), it's pretty fresh tasting. The takoyaki was a bit softer than i expected but also fresh. My favorite is the pork okonomiyaki though. You can never go wrong with pork belly. All in all it's around $10 for a medium sized meal. The staff are all really nice and the owner actually owns a bunch of restaurants in Japan (92 to be exact ). Would definitely recommend this place if you're in the area!
Okonomiyaki! As and American trying to appreciate the best Japanese street food in the city - they never disappoint on delivery... have never eaten in the actual restaurant('')
No comment
Very delicious food, and extremely friendly staff! Really great place to grab a quick bite!
The Takoyaki is great but others are just ordinary. And for me, the food is a little salty. However the staffs are very nice.
Best okonomiyaki in Manhattan. Â This place is a neighborhood gem! Â The potato chips with nori and salt are also outstanding. Â Plenty of seatjng and a great vibe.
The staff here is excellent! So nice and patient. Food was excellent too. Great price for a nice sized platter. Will be returning!
Their takoyaki is the best in town. Â The guys here are super nice and really care about the food they craft!
No comment
Better than otufuku. Airy and doesn't have so much batter. Good ratio with meat veggie and batter. Make everything to ordee

I popped by tonight to see what was up with this new spot and holy sh*t was I not disappointed! Â I had a few octopus and pork takoyaki and some grilled edamame and it was all DELICIOUS. Can't wait to make this a regular spot.
One of only genuine Okonomiyaki and Takotaki place in NYC! Great for quick bite and drink!

Excellent. Â The noodles in their yakisoba are made to order. Â Made for one of the best yakisobas I've had. Â Lots of space inside which is nice and good ventilation from the grill. Â  Nice people. A great spot.

Terrible. Don't go here if you know that real Japanese okonomiyaki or takoyaki tastes like. I was really craving takoyaki so I checked out this place out and it has high overall ratings so I was excited. Should have trusted the mixed reviews though. I came to the front of the store to see the menu and was unpleasantly surprised to see that they allowed customization for takoyaki. They ask to choose between octopus or chicken and make the takoyaki regular or spicy. It's called TAKOyaki for christ's sake, tako means octopus! Also I have never heard of spicy takoyaki. I really should have turned around at this point, but since I came all the way here, decided to give it a shot. I ordered only takoyaki and took a seat. It took a while, but I didn't mind because I know it takes a while. Finally got my food, and was unhappy that that had only a little bit of very small sized bonito flakes. It smelled fine though. So I'm excited, grab my chopsticks and pick one it. I immediately notice how mushy it is and the poor thing is starting to fall apart as I'm holding it. I eat it anyway, and I'm immediately shocked that there is something crunchy in it. In disbelief, I inspect another one and see that there is undercooked cabbage chunks in there... why?!?! Other than picked ginger or scallion, there should be no other vegetables! Especially not something so intrusive and texture ruining as crunchy cabbage. Takoyaki is supposed to be a delicately crispy, warm, and gooey savory ball of octopus goodness. I was so disappointed. On top of that, there were only 1-2 small chunks of overcooked octopus. Really, no matter how much you're craving takoyaki, don't come here. A good ramen restaurant that DOES NOT specialize in teppanyaki and happens to carry takoyaki should be much, much better. This is NOT AUTHENTIC, please don't get fooled. The only upside of trying out this place is that now I know not to come back.

A very friendly atmosphere with an open air kitchen. It was really fun to watch them prep the food. There is a wait time per item ordered because everything is made to order. I got the veggie yakisoba. The noodles were perfect and chewy. The sauce was tangy and sweet. My family tried the grilled chips and grilled edamame appetizers. It was so good we all ordered more. I would definitely recommend this place.
This is a great casual spot that serves Japanese stir-fry noodle and other side dishes. Nothing over 10$ . Very good way to try authentic japanese snacks
Nice place. Stir fire noodle and soup are a little bit salty. Takoyaki is very delicious.

The takoyaki is simply scrumptious. Nice and pillowy-- the texture is just right! The sizes are the usual size of a standard takoyaki-- some spots serve much bigger ones, but I can't even be mad. It was so good! I've come here about 4 times now, and about to pick up another bite soon. Â Please give it a go!
Fast, cheap AND DELICIOUS! If you haven't checked this place yet, I don't know what you're waiting for. Love the ramen. Just stop reading and go
All I can say is OMG. This place is so amazing. I love the staff, they are amazing. The food is incredible, small menu, but everything is amazing. I come here at least once a week.

Wow the omelette was ah-mazing. The beef perfectly marinated and just the right amount of chewy. The eggs were decadent and flavorful. Octopus soup was very unique and perfect for a cold day. Takoyaki was full of filling and not just dough. Would love try their yakisoba next time.

Surprised this place isn't busier but thank god this isn't yet. Possible the best kept secret in the east village. Small menu so deciding what to eat is easy. The Yakisoba & the okonomiyaki (savory pancake) are both solid. The prices are very affordable and the portions are on the smaller side but adequate. The space is minimalist but very spacious.

Got excited when I heard they offered authentic Japanese street food. I could not wait to try them! The way they Americanized the food is just..weird. The sauce, the veggies, everything together just had a very bad mix. We didn't finish anything we ordered.

Excellent new Japanese spot in the East Village. I got the Yakisoba with octopus. The flavors were excellent and the noodles were perfectly cooked. This is the first US version of the owners successful chain in Japan. I will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu!
Amazing yaki soba would definitely recommend. Cheap easy and amazing. Great for anytime you're in the mood for some good food.

Love it here. My mother and i went after i read about this place online. All the staff were kind and courteous. My mother spoke with one of the cooks in Japanese for awhile. They quoted us it would take 20 mins but only took about 14 mins. Based on service and flavor alone i will be trekking down to the east village often

The pork okonomiyaki is so good! It's decently sized too :) I've had many okonomiyaki with too much batter and not enough filling but this isn't the case here. The batter to filling ratio is perfect. I like the little crunchy things they add on top of the okonomiyaki. I can't wait to try their takoyaki and yakisoba too!
We ordered one of each on the menu and everything was awesomely good. We'll definitely be going back again soon.

Sitting here right now enjoying this takoyaki!! Really delicious batter and generous pieces of octopus in each. Best part is that they're made to order. A lot of places will make them in batches and place them under heat lamps. Not this place ! And that really makes all the difference. Will definitely be coming back

Great spot, so glad I saw the beautiful lamp outside when I was walking by! The yakisoba with shrimp was excellent, and very good value for the price. I had that and the octopus takoyaki, and was delighted with both; as good as any I've had in Japan. I then found out that the chefs have been trained in Japan and the food definitely reflects the authenticity. The staff were very friendly and courteous, and I'll certainly be back - it's worth the trip to the east village just for this place!
Authentic and tasty Japanese street food from Nagano. Super friendly staff. Will definitely return and try some of the other menu items.
No comment
New spot that offers quick Japanese eats at affordable prices. Immediately bookmarked as I am in the east village often.

Stopped in because I was craving some takoyaki. I had a wonderful experience! The owner was friendly and welcoming, and the food was great. Next time I'll order my favorite: okonomiyaki. I'm sure it will be just as good. Great to see more spots like this!

Despite the wait, the food was so worth! I only got it for takeout, but the inside environment was very nice. Music was hip! Menu can be a bit misinformative but honestly I'm sure you won't go wrong with anything on the menu. Would go again. Definitely.
Delicious food, friendly and personal staff and unique beverages. Â This hidden gem prepares delicious food. From side dishes full of umami flavor to the main dish.

The most amazing food in the east village! I'm the local and have literally tried every single food joint around me but haven't realized until now that there can be a really REALLY good Japanese fusion food outside of Japan. Highly recommend. Fantastic experience.

Dokodemo is the crown JEWL of the east village! Not only in the owner a sweetheart and very passionate about his restaurant, but the food is incredible! The ramen rice is my personal favorite - I go in there 3 times a week for it - and the okonomiyaki is also delicious! I don't think you can go wrong with anything in the menu, to be honest. Do not pass by without entering! This place is a must-go!!
The pizza was exactly what I was looking for, although non-traditional. A grilled cabbage pancake topped with a unique barbecue-like sauce.
My favorite okonomiyaki outside of Japan! Â Updated menu with spicy versions, totally worth it.

Found the restaurant by chance and will definitely come back to try the Okonomiyaki. The restaurant has seats for ~20 people so the atmosphere is really friendly. Kitchen are clean and dishes excellent ! We had the Takoyaki & the Yakisoba Shrimp. Highly recommended !
No comment

Aight, this hurts. Â The food tastes good, but no better than the yaki soba I make at home with the same ingredients. Â I have a rule that I won't pay for food that I could just as easily make at home, so this one doesn't work for me.

The food was pretty good, nothing fancy but it hit the spot and the price was also good. I'm giving this place 5 stars due to the business practice. I was originally charged for the wrong item and didn't even notice. Upon exit, the manager approached me and explained the error, and then actually refunded me the price difference. You don't see this kind of ethical business practice everywhere!

Love love love! The Takoyaki. This place became my most chill calm visit snack place with my friends. The staff are so kind and friendly, and they're also beer friendly. If you're ever in the mood for takoyaki and beer, come here!

This is such a wonderful place .... the food is so freaking addicting. I couldn't decide what I wanted so I got 3 meals. The ramen rice was so amazing .... I got the beef spicy. The okonomiyaki was perfect too. The yakisoba was good and almost as addicting as the ramen rice. I don't know what to do next time I come, cause I will want everything again , but also I want to try the takoyaki too ....
This is very craveable food! Go for the pork okonomoyaki and the octopus takoyaki. Puts most fast food to shame. Yes you have to wait Â ten minutes- totally worth it!

Delicious! This spot never disappoints, I'm like addicted to the noddles here, everything tastes so fresh and wholesome. Definitely recommend this spot especially if you want something quick and delicious. The employees are super nice, spot it super chill and cool.

I was really excited to check out this place because I absolutely LOVE okonomiyaki and it's hard to find in NYC. Unfortunately the execution is very poor here. The flavors are there but everything is severely undercooked. Severely!!! The okonomiyaki was very gooey but the takoyaki was even worse, literally a ball of goo that was falling apart. It was so extremely undercooked that I was worried about eating it. Very sad! I guess I will go back but ask them to cook everything longer (properly).
This place is amazing. I've been going since they opened, and each time the food doesn't fail to satisfy. Plus, the owners/staff are all so friendly!
This place is my favorite place for yakisoba in the city. The owners are SO nice, the restaurant is modern yet casual, and the food is fantastic.

I was just passing by here, but it looks simple and cool and I decided to have my dinner. It was awesome and good. I tried ramen-rice. This was quite interesting. And also, I tried okonomiyaki and I even took away to my home. I recommend here

Went for quick lunch and we were not disappointed. Â The takoyaki rolls were delicious. Â So was the omelet with Japanese beef. Â First time I have ever had endamame and potato chips grilled. Â They were great. Â I'm sure we will go back again to try the other dishes.

This is the best yakisoba i've had since being in osaka. I work across the street and i order it at least once a week. The first time i had them send it over, i called the restaurant to tell them how amazing it was. This is absolutely a must!

Food was very good. Â Tried basically everything. Â The Yakisoba was my favorite. Â Must try the Takoyaki balls, so good. Â Relatively small seating. Â Coukd imagine this place packed after a night of drinking. Â Definitely come here

Terrible experience. The omelette, although not too bad taste wise, was very oily and was such a tiny portion for the price. We also ordered the takoyaki, one of my favorite Japanese delicacy and it LOOKED good. But that's as far as it goes. They were incredibly salty and undercooked. I didn't even get to finish one. The taste was horrible too. It was honestly the worst takoyaki I'd ever had!! Don't waste your time and money. You're better off going somewhere else.

solid spot for unique eats. Â these staff was helpful and explained all their options. Â great use of such a small place and their to-go containers made were the perfect sizes for their food. Â I got home and everything was still awesome and not a mashed up mess.

Ordered the Okonomiyaki with octopus, takoyaki balls which was delicious(4 stars)! The yakisoba and the ramen rice I am not a fan (3 stars). I would probably never order that again. Owner is really friendly, great place for a quick snack!
Authentic Japanese street food at a great price. I had the takoyaki with octopus and matcha potato chips - so simple and good, and the owner is super cool! Check it out!
Probably the best Japanese street food I've had outside of Japan: the okonomiyaki is unbeatable, and the tacoyaki isn't far behind. Â A steal at twice the price!
The best yakisoba I've had in NYC. Â The noodle is chewy and firm, and the flavor is just right, not too salty. Â I'll have to go back to try other items on the menu based on other stellar reviews.
Excellent food, simple but delicious. Really enjoyed their version of Yakisoba with pork and classic sauce. The staff are welcoming and helpful. Awesome drink selection too!
just perfect. ramen rice, japanese pizza, all great and cheap

made a yelp account just to give this place 5 stars! so so good. price was right, staff was kind, and the food was fresh. i had my first-ever shrimp yakisoba - a japanese street food dish - and it was super tasty with great garnish and spices. it was also fast (less than 10 mins to make), so it made for a perfect quick lunch. the minimalist look of the spot is cool too.

Formerly Champs, Ro's Diner is almost as good and cheaper, too! Same location, less decor, same black and white theme. Many options for brunch with kind servers. We miss Champs, but this is the next next Brooklyn vegan diner.
No comment
Just walking through the door made me feel like I was back in Spain! I LOVED this place! Staff was incredible and everything we ate was A+++ if you are in the area - this is a do not miss!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The selection of packaged and deli-case offerings was very appealing. The eat-in fare not so good and best to try authentic food elsewhere. I had a Spanish tortilla and found it a reheated bland mush. The morcilla was cold and insipid. The flan, however, was delicious as was the glass of house wine. Â Moreover, the service was spotty and the ordering slow with only one cash register/POS. I'd return to purchase canned seafood and maybe jamÃ³n iberico.
No comment

This place is a G_dsend. We have a similar place in Miami called Delicias de EspaÃ±a, and I sorely missed it when I moved up here. Then, I stumbled onto this place one day while out taking a leisurely stroll in the neighborhood, and I immediately knew I'd found a glowed up version of my go-to. If your a lover of Spanish food, there is no better place in NYC to find the variety of gourmet items that are sold at Despana, It's both a grocery store and tapas bar. Up front you can find sauces, olives, jamon, chorizo, cheese, cans of all kinds of canned seafood, olives, olive oil, vinegar and more, It's like walking into a shop in Spain. In the back they serve tapas and pinxos, which you can take out or eat in a lovely white-tiled side room. If you're eating in and want wine, just go next door to their wine shop and they'll provide the glasses. Typically, there will be sample of olive oil or olives with pieces of bread on the shelf for you to try. Since almost everything is imported, it can get pricey, but the food is great and authentic. You can get an Iberian foodie experience without having to fly to Madrid.

To All of DESPANA in New York, Thank you, Thank you, Very Much for delivering my order so quickly. Please allow me to explain. On Thursday, April 09, 2020 I placed an order and paid for the next day delivery. Because the the order was placed after 12:30 pm. The order was not scheduled to arrive until Monday, April 13,2020. On April 10, 2020 at approximately 1200 pm I spoke with a with a lady at the Woodhaven, N.Y. location. I explained my situation. she mentioned she would see what she can do. The order arrived at the delivery location shortly after. The products from DESPANA are part of a gift for my wife who has been working hard during these incredible difficult times at her hospital as a nurse. The products will be used during a live cooking class I have setup with a chef from Spain online. We shall be making various kinds of TAPAS. Thank you again. She will be pleased. I will be purchasing from DESPANA again. Incredible service.

Love this place. Â I had goat cheese on toasted pan with caramelized onions, jamon iberico, gazpacho and blood sausage. Everything I have tried is pretty amazing. The jamon is extremely pricey but worth it. Service is polite if a bit quiet because of the language barrier (they all speak spanish). The new sommelier wine consultant is a wizard. She picked out an amazing bottle of red based on our preferences. Full body, not too tannic, fruit but dry. She gave us the background on the wine...It came from grape vines that were over 200 years old and untouched by phylloxera so they were gnarly and beautiful. It was amazing. And, I love sitting in the back surrounded by cool marble. A quiet little oasis amidst the bustle. The wines are $10+. But even the inexpensive ones are special.

Great spot, friendly staff, and amazing tapas/salads/and food! When you enter this store/cafe and walk your way toward the counter in the back you magically seem to work up an appetite. Our best find this year. A low key lovely dining room to wile away the hours nibbling at delicacies of Iberia. With Spanish beers in the cooler and a whole wine store next door, you can complement your croquetas with uncommon cervezas and vinos.
Yum yum yum ! Def worth a pit stop in between that shopping . Food is great , coffee is amazing!

46 reviews so far but I'll throw my two cents in too. A word to the wise: Don't come here hungry. If you love good Spanish food, tapas the the like you'll be seventh heaven at this smartly stocked market cum cafe serving the best of the Iberian peninsula. I stumbled upon it and once inside knew I had struck a gold mine of good things to nosh on. I'm not the only smart savvy New Yorker who knows good food in this food-obsessed city of ours [sorry San Francisco, this is the real deal]. Prices skew high but not stratospheric and there's something for everyone to like. Often they have some cheeses and meats on sample and if that won't get you to open your wallet, something else will. I personally could camp out here and eat until they closed - it's that good.
This place is awesome. We had the Picante and the Chorizo sandwiches and loved them both. The gazpacho is also amazing. We will be coming back.

Excellent little place. The tortilla original was light and airy even with the potatoes that were sliced thin. The choriezo in cider was not nearly as spicy as the Mexican version and was also nicely cooked with minimal fat to the meaty sausage. There is a very nice wine shop next door that has just Spanish wines and were well selected as well.

My friend and I have both been to Spain and wanted to have authentic tapas again. Everything we ordered at DespaÃ±a was delicious! Pintxos Majoma and Brandada were two of my favorites. While I might have experienced having tapas in Spain, I was able to appreciate the simplicity of the food, the textures, and the flavors more today (with a nice glass of sangria)!
I love coming here to pick up hand cut data negra. Â Whenever I have time I like browsing here and then enjoying some tapas and wine.

I don't even know where to begin. Despana's sandwiches consistently bring me to my knees. My friend and I have a system where we'll each order different ones and trade halves, and in my experience you can't go wrong. I think my favorites would have to be the Picante, the Despana, the Gallego, and the Navarrico. I love this place I love my friend I'm glad we have our Spanish sandwich focused ritual.

I must admit, they have one of the amazing selections of assorted Spanish meats and cheeses I've ever seen. Sadly, some of their sandwiches doesn't live up to the ingredients, it almost feels as if they failed to meet their potential. I'd say purchase their products and make your own sandwiches at home!

Solid food & setting. The tapas match the fare served in Spain. We had the cheese plate, chorizo picante, bread with tomatoes, and the gazpacho. All the dishes were well made and reasonably priced for tapas(America has a confusing concept where tapas are extravagantly priced, whereas it isn't the case in Spain at all, and looks like Despana is trying to mimic to an extent the pricing in Spain) Oh, and to top it all, the Sangria was fantastic!
WARNING: those seeking churros con chocolate will not find it here (menu needs to be updated). Having said that, the torta was p good and so was the jamÃ³n serrano.
I was so excited when I found this place. Not only is there great prepared food and desserts, but there's also a grocery section where I can find all my favorite things and take them home.
The sitting area is somewhat cafeteria like and off putting, the snacks are not bad

A Spanish charcuteria on the edge of Little Italy, Despana is a refreshing new addition to the neighborhood. Â With bountiful free samples of oils, vinegars, spreads, and other tasties, the lunchtime wait for a bocadillo (sandwich) breezes by. Â The bocadillos aren't cheap ($7+) for their relatively small size, but the ingredient quality is immediately apparent on your first bite into a crispy, warm Sullivan St Bakery ciabatta. Â The meat & cheese counter looks very appealing, with a wide variety, and although I haven't tried it yet, I can hear the chorizo calling my name...
5 stars are not enough. This place is like a bite of Spain right here in NYC. Anything you order I guarantee you will love. Cant wait to go back.

Â I highly recommend the picante (chorizo, mahon cheese & peppers served warm) and the despana (serrano ham & goat cheese). Â I layoff the tomatoes in both. Â The bread for the despana is a bit hard and my jaw gets tired but I still love it. Â I heard the tapas are really good too but haven't a chance to try yet.
If you work or live nearby the sandwiches are an amazing secret. Really really brilliant. 7 bucks is a bargain, considering what they put on there.

New York needs more places like this. Well-executed, limited selection, reasonably priced high-quality food products. Prices are really reasonable particularly considering this is Soho. Good selection of little plates to eat in the small space in the back as well.

GREAT place to buy Spanish meats, cheese, dips, oils and sauces - they provide lots of free tastings of their sausages, deli meats, and cheese and are always extremely friendly and knowledgeable. Service was good. Seated quickly. The food was a little bland but cooked well. I would go back to try again,
My favourite place to buy Spanish food (esp. Jamon Iberico de Bellota) and wine. Absolutely love this place.

My trip to Despana was a cultural experience. I never had Spanish food before. Spanish meaning food from Spain. It was quite different from the Puerto Rican or Colombian dishes that I was use to. As I walked through the door my mouth started to water. The smell was enticing. My vision was filled with fancy bottles of jams, cheeses, and oils. I want it all !! Quickly I began to search for the tables and a menu. I finally found the tables all the way in the back, along with the menu. First thought was, so many choices to choose from. What do i choose? Tortilla & idiazabal and chorizo in apple cider was the first things that I ordered. It was sort of a potato cheese with cured ham mini sandwich. It was quite a treat especially the chorizo . This made me quickly go back to the counter to order more things. Next up was Quijote. If there's anything to try this is it. Dry cured pork loin (lomo) with Manchego cheese and quince spread. Wow!! The flavor of the pork, cheese and quince blended so well together. It was such a delight that I had to take small bites so that I could savior the taste. Check the pictures it ll make your mouth water too!!

Manchego, Idiazabal, Chorizo, Iberico de Bellota, Serrano, Olive Oil, Pimenton de la vera. I feel like this is Mary Poppings and I am singing "These are a few of my favourite things". Fantastic selection and if you have never tried these Spanish delicacies you need to get here now.

This place was a lot of fun - great selection of Spanish import items (some with FREE samples!!), great selection of cheeses/chorizo/cured meats, and delicious tapas in the case near the back. I am officially in love. Thsi place is so cozy,clean and unique in its own ways. Very attentive staff, positive vibe, delicious dishes, relaxing ambiance-a little heaven in a middle of stormy soho. samples of diffirent items are just another sweet detail that hooked me up as soon as i walked into the place.

I had a hankering for morcilla (blood sausage), and DespaÃ±a filled that void in my day. You walk in alongside a refrigerated deli counter with lots of cheese and sausage items that you can purchase to bring home. In the back, there's another serving area where you order pre-prepared tapas. I did find it a bit annoying that they didn't serve alcohol. I want to come back to try some of their other tapas the next time I'm in the neighborhood.
Delicious snacks. The butcher table converted into a dining table is a nice touch.

Only tried one thing (Tortilla & Gambas) but wasn't overly impressed. Â The displays have all sorts of tapas to choose from, but my eyes led me wrong. Â I'd try some of the other things people have recommended.

What a wonderful little shop DespaÃ±a is. The counter and seating area at the back are nice, and they make cute little tapas, pintxos, and flautas that make for a satisying lunch. But I've become a regular for their produce. Their selection of canned and jarred seafood is incomparable in the city - high-quality brands like Cabo de PeÃ±as that are above and beyond what you'll find elsewhere, and at very reasonable prices for said quality. Their counter o' pork, as well, has some real treats: the morcilla (blood sausage) and lomo embuchado (cured pork loin) are among the best I've had in NYC, and they slice their Iberico by hand - which, while expensive, is still cheaper than at many other establishments. Great place to grab a quick bite or put together a meal for later at home. One of NYC's newest treasures, there's no other store quite like them.
We had the Despana sandwich...great sandwich but the goat cheese (although very good) was a little over powering....overall very satisfied...would def come back

Amazing. Everything I have ever tasted out of this place has been incredible. Sardines, ham (yes I splurged on the Iberico), cheese, olives, oh my. And well worth every penny. Just finished the Pescado sandwich. Omg. I want ten more.

It takes me back to my childhood when we would go to Casa Â Moneo to buy Â products from Spain for Chrismas Eve. At Despana I find the wonderful treats and warm staff.

Tapas lovers and Iberian food aficionados swear by this stylish outpost of DespaÃ±a Brand Foods, a Queens-based importer of Spanish provisions well known to savvy New York chefs. Neatly stacked shelves stocked with canned olives, paella rice and mixes, bottled and tinned squid, and jarred piquillo peppers greet shoppers at the entrance; inside, customers encounter clusters of olive oils, vinegars, honey, and preserves, even sugared chestnuts and whole preserved pears. The region's noted seafood--cured fish, marinated anchovies, smoked tuna, and salt cod--is complemented by a solid selection of Spanish cheeses, from aged and young manchego to a creamy-soft tetilla and a leaf-wrapped blue cheese. A meat counter offers plentiful tidbits for tasting, like morcilla (blood sausage) and imported ham sliced paper thin, which are laid out on every surface to tempt novices to expand their culinary experiences. If the samples whet your appetite for more, you can order toothsome takeaway bocadillos, made-to-order sandwiches served on ciabatta from Grand Daisy Bakery
Great tapas and sandwiches! Ideal for a quick bite. Downside is that it can be crowded but that's fine when eating solo - go make some new friends!

A bit pricey but everything is amazing and well worth it. Got two sandwiches and two glasses of wine just superb. Wine selection from Spain is the best around for rare and good bottles, haven't gotten a bad recommendation yet, they know their stuff.

Yummy, yummy sandwiches! Â Perfectly toasted, delicious bread, and great Spanish meats and cheeses. Â It was so hard for me to decide which one I wanted! Â I also love how there are samples everywhere - I tried so many different types of chorizos and cheeses (inluding La Serena!) and love that they encourage you to taste things, because they know you'll get hooked. Â The only down side was that the pintxos we tried were ice cold, making it a little unpleasant to eat. Â I will be back soon to stock up on Spanish ingredients, before stopping by at the wine store next door.

Yes you should come here. It's a great place if you want good food but aren't in the mood for a big production. The quality is excellent and authentic. We shared the picante sandwich and the Despana. Â Great chorizo made on premises and the ham and cheese was def genuine Spanish. We also ordered the octopus over mash potatoes tapas swimming in olive oil. Really tender and tasty and I'm not a big fan of octopus. This was just good.

having moved from spain a few months ago to New York, Im happy to say that deespana is one of my favorite spots in the city. Not only is their food amazing, the staff are friendly and they even have products from more less known places such as the canary islands where Im from. Get the mojo picon (red) for some boiled potatoes. Thanks deespana for making me feel at home!

Despana is such a cute grocery market. I discovered it one day last Spring when I was running errands in SoHo. I decided to give it a try and ordered some jamon and manchego cheese. It was delicious! The food products are definitely authentic! I then went back with my family to create a Spanish-inspired happy hour before we went out to dinner. We had jamon, chorizo, manchago, olives, and crackers with a Spanish wine we had bought somewhere else. It was quite expensive, but we ended up with plenty of left overs. This place isn't cheap, but it sure is a treat. Go when you're feeling the urge for some quality Spanish foods or you're hosting a party - your guests will be so thankful, but your wallet probably won't be!

This is one of the best places for tapas in NYC. Â It is a casual sit down place but that doesn't take away from the delicious tapas they serve! Â The prices are lower than a typical tapas restaurants and you can bring your own wine and there are no corkage feeds. Will be my go to spot for delectable tapas!

Great Place, love the "bocadillos", and i heard they will expand, and now they have delivery....am i lucky or what???? If you love Spain and live in NYC, this place is a MUST!!!! By the way, join the Despana Ny group in Facebook....!!!!
Tasty and reasonably priced tapas in a casual setting. My friend and I had a tasty lunch for $25, which isn't easy to accomplish. I would particularly recommend the pulpo pinxto.
I thoroughly enjoyed lunch at this cafe. Â Nice to get away from the soho crowds. Delicious manchego salads and tortilla Espanola at a reasonable price. Â Highly recommend Despana!
one of my favorite places to go buy random food items i've never tried -- and different versions of things i am more familiar with.

Great Tapas spot and excellent spanish wine selection at the wine store next door. Â Pick your best wine next door and bring it in to enjoy your tapas....lets just say I had to take a few trips back inside the wine store.

I got a sandwich here for lunch this week. Â I really liked it. Â The sandwich wasn't overstuffed, but also wasn't tiny- it was just right for lunch. Â The ingredients tasted like they were very fresh and high-quality. Â I had the Despana sandwich, and the goat cheese on it was absolutely amazing! Â The service was REALLY quick. Â I'll definitely go back!

hellooooo! i love despanaaaaaa! had a few things, and all were perfectly delicious. i just wanted one of everything. so ultra serious. i don't believe there's one yucky thing on that menu. this has easily become one of my favorite nyc spots. do yourself a favor, and go yesterday
No comment

The place to be that have a brunch on Saturday ! There are really Spanish dishes and products !! Th place is very clean with those big tables made in white marble, everybody can sit around. It is a "mid-bar, mid-grocery" place with a quiet atmosphere. Just a little something could be improved : churros con chocolate .. not so good but everything else is delicious !

Authentic Spanish ham, cheese, olives, almonds, and other delicacies. Authentic and no too too pricey (but a little bit). Right now this is my in town go to for arbequinas, marconas, and jamon serrano.
I went there last year while visiting NYC; I am still thinking about them and planning on visiting again this year when I go to New York. That should tell you something!

great lunch place- working in soho this is a great place to escape the hustle while making you feel like your on fiesta in Spain for a hour. yummy salads that's a good portion and delish tapas! And you get to try the samples! :)

This place is freaking awesome. Â A specialty market with free samples of delicious meats and cheeses when you first enter. Â And then a few communal tables in the back. Â Just grab a menu and order at the counter and they will bring the food out to you. Â Authentic Spanish eats. Â Even the bottled water is 'Fuensanta'. Â  I had the Serrano croquette, chestnuts flauta, and zucchini tortilla and everything was delicious. Â Friendly service as well. Â This place was a find and I would definitely revisit.
Tasty. Â Wonderful gourmet to go. Â Try a plate of black sausage and tomato sauce or chorizo and potatoes...though there are innumerable fine selections to be had. Â A "go-to" for iberico ham.
This place is amazing. Love their food to stay and the take out produce such as cold cuts and olives are always in my apartment. Highly recommend them.
I tried the Despana Bocadillo and it was amazing. I thought I was done until I saw some pata negra.Needless to say I had to get some of that too! I can't wait to go back.
Fanstastic food. Â Flat out. Â The sandwiches are so damn good. Â not far from the SOHO shopping. Â Stop in and grab a bite. Â You will not be sorry.

This place is a gem... You will feel transported to Spain. Buy a bocadillo and take it to the park for a lovely picnic (the ciabatta travels well) or enjoy it at home paired with a nice glass of wine. The sandwich size is large enough to share, especially because the ingredients are pretty rich. I find that for the price, the salads seem a bit expensive (also, based on experience, they seems to either be out of or missing some of the ingredients listed). However, I sometimes still feel compelled to order a salad because their homemade dressing is so lip-smacking good!
This place misses the mark on the Chorizo Bocadillo. Bread is thick and there is not much chorizo or cheese. Let down. Especially for 8.50.
All the sandwiches are so tasty and the staff is super friendly! If you love chorizo you have to try one of their sandwiches with chorizo in it...delicious!

Why is this so good? I am gaining weight from the delicious olive oils, chorizo and tinned seafood. If you get hungry while you are shopping, Â you can have snacks in a gorgeous marble sitting area. I love this place!

I try to come by here once a week for lunch to treat myself to a delicious sandwich. I have had at least 4-5 different bocadillos and can say all are really, really tasty! El Quijote may be one of my favorites because of the sweet/salty combination from the pork and quince spread. Highly reccomend!
Outstanding jamÃ³n serrano bocadillo - this has to be one of the best sandwiches in Nolita. I was a first timer at DespaÃ±a today, but I'll be going back for a taste of Spain frequently from now on.

OK I've been here a couple of times already. I make the drive from Long Island Â pay the toll to the Bronx. The food has been over the top each time. The staff is very friendly and the service is top noch.

my gf and i couldn't decide what we were in the mood for, so we opened yelp and i swiped and randomly choose despana. just imagine that "n" has a squiggly line on top of it.. i dont' know how to write a Â squiggly n on my computer. anyway, what a great choice! i was pretty confused when i walked in, because it didnt' look like a restaurant, but then we found the cafeteria style seating in the back. i glanced at the menu and saw the very reasonable prices, and quickly decided that the unconventional seating is the way to go. after consulting with my venezuelan girlfriend about what a chorizo was, we both ordered sandwiches. while waiting for them, the lady at the register told us we could go next door and buy a bottle of wine to enjoy with our meal. score! we ran next door and found that the rose wine was 20% off for valentines day. perfect. anyway, we spent a good hour and a half in there laughing and eating and drinking. such a great lunch. we'll probably be back if we're around the area!

I found out about Despana last week via the internet because I was looking for a local place to buy pata negra for my husband who comes from the South of Spain. Â We got up early this Sunday morning and headed on out to Soho to see for ourselves all the authentic Spanish cuisine. Â My first impression was not of awe as I was disappointed in that an establishment that sells authentic Spanish cuisine would have behind the counter women who were not from Spain (they are Mexican) not the same thing. Â The owner I was told is from Columbia, another let down. Â The majority of the staff excluding the manager who is from Mallorca, Spain are from Mexico. Â  Â As for the bocadillos, yes the chorizo tortilla was heavenly and the cod croquet as well. Â But I went in the hopes of finding authentic churros, and what I got was a Mexican lady opening up a plastic bag of so called churros and placing them in a microwave then sprinkeling sugar. Â I walked out with a big let down. Â If you have to go authentic with the products, at least have a Native Spanish person put up the business and hire family members from Spain, not Mexico.

Cute spot with perfect drinks and great service! Chicken skewers, guac, plantains and chaufa made to perfection with 90s R&B playing in the background. Staff very knowledgeable on drinks and recommendations from the menu. I'll def be going back!
No comment

Cantina 33 is solid in my book. The place is small, clean, and colorful. The staff is friendly, and the service is fast. We always go off-peak. We have been more than a handful of times and never leave disappointed. My kid loves the chicken sandwich, and my sister-in-law and I love the margaritas. . Like others have mentioned, they include the tip, and I don't mind. I am sure they have their reasons for that. If I lived close, I'd be on the HH wave bi-weekly. I highly recommend anyone who loves margaritas to check out this place. I have had the salad and some other dishes, and they were good, but the main focus is always on the margaritas, and they always hit!
No comment

I came to this spot with my friends for a boozy brunch afternoon. The service was very slow (there were only 3 parties in the entire restaurant.) We waited close to an hour for our food, when receiving the food it was cold. And I asked for scrambled eggs but did not get scrambled eggs. There is not a lot of options for the bottomless brunch also. A very sad disappointment.

Cute little place in ridgewood. Enough seating and space so you can have an intimate dinner. We tried the ceviche mixto- choclo was still frozen but leche Tigre and seafood tasted good. Not fishy. More on the garlicky side. Entrees were awesome. Wished the lomo saltado came with yuca fries instead as potatoes were just boring American potatoes. For dessert I would not recommend the churros as they were just over powdered with sugar.

Cute Peruvian place in town. They have a range of Peruvian options. My favorite was the ceviche

What a great find! Sat at the bar with Jules and enjoyed a delicious Watermelon smash that was delicious and refreshing. Â The ceviche was on point, the arepitas appetizer was very flavorful and the Lomo salteado was mouth watering good. Definitely have to return to enjoy more of the food..its very nice ambiance decorated great for pics and the life is beautiful sign is my favorite.

Unfortunately I can't give 0 Stars. Yesterday I had a the worst experience with customer service. Â The waitress was very rude. Â I have never been made to feel so bad. Food was great but small portions. Drinks were great! Music was a little loud. Interior was nice, and clean.
