I was taken back by how small this place actually is. Tiktok and ig make it seem huge - it's tiny. But that is NOT IMPORTANT the food is amazing. Amazing amazing I can not wait to go back. I will get the rum drinks instead bc the tequila was a little strong for my partner and I but thats honestly the only complaint. The staff was pleasant (if overwhelmed) & nice. Service was pretty fast. Tip is included in the price. Will be returning ASAP.
Liked this place nice atmosphere, nice drinks and bar. I recommend. Nice place to chill with friends. Its cozy colorful. Latin music fresh food very clean, good service.

Food is fresh and delicious, Peruvian with a splash of fusion. Drinks are delicious and strong. I always for the Moscow mule or the frozen sangria-margarita mix. Happy hour prices aren't really happy lol (if you know what I mean). The prices are a high for a local venue.

I had been craving Lomo Saltado. Lost my go-to spot during COVID so decided to give this place a chance. The LS was tasty indeed but didnt come with the Verde sauce it typically does. That was disappointing. The Rotisserie chicken was VERY dry. You could see the dryness before even eating it. Packed well for takeout. Cocktails were good particularly the Cucumber JalapeÃ±o Margarita. The Tres leches was just okay. Probably wouldn't order from here again, at least not for take out. Maybe the chicken will be moist in house.

The place is small but the food, drinks and music were amazing. The overall atmosphere was good. It was 4 of us and the wait was about 45 to an hour on a Friday night after 9. We started at the bar and everything from the bar was put on our bill for the table which I loved since we had to wait to be seated anyways. Will go back but maybe a little earlier.

Great food and love that they are pro-freedom! This was the whole reason we went to this place. We would definitely go back again. The only thing I was not sure about was that the server added gratuity to our bill for a party of 3. Had she not done that I would have tipped a lot more. There was not option to add a tip because I wasn't given the option. I am a very generous tipper being a business owner and having worked many years in hospitality in NYC. When I looked at the receipt I could see at the bottom it has "suggested percentages", but again I was not given the option. I also didn't notice anything on the menu that states they do auto gratuity. That was why I gave 4 instead of 5 stars. Otherwise I would definitely give 5.

I want to start with saying the service was great, the young lady was very helpful and attentive. It was pretty busy on a Sunday and she was there managing the whole place alone -.- ! I give her credit . Unfortunately I'm really disappointed but the food was extremely salty! Â I didn't even eat it. We order LOMO SALTIADO + CHICKEN CHAUFA + WONTON the lomo was over whelmed with soy sauce. And the CHAUFA tasted like a spoon full of adobo :"( . Unfortunately I would not be returning.

As a Peruvian I did not enjoy the food served here . It has a friendly atmosphere with attentive waitresses but this place is definitely overpriced with small portions. We left hungry and ended up getting tacos from a taco truck. I would recommend going somewhere else.
The vibe was great, small cute spot. Small servings, service was great too. Food was yummy. I recommend!
No comment

This spot right here is absolutely amazing !!!! I can't express enough how much I truly enjoyed the entire experience the food was amazing the drinks were bomb and our server was very attentive. We wanted to ask her for the chef because that's how good the food was. The half chicken was so juicy you could see all the juice dripping off the chicken before eating it .I'll definitely be returning !

Do not waste your money on this place. Customer service was awful. They were confused when I asked if they had Â salchipapa on the menu , I was very surprised because Peruvians love their salchipapa and this place was just not it. Over priced food that is not worth it. Please also save yourself a trip :) Â If I could give this 0 stars I would .
Chicken stir fried rice was sooo good and the corn off the cob Â Brie the bartender and server was so nice and the drinks were good and strong!!! Will be back very soon

Food and service are spot on! Ordered the chaufa mixto Â with beef and asparagus and the chicken sandwich and shared the tres leches cake. Aaaaamazing! Flavors are authentic and portions were perfect! For drinks, ordered the pisco sangrÃ­a and and a sangrÃ­ta. Both drinks were picture perfect and yummy. The pisco sangrÃ­a was super refreshing. Let's put it this way the food and drinks were so good I ordered more to take home. Must also recognize the service was wonderful, attentive without being overbearing. We were there for brunch, will definitely be back for dinner.
Wow- it was totally worth the trip from the city! I finally got to have GOOD Peruvian food here- Lomo Saltado was so delicious, so as ceviche mixto.

This was a pretty chill spot to catch up with friends and have a few drinks. Food is also really good, I ordered a Passion Fruit Margarita, Anticuchos and fries. Music was bumpin and Jackie was really friendly. Although the place can get busy, it was worth the wait. I live pretty far from here but I would definitely go back.

So freaking good! As a Peruvian American, I can say the dishes I had were pretty authentic and really good! We have the beef anticuchos(amazing), papa Ã  la huancaina(decent/had better but would still recommend) and lastly the tallarines verde(this usually comes with steak but the breaded chicheen was amazing and surprising sweet). Beside the great food, the waiter was super sweet and the aesthetic is cute. Definitely costs a bit more for the area but worth it, definitely coming back soon.
Good food a little $ but worth it. There pisco is good and they're frozen margs are strong but tasty. I have eaten here twice.

I came here Sunday because my sister wanted a drink. Got a margarita to go & tried the Sangria. Now im giving this place 1 star based on the chaste bartender. The drink was 10 & change being that I wanted to give him a tip and only had 11$ I used my card. He asked me if I needed a receipt after paying with my cc I told him no. I got change for a 10 & have him $2 cash tip. You know he had the nerve to add an additional tip on my credit card. Smh I have not called my bank yet because I do not want to wait for a replacement card etc. But how does a person add their own tip to a receipt. That's crazy I've never had that done to me before. I was so shocked. I wish I asked for a copy I know it's hRd times but you do not cheat ppl. It is bad for business!

Love this new spot! I am totally coming back to try more of the menu. The place is so inviting and the decor and murals are so well thought out. The server was very informative and attentive. The entree that we picked was the seafood rice dish, which was delicious and the lomo saltado was PACKED with flavor. The real surprises were the appetizer the beef hearts and ceviche were amazing! Make sure you get the tres leche, it is one of the best I've ever had Â Love this little hidden gem.

Amazing Peruvian Food in this beautiful space with incredible art murals and plants / lights inside. Exceptional Pisco selection. Must try Tacu Tacu and Choufa dishes. Family owned and operated and a great addition to the neighborhood. Great job by Chef Kevin Lenis formerly of Llama Inn.
No comment
Amazing foods so good drinks are awesome and the waitresses are super nice and friendly

I wanted to like this place as this area really needs more places to hang out at with great food, drinks and ambiance. Â The place looks very cool, kudos on decor. I give this place two stars because there biggest problem is pricing. The food is good but not worth the price. My wife and i ordered steak dishes. Both steaks were tough. I wouldn't mind this if the dish was 1/2 the price. In fact i would have came back if the price was cut in half. I just couldn't get over having this kind of mediocre food at that price. I would prefer to continue going to the the very close by Hispanic restaurants for better flavor, portion and again price tag.

A friend of mine suggested I swing by Cantina 33, she worked with the chef/owner. Â My wife and I went for dinner on a Friday, the place had a nice crowd and the bar was full. Â We got sat quickly by our friendly server (unfortunately cant remember her name). Â The ambiance was warm and welcoming, and you got the sense they were going for modern Peruvian. Â The prices were a bit steep but looking at what they were serving it certainly made sense. Â The food was incredible and portion sizes were great. Â We'll be back for cocktails and appetizers next time!
Food and drinks were delicious. Staff was friendly and helpful when asking about the different menu options. Loved the sangria!! I can't wait to come back!!

I'll give it Â 1 star.... the lomo saltado $35?! That's crazy high. The rest of the food wasn't bad at all. I don't think I'll come back anytime soon unless they change up the menu. As for the drinks... piÃ±a colada was terrible! They don't even have a blender to make frozen drinks tf is that. Hope it improves really....

Ventured out on a Sunday evening to this new neighborhood joint for a quick dinner. This evening getting a table was relatively easy as the place was only about a third of the way packed. I can see this not being the case in the summer time. I had a frozen passion fruit margarita. My friend had a whiskey sour. Both drinks were well made. I ordered the pork tacos and he had pork burritos. Â The tacos Â were good- though a little on the small side. I do want to note that I did not leave there hungry but if you're used to more food order the burrito. It was definitely a nice size. There is a parking lot next door- though whether it belongs to the restaurant or the neighboring establishment I'm not quite sure. The ambience is very "Mexican Restaraunt" but I love it. I think this will be a great hang out especially in the summer. The prices were reasonable. They except cash and credit. Ill definitely be back. Really enjoyed it.

Was here the other night and food was so yummy! Service was quick and friendly, wold love to comeback. I shaved a star off because the drinks were small for the price. Two sips and I was Â almost done with my margarita.

Scene was nice but food was just okay. Drink menu was a little scary so I stuck to my favorite- vodka with cranberry. Yours was the best I've had in the neighborhood but $13 is a little steep for Myrtle Ave. Waitress did not know how must of the items on the menu were prepared or what they were for that matter. She was however very polite. I concur with the other reviewer that the entrees Â are not for sharing however I ate less than half of my arroz chaufa and wanted to take the rest home and was told you didn't have any take home containers because you were only opened for two weeks and after my insistence she had it packed and explained that the establishment didn't want to give the impression that it was a take out restaurant, huh?

The food was very mediocre. I ordered the wings which tasted like they were from KFC, I had higher expectations. Maybe something tasty and unique. It was not that at all. I also order the Chaufa rice which was not all that. We also got the arepita sliders, those were pretty great. And for dessert we had the tres leches cake and the cake itself was extra dense, never had a trea leches cake like that in my life!!! We didn't even finish it, we just left it there. The waitress was so nice and always attentive which was awesome and she was friendly and polite, the drinks were good, I got a classic mojito. However I would not come back but it was not anything special. But the place is beautiful! A cute girls night or date night but the food can we way way better.

All the food was delicious, and the seafood was cooked perfectly! The fried seafood was my favorite, a little spicy, crispy, and still so tender. Â Next time we will have to try the meats! The pisco sours were yummy, and there were also other interesting cocktails and wines to choose from!! The ambiance was great too, tropical hanging plants and colorful murals make you feel like you've traveled to a different place! Very nice experience :)

Delicious Peruvian cuisine and awesome pisco sours. Definitely recommend the jalea, it is fried to perfection. The decor is amazing in this place and the staff is friendly and attentive. Definitely worth stopping by for dinner or just drinks, you will not be disappointed.

Came in for happy hour(5-8pm) on a Saturday and I had such a great time here! Pisco cocktail was $8 and it was perfectly made! The Chicken Chaufa($18) was soooo delicious and the flan was bomb! I would've went for the Lomo but it was $35; appetizers are $10 and over. So it is on the expensive side.

Today was my second time coming here the first time was amazing although today was such disappointment the food is amazing that's why I came back I order bottles mimosas and it's from 2 to 4 it was 3:45 and the waitres told me the bottomless finishes a 4 and I was like ok its 3:45 she said the owner says is over we were very disappointed since we came just for brunch â

Went in with my Girlfriend to eat some Peruvian style food and have a drink or two. We was greeted as soon as we entered the restaurant by both bartender and waiter and was given traditional Cancha Corn. We ordered Papa A La Huancaina as an appetizer and a steak with papa and it was very delicious and well presented and cooked, that you dont even need a steak knife to cut the steak. The seasoning is like no other place, unique flavors that leaves you wanting more. The only problem I had was the drink I ordered was a Whiskey Sour, the bartender over poured more sour/bitter making you not really taste the whiskey. The Chef/Owner would come out and present himself, we was honored on meeting the owner and chef of Cantina 33. Would recommend to friends and family to go eat and drink their. Had a fun night and planning to go back and try more food from their menu.

Chef Kevin really nailed the Peruvian flavors in his dishes. Food is phenomenal greatly presented and well portioned! Can't wait to go back for the limo saltado! The drinks are also amazing! Everything is just right!

Really yummy! Food came fast and everything was super flavorful. One of our fav meals of quarantine. Its been hard to get excited during these times but this meal really lifted our spirits. Excited to go when we are able to dine in :)
favourite new neighborhood spot. Friendly atmosphere, impeccable drinks and a drinks and food menu with a really thoughtful connection to Peru. Best drinks and vibes in the area by far.

The place has great artwork on the right side. But, the food over here is just mediocre. Unfortunately, the dishes were overly priced with food of really small portions. The waiter told us the portions were big. The Chicha morada, I was expecting high quality chicha morada similar to what I had in Peru. It was a difference of day and night.. it was like drinking pure tap. If you're not too hungry for the night, this might be it. If you're hungry, I would recommend elsewhere

Dope decor food is excellent and cocktails are delicious! Awesome vibe that me and my friend walked in on randomly! A huge welcome to the neighborhood and is a must check out for great new places to dine or just have a casual drink!!

Wow my husband and I had such a delicious dinner the duck was so tender and the fried fish entree was light and crispy. But damn those prices lol we wish this place was just a little more affordable so we could come eat more often.. we will definitely be back for a cocktail tho. Service was great

Happened to stop by Cantina 33 on their grand opening and was blown away by every detail of this restaurant! Since then, I've been back several times, I just can't get enough of it! The ambience is stellar, the service is quality, and the food/drinks are to die for! When you stop by, make sure to try some of the pisco punch with some ceviche, you won't regret it! Thank you to everyone who works at Cantina 33 for making me feel welcome, answering any questions I had, and creating a wonderful haven of delicious food and great vibes.
Must try Beef Heart and Lomo.. great flavor .. so yummy .. over all great atmosphere .. love the art work on the wall .. drinks and food great !!

My fiancee and I went to eat here on a whim for brunch and absolutely loved it! We had the Chaufa (Peruvian stir fried rice) and was absolutely delicious! Best fried rice I've ever had in my life. You can have it with either chicken, beef, asparagus or shrimp. If you dont want to decide on one you can mix two of them up, we chose asparagus and beef and could not be any happier we did that. We also had the crispy chicken sandwich with the fries which was also absolutely amazing. Chicken was tender on the inside, perfectly crispy on the outside and the fries were stupendous. The drinks were also on point. We had the frozen sangrita and the pisco sangria and they were delicious! For dessert we shared the dulce de tres leche and it was also really good. The service was great! They checked up on us and made sure we were doing ok. Food came out quickly, it was a great experience overall. We are definitely going back for more delicious food but you don't have to take my word for it definitely check it out for yourself and be the judge. I'll just end it with this, I'm a foodie and am rarely wrong when it comes to food

5 stars of th strength of their "the breakfast" alone. How many times have we brunches and couldn't decide if we want savory or sweet? The breakfast gives you a sampling of everything including a pancake with berry compote, bacon, eggs, home fries, salad I mean perfection. A let down is that you can only order the 4 specialty brunch cocktails and not their other specialty cocktails but you can still order other bar drinks and mimosas. I got a whiskey sour which wasn't great but my meal was. Plus they have plenty of outdoor tables and allow you to use their bathroom or the one at the Mayflower. Great food at a good price. Absolutely SCRUMPTIOUS!! One of my favorite restaurants. All of the ingredients are so fresh, the pasta is homemade and the service is impeccable. Best spot!
Excellent food and amazing staff....very friendly. Nice atmosphere. Easy access by bus or train.

Let's start with the drink-a cocktail with Â mezcal and passion fruit! Â had two. Then we ordered the octopus for starters-awesome!! Cooked perfectly with a little bit of char. Was not overcooked! Served over a bed of celery, gigante beans, olives and a dressing-sooo good. And yes, although at an Italian restaurant ordered the rib-eye with an order of broccolini. Again, both cooked to perfection and seasoned wonderfully. The ribeye was a thin, bone-in steak but cooked medium rare! It came with baby potatoes and a yummy chimichurri sauce. Â Ohhh I think this place is going to be one of my favorite places to go for dinner!

GREAT service and delicious food. I had the fettuccine w/sea scallops and fusilli lunghi and they were both delicious. We also had the rib eye steak and it was cooked perfectly -- so tender! I'll definitely have to come back.

Solid spot for pasta. Lots of wine choices, good beers and cocktails. All tasty though we thought the spaghetti was similar to Lo mein and the fish was slightly over cooked (could've been cooked for 30 sec to a min less) since it was dry. Overall, the meal was good. We were a group of 4 and made a res on Resy.

I finally got to come in for dinner, and I work just across the street!! I was SO impressed by the service! I made the reservation on RESY and did mention about dinner being my friend's bday. I was going to speak with our server (I think his name was Peter?) about maybe bringing the dessert with bday candle. Well, I forgot Â But guess what?!! I was SO happy and surprised to see one of the server walking over with the dessert we ordered with bday candle!!! I thought that was very thoughtful! Thank you!! :)

We had an amazing meal a few weeks ago on a busy Monday night. Â The staff was so accommodating of our party of 10. Â Everything was excellent from cocktails to entrees. Â They accommodated some dietary requests easily and were super helpful when ordering wine. Â Most of us never order dessert but it all sounded so good that we ordered one of everything and shared around the table. Â We are so glad we did! Â Dessert is not to be missed! Â All in all, a great night and a wonderful find - we'll be back!

Sat at the bar and shared the Oxtail Ravioli and the Ragu Bolognese with a friend and got an Adffogato and Tiramisu for dessert. All around amazing food- the Ravioli (with bone marrow and sage!!) melted in your mouth and was covered in a sauce so good I wanted to lick the plate clean.

I've been here a few times years ago and don't remember being particularly impressed but we went for brunch this weekend and I've definitely changed my mind. I had the avocado Benedict which was really well cooked and flavorful, the home fries were to die for! Just the right amount of crispy. My boyfriend had the lasagna and he was obsessed. Cute atmosphere too, will be back

The cutest, yummiest Italian brunch I've had! I've regretfully only been here twice for brunch. I would love to go here for dinner one day. You must have their bombolones, they are adorable and delicious. The carbonara for brunch is everything. Carbs for brunch is always a success. The braised beef hash is delicious but I personally could have used something like a side salad or something to brighten up the dish. I wouldn't just have this alone personally. All in all, a successful brunch. It's also a great location and the atmosphere is welcoming.

Oh damn. Went here for date night and I don't know where to start on how good it was. Service was amazing. The server had some great suggestions and were on top of taking care of us. We had the deep fried zucchini flowers and shared the spinach gnocchi with smoked eggplant. The bourbon sangria drink special was off. the. hook. Go here for a memorable culinary experience you won't forget! It's worth every penny!
my boyfriend and i's favorite restaurant in new york, can never go wrong with anything on the menu. The vibe of the place is perfect and the drinks are incredible. worth every penny

What a great find for brunch in Fort Greene. Everything was amazing, from the awesome service to the bombolini because they were running behind on our reservation, the delicious oxtail burgers, fluffy pancakes and super crispy bacon was awesome. Don't miss the oat milk latte and the cocktails. We'll definitely be coming back here for dinner!

Sitting in a quaint little street of Italy and enjoying Fettucine cacio e Pepe...except it's a quaint little street in Clinton hill in Brooklyn . This adorable place with well distanced outdoor seating . My pasta was al dente and I like that. The music was lovely and the food was great. Just the portion size is small for the $$.

This is hands-down our favorite brunch in Brooklyn, or anywhere else for that matter! We go at least once a month and get the classic breakfast & avocado Benedict. I do wish they would bring back the standard Benedict with Canadian bacon, but their everyday bacon is delicious, too. We also love the blueberry pancakes with citrus ricotta cream! So happy that this place is doing well post-covid and will continue to visit them. :)

It's tough to run a restaurant during COVID but the staff did a great job. I had the Oxtail burger and other tried the oxtail ravioli, lasagnetta, heirloom beets, burratina, gnocchetti di semolini and fusilli lunch along with several drinks. Everything was well prepared with only one minor error on a drink. Eating outside was fun as we could people watch while we ate.

My favorite restaurant in the city right now. The oxtail ravioli is my favorite food, I would pick the bowl up and lick it if it was social acceptable. We had not even asked about them because we didn't even feel like it was a big wait, especially on a busy-ish Saturday the day before Valentine's Day. Above and beyond.

This spot serves an amazing brunch!! I came here with a friend on a beautiful fall day and we sat outside. The staff was extremely attentive and friendly. We both ordered the Breakfast which comes with two eggs any style, buttermilk blueberry pancakes, home fries, bacon, and market greens. I know this may seem like a lot of food, yet, the portion size of this meal was absolutely perfect! Every single item of this meal was cooked to perfection. I would love to brunch here again! All I can say is visit this restaurant and order the Breakfast, your taste buds will thank you.

We asked if he could kindly come back in 5 minutes as the clock was about to strike 12 and the last thing we wanted to be using a card machine as everyone around us was celebrating. He said it had to be done before midnight so as the rest of the restaurant was cheering and merry, we were fiddling around paying his tip - which, quite frankly, he didn't deserve at that point. We chose to ring in the new year at this establishment and because of them it fell flat. He should have brought the bill 10 minutes earlier and not at 11.58pm on NYE. Never again.

I'm told that the salmon hash is really good, but I decided to go with the P.E.B.F. I was worried it would be too much food but the portions were just right. At the end of the meal as we were about to close out our bill, the staff was kind enough to bring out a slice of birthday cake for my friend. Icing on the cake as they say.

We dined here while staying in Clinton Hill. The ingredients were extremely fresh and flavorful. The gnocchi and pasta were made from scratch. The servers were attentive and friendly. It has an intimate neighborhood feel that is difficult to replicate. We would have appreciated slightly larger portions, but I would say they were comparable to similar farm-to-table restaurants.

Went here for an impromptu date night and oh my goodness... order all of the pasta. We had oxtail ravioli and some green linguini-type pasta with veal. Always had great meals here, both dinner and brunch. It's a lovely space that feels like a cozy neighborhood restaurant but also a date night/special occasion-worthy spot. Oxtail ravioli is an amazing dish as is the burratta appetizer with bacon, melon, and greens, perfect flavor balance. Two of us tonight shared 2 apps, 2 pastas, the pork belly entree special, and a bottle of red plus the lovely house bread and bread sticks, and the bill came to $125. In Brooklyn that doesn't usually buy you anything close. Service was also excellent. Really can't say enough for a place that has such good food with such a reasonable bill and a low-key but warm and inviting vibe.

This place has a ton going for it. Super cute, great location, staff were very friendly, and prices were reasonable. Nice drinks menu, and it's right next door to one of my favorite bars, The Mayflower. I really wanted to love it, but the pasta dishes we ordered were surprisingly flat and uninspired. We'll probably give it another try sometime, but will steer clear of the pasta portion of the menu (particularly the spaghetti dish w/pesto. Very wet, unsalted, with no discernible pesto...) All in all, the restaurant as a whole was fantastic, but the food didn't measure up.
If anyone's ever in the downtown Brooklyn area and looking for amazing Italian food, try Aita's restaurant. It's a cozy place with great dishes and tasty drinks. And trust me I know Italian food.

Great atmosphere and great service. Had the pancakes and they were delicious. Have never had a bad meal here and often recommend to friends and bring visitors to Brooklyn.

However the pastas were very good especially the oxtail ravioli. For desert we ordered the sea salt hazelnut tart - it lacked any complex flavors and tasted like frozen cake I had from Costco. We would return again but only for the octopus and pasta.
Fantastic service. Â Interesting menu (oxtail burger) but somewhat limited. Â Everything I ate was great.
No comment
The best! Favorite spot in the neighborhood. Always on point, great decor, great service, awesome brunch!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Cute atmosphere but the food was subpar for the price. Got scrambled eggs that I definitely could have made better at home - they were watery and pretty flavorless. The server was nice, but pretty absent - we had to flag someone else down to get our check.
No comment

The best part of this meal were the appetizers, we had a beet salad, and grilled octopus. Otherwise every entree we tasted were pasta dishes that seemed like they could use some help, but the prices are reasonable. I wouldn't go out of my way to go here and won't be back anytime soon.

Went there for breakfast on a Sunday morning around 11 - didn't have to wait because we sat at the bar. The service was great and the food was perfect - I wanted to stay there all day and eat everything. Had the jalapeÃ±o eggs benedict with avocado and I basically died and my ghost is writing this review.

I can honestly say Aita is one of the most quaint brunch places I've ever been to. It was so cozy and brunch was delicious. Even though my blueberry pancake had less than a dollop of berry, it was still an all around good food experience. The proportions were nice and the staff was really friendly.

Honestly one of the best Italian dishes I've ever had outside of Italy! I had the gnudi, and the pasta pillows were so light and delicate surrounding the fluffy, smooth ricotta... just beyond delicious. My friend had the oxtail ravioli, also to die for. I usually wake up yearning for coffee, this morning I woke up yearning for gnudi from Aita!
No comment

Sharing dinner with friends raving over food (and as a vegetarian), I've often wondered if my taste buds are shot. Middle age. Too much strong coffee. Then Aita. The food elsewhere just hadn't been as good. Aita is outstanding food for the price. Please don't go. I had trouble getting a table and want to go back tomorrow.
No comment
One of the best brunch places in NYC. Reasonably priced for great food. The staff is always attentive and friendly. You will probably have to wait but it's well worth it for the Brunch!
No comment

Went on Friday night. Â Really liked the way they re-designed the room. Â Nice sized, comfortable bar too. Â I had a very tasty Rib Eye and my wife had the Stuffed Trout. Â They have a good little wine list with a lot of bottles in the $32 to 45 range. Â While we were waiting for our food couldn't help checking out others dishes as they came out. Â Real new but very promising.
No comment
Yeah this place is insanely good. Everything about it, the environment, the food, the staff, all top notch, all really on their game.

Stopped in here on a whim a few weeks ago. Â We enjoyed the friendly service and the food. Â I had the burrata, which was nice but the real highlight was the cioppino seafood stew, which had a lot of fresh-tasting, well prepared seafood, coupled with a delightful broth. Â I appreciated it even more after having tried a similar dish at another restaurant a couple weeks ago and having not enjoyed it all.

The restaurant has a unique, rustic atmosphere and a great menu. Highly recommend to try one of their home made pastas, personal favorite is the Â cannelloni parmigiana!
No comment
No comment

What a lovely brunch experience! My boyfriend had 5 out of towners visiting him and we had a party of 10. We called many places and as you probably already know it is so hard to find a place to fit a large group. Aita has a table just for that. We got there and it was ready right away. People got the benedicts, salmon hash, salmon sandwich, and pancakes and all were very very good! The service was quick as well. Could not have enjoyed a better experience!!
Very attentive service, comfortable ambiance, delicious food! Recommend the avocado Benedict and the carbonara.
No comment
Fantastic dinner with a party of 6. Totally accommodating--reservation system via their website works well. Thoughtful wine selections and creative seasonal meal options.

simply fantastic food. we split appetizers around the table... and everyone enjoyed bites of the calamari and potato foam (squid ink is perfectly briny) octopus and tomatoes (octopus was perfectly cooked, which I gather is hard from watching people fail to cook it right on Top Chef) and the green tomato and corn salad (so summery.) We also enjoyed the cucumber smash cocktail. If there's a line, its worth the wait.
No comment

We're picky, never write reviews, and are stopping to say we loved it. Classy yet down home food and people.

Was staying in Brooklyn on a family trip and had a last minute business meeting scheduled. Looking for something family, friendly and romantic especially looking for some Italian food, so I got this place recommended by my cousin, but this place is more than what I expected. The Italian dinner with my family was a pleasant and fulfilling surprise.

Came here for dinner. There was only a 20 min wait for prime time Saturday night and were offered a seat at the bar to get a drink and wait. Started with cocktails, which were amazing! We got our table ahead of schedule and ordered rabbit to start and it was amazing! The beet gastric was a perfect pair. For main got oxtail ravioli with bone marrow sauce and heirloom carrot gnocchi with whipped goat cheese. Soooo delicious!!!!! Both are unique dishes and tasted amazing. We weren't sure what to drink with our meal and our waitress, Rose, helped us pair the perfect wine. Once it came to dessert Rose suggested the special which was a dark chocolate flourless almond cake with eggplant. It sounded different, but she said it was her favorite so we went with it. Soooo good! A perfect rich chocolate cake to end our meal! Would recommend coming here for delicious food and amazing service. All the staff were so attentive and made sure we enjoyed everything. Will be back!

Love this place!! I was there for brunch & Â decided to go there for dinner last night and Aita does not disappoint. We sat at the bar waiting for a 3rd friend and asked the hostess how long for a table. She was so nice and was able to move things around because we had been sitting there, but didn't put our name in right away. Once seated, our waitress greeted us and was attentive, but not overbearing. The environment is very cozy and the food is great. Can't wait to go back!
No comment

I have been wondering about this place for ages, having been in the neighborhood for a number of years and walked by it a lot. Â I convinced some friends to go for lunch this week and it was really awful. Â Like, verging on inedible-awful. Â I had the 'Holy scramble', which was shrimp, mushrooms, scrambled egg and salad. Â The salad was bitter and the dressing tasteless and the eggs were awfully incredibly fishy tasting. Â The waitress was not great and didn't inquire about how our food was and was not attentive in filling up water etc. Â A HUGE disappointment.

On a stormy March evening my wife and I wanted a cozy place to have dinner close to our sons' apartments. We walked onto Aita and even though we didn't have a reservation we were welcomed and initially seated at the bar and we placed our order. The bartender and hostess graciously switched us to a table when it came available. We shared the pumpkin and pear soup which was good but the pepper overshadowed the more subtle flavors of the fruits, the octopus and pickled vegetables salad which offered a wonderful contrast between the tender grilled meat and the briny pickles, and the pappardelle with wild boar ragu which was delicious and not overly gamey. To finish off the meal we shared the olive oil and pistachio cake that I thought was just heavenly. We lingered a bit hoping the storm would abate but finally had to leave the warm welcoming surroundings of Aita and face the storm again.

I think I'm done with this place, unfortunately. Â I've been here about 12 times. The food is very good, but the service experience is always so weird and awkward, and frankly, border-lining on rude. They seem to forget that there are lots of places in Brooklyn with truly amazing food and no weirdness. Tonight I was there and there was no AC, so we were sweating buckets and dying for a glass of chilled wine. (Didn't we order about 20 min ago...?) Â Then there rules about ordering as a not-that-large a group. They don't have that "crack" dish that your insanely crave or that super cool vibe that will make someone endure these irritations. And life's too short to be frustrated by their arrogance. Enough
No comment
Awesome service and great ambience. The food was so good! One of my favorite places in the area.

I want to be able to write the hip, foodie yelp review which goes into great detail about food preparation and which dish you should really order, but I can't do it - I can't pick out a few items from the menu to highlight. Â We've been at least 6 times over the past two months and every meal has been great. Â Lovely combination of flavors, well executed, and reasonably priced for what is on offer. Â Tonight was a perfect summer meal with a seasonal arugula and peach salad, seafood salad, and passion fruit sorbet. Â And I got to steal a few bites of my daughter's chocolate tart. Â Quite possibly our favorite neighborhood destination.
No comment
Food is alright but a bit pricy. Tiny yet beautiful place. The menu is very confusing, which seems to me is their effort to make the names fancy.

Love their brunch! I've never had to wait more than 15 minutes for a table and have always had really nice servers. The Avocado Benedict is a nice twist on a classic and the homefries are so yum! Super crispy, drool! I literally had to go back the next day just to get them again.

My family and I went for brunch today. Let me start by saying the food was amazing! However the service was terrible. I have worked in a restaurant for the past 5 years and I know the difference between having a bad day and bad service. It was slow and we were constantly forgotten about. I'm surprised management is not on top of this because they could have turned our table over 40 min faster then they did if our server stayed on top of our order and getting the check at the end of the meal. The hostess was super helpful but her outfit was a little to much for the brunch atmosphere. Anyway I would go back but that's because I understand the in workings of a restaurant and the food was really that delicious!

A beautiful, cozy little restaurant nestled on a lovely Clinton Hill corner with an intimate ambience and delicious food! Service was great as well. Can't wait to go back here for my birthday next week!
No comment
Had a very pleasant brunch. Eggs Benedict with avocado salad and home fries was delicious.

Food and ambiance was great, the servings just the right size. We always order pasta, and the one time we went for brunch, their blueberry pancakes and eggs benedict. It's a cozy spot that's great to go to on the weekends.

Came here for a birthday celebration. Reservations were made in advance for a party of 9. Seating was ready to go on a busy Saturday night. The service was prompt and friendly, "food was very good" was the general consensus amongst the 9 us.

This place is adorable and intimate. I enjoyed a late dinner during an epic snowstorm, and was pleasantly surprised by the cozy vibe. We stayed and enjoyed the view from our booth past closing hour, and the waitstaff was more than accommodating. The food is a bit more pretentious than what you would expect from the decor - small portions and unnecessary garnish. But maybe it was so good that I just wanted more?
Love the atmosphere and the food is amazing. The prices are a bit expensive to eat there weekly, but definitely one to keep in rotation.

This place is delicious! My family and I went here the other evening for dinner and loved it. The atmosphere is perfect for a quaint Italian dinner. We ordered the Braised Calamari and Mozarella di Bufala. For entrees they ordered the gnocchi while I ordered the Green Taglierini. We ate and loved every bite! All the pasta is perfectly made and cooked and every dish has a wonderful taste. I cannot wait to go back!

Great little brunch spot! Love the eggs/pancakes dish I had during brunch. Nice ambiance & friendly staff. Gotta try the oxtail burger next brunch visit. Â Will be returning to try their dinner menu too seeing as other reviewers are loving their dinner as well.
Great neighborhood spot. Â Thumbs up for the roast chicken, any cocktail, and the ability to please the parents.
Oxtail burger is AMAZING!! Codfish sandwich, super tasty, and the cupcakes on the counter taste bakery-fresh. This place is definitely a neighborhood secret, and I'm in love
This place is great! I've been for brunch and dinner multiple times and feel it is constantly getting better. Stellar service and food!

Crazy good brunch spot! NEED to come back for dinner, came here on a rainy late sunday afternoon hoping it would be a little empty - no luck! Sat at the bar for brunch with a friend and had an amazing meal. I had the fried oyster benedict and it was AMAZING, we also ordered some side pastries (croissant, brioche) really good. My friend had a veggie omelete and we enjoyed some mimosas. The bartender was super friendly, although busy and didn't skip a beat. He was managing his bar like a pro! Everything about this place is stellar, love the little small details from the decor on the wall to the bathroom (tons of interesting little knick knacks to be found). Will be back SOON!
There's a vintage typewriter in the bathroom, if you're into preposterous shit like that.

Very enjoyable dinner here, which I liked better than previous brunch. Â It's a tight squeeze, but they do have a pleasant bar around the corner for a cocktail while waiting for a table. Â Unfortunately can't Â remember details of the meal, other than that it was reasonable, market-driven, satisfying all around. Â Will return.

Beautifully designed. Romantic, Intimate. A great, much needed addition to that neighborhood. Unpretentious. A very solid and tasteful menu both for drinks and food, that rotates based on fresh/seasonal ingredients. GREAT wine list. All their pasta is homemade. Both their brunch and dinner are awesome. It's still a bit of a secret neighborhood joint so it doesn't seem to get too overcrowded. I would go check it out before more people find out about it.
I have been here for dinner and brunch. The food and service were excellent both times. The great ambience really makes you really feel at home.
Delicious both dinner and brunch! Took my friends that were visiting from Europe here twice. Love it!

Pretty fantastic, I must say. Tucked away on a corner of a residential block only adds to the charm of this place. Everything we ordered was delicious, and everything else looked the same. I will be back for more. The service was superb and sincere on a very busy night. Stop by their little speak-easy style spot for an after dinner cocktail, right behind the restaurant.
No comment
Excellent food. We've been here 4 times and have had 4 good meals. Hope this one sticks around for awhile.

Been here a couple times. Â Third time wasn't a charm. Â Food was okay; service was mediocre to bad. Â Some weird service about a confused wine order, which eventually was graciously resolved. Â When all was done, was told in that sort of friendly restaurant way, "we need your table since we have others waiting." Â Pity, was becoming one of my favorite places in the neighborhood.

Went here for dinner on New Year's Day and it was perfect. Cute and cozy space, but you don't feel crowded. Everything we ordered was delicious: beet salad, short ribs (falling off the bone), fettuccine bolognese, and the octopus with zucchini and bread crumbs and whatever else was in there- I've never tasted anything so good, it's a must try. They also make a mean manhattan martini!

This is one of the best dishes I've had in my life!!! French toast. The spetzel mac and cheese was great as well. Is it a coincidence that the chef from one of my favorite restaurants (Fiore) comes here and now this place is incredible and the last couple times at Fiore were sub-par...I think not.

Went last night with my visiting/out of town parents. We were really disappointed. The waitress had absolutely no personality, the pasta w seafood was over cooked. My husbands pappardelle was excellent. It wasn't the standard Aita fare. I wonder if the restaurant sold to someone else. It just didn't have the charm and authentic Italian food It used to. I would rank it 4 stars if you never experienced it's original charm but only 3.5 stars for not meeting past expectations of guests that really loved the original authentic Italian restaurant in Brooklyn.

Our waitress was really friendly. They've done an immaculate job with the decor. I remember when this corner was a bodega and now it's this very beautiful little restaurant / bar. We ordered 2 pastas. The sausage brussel sprouts pasta was a bit mealy for my taste but the mushroom ragu pasta was delicious and surprising. Overall, this is such a nice neighborhood place. I'll definitely be going back. It made me feel really good about moving back to Clinton Hill after all these years away.

Very nice, classy decor. I came here for breakfast and had one of the best breakfasts I've had anywhere. In particular, the pancake (just one, but very filling) was potentially the best pancake I've ever had. And I am extremely hard to please when it comes to pancakes. Unfortunately this place is in a neighborhood I don't frequent too often, and they seem to do a lot of different things - breakfast, dinner, drinks - so I can't really try everything here, as I would like to. But my impression from the one visit was nothing but positive.

Not getting the 5 star reviews. everything was very average to below average. Spaghetti was over salted, rubbery octopus, $11 cocktails served in tiny elf glasses. I don't know, the people were nice there but this whole 'let's play iron and wine and fleetwood mac and serve tiny cocktails under amber lighting' business is really getting tired. Anyway, not horrible, but not that good either. Proceed with caution.

Was here for a girls night with my foodie of all foodie friend. The food was excellent, we highly recommend the Tuna Tartar. Service was attentive but not overbearing. I had their tequila based cocktail, it was good but nothing overly special. We had an AMAZING bottle of wine, and at 39 dollars it felt like a steal. Our biggest disappointment was a lack of gelato on the menu, it was served with other deserts but not alone. Over all it was a great evening and I would highly recommend.
Great relaxed spot. Better value and vibe than the places on Dekalb.

I hesitate to write a review, because then more people will know about this wonderful place. As out of towners, it was pure good fortune to find this restaurant. From waiters to the bartender....superb and friendly service. Will go on my list that I give to everyone I know who appreciates what hard work and skill means to food.

Nice addition to the hood, I think. Â Same owners as Forio down in Williamsburg, yet this place has a much quainter, more local feel in my opinion. Â Food was tasty, well priced and atmosphere was inviting. Â My fiance mentioned that the fish was pretty salty, but I found my pasta dish to be well seasoned. Â Will definitely be going back. Â Great place for smaller groups or just 2.
Awesome waiters, best raviolis of my life! (It were the ricotta-pecorino ravioli with leak and sage butter)
No comment
No comment

I've been here a total of 4 times now, and have been consistently impressed each time. The food is delicious and reasonably priced, and the service has always been excellent. Their brunch is great, too. It can get crowded some times, so I usually sit at the bar. Overall an excellent addition to the neighborhood!

Sadly brunch was underwhelming. Good but not great, though I wouldn't mind coming back to try the burger. The worst part of the meal was the coffee. Horrendous. Starbucks tastes better than the coffee they served. Coffee is an essential part of brunch and I couldn't take down more than the first sip.

oxtail ravioli is really good. we went late and the server gave us the vibe that she did not want us there but you know what i'm going to give her the benefit of the doubt and assume that she had a rough night or maybe her neutral resting face is just like, you know, like a mean face. i dunno. but the food is awesome! the restaurant is beautifully lit. if there are busy you can wait next door and have a drink at their bar The Mayflower. the brunch here is also really good but the wait can be crazy so bring a newspaper or a sudoku or like some mad libs to pass the time. shout out to mad libs for the good times.
No comment

I've eaten here a few times, and I've always had great service and very good food. Â Even more than that though, I love the ambiance. Â It's the kind of neighborhood place your friends and family who don't live in New York imagine when they think of Brooklyn. Â Their cocktails are really good too: in my opinion the drinks at the restaurant are actually better than the drinks at their sister bar.
Fantastic little place in fort greene with the best salads and lobster dish!

I received a very nice email from the owner regarding my negative experience at the restaurant. Â It was explained to me that both the owner and chef had left early on the night of our visit and they were concerned that my experience was not acceptable, nor reflective of their normal standard. Â So I stand corrected Â - the ownership does have pride and care in their food and service, and I must have just gone on an "off night". Â I hope to eventually revisit to see what it might be like on a typical night. Â I hope they will continue to work with their staff to maintain the level of quality they strive for... even when the chef/owner take a much deserved break from manning the shop.

Great casual atmosphere - and romantic at same time... OUTSTANDING service too... AND the food was even greater! The lettuce salad and burrata appetizer were both outstanding - as was the special chilled summer soup. Rigatoni with shrimp and the halibut special were both beautifully presented and exquisitely prepared. And - the grand finally of the olive oil cake drove me to come right home and write this review! Don't miss this place - whether a local or visitor! Oh yes - the specialty cocktails were great too - we tried their version of a margarita as well as their Manhattan - forgot their special names- (look for the descriptions with tequila or rye...duh...) both excellent - as well as the wine choices. This summer they are expanding to Clinton Hill - calling it Larina Brooklyn - can't wait!!! And - they are on Open Table too!
No comment
Been there for several times mostly for brunch. Montecristo is my best and you will find not many places carrying this food and doing it right. Don't forget to add a fried egg on it:))

It was my birthday brunch and it was delicious. Wait time was acceptable together with the Â service. The staff is very attentive to their guest. Food was fresh and vibrant. Wait time for the food was above average. Really enjoyed the time spent there. Wow! Remembering as a child going to the then corner store before going to school across the street . LoL
No comment
Delicious. Great cocktails and bar around the corner and really good food. Never an issue.

This is a nice looking place. Â We've eaten here three times and the food is consistently good. Â The first time we went for brunch. Â We had omelettes, but someone at the table next to us had what looked like the most amazing burger. Â So we went back for dinner, but unfortunately they don't serve the burger at dinner and they had a bit of a wait. Â We opted to stay anyway. Â It wasn't so bad as they share the bar next door and you can have drinks until they come get you. Â Their octopus was the best I've had in quite some time - had it both times. Â For entres we got the cavatelli and also their meat dish (lamb chops, sausage and beef). Â We still have to make it back - the burger is definitely one I have to try.

When your father is from Tuscany it is often quite difficult to satiate your father's palate with the traditional "Sause-Laden" "Gravy" style Italian restaurants of New York Lore. However, Aita provides wonderful Osteria style dining in the heart of Clinton Hill. The Octopus was tender, while the numerous pasta dishes specifically the Vongole was flavorfull without trying to overpower the ingredient with wine or other substances.

Just tried to go to Aita for brunch (3:30 pm on a Saturday). Â There was no one waiting, and they had an empty table of four composed of two smaller tables of two. Â The waitress wouldn't seat us at a table of four, wouldn't pull them apart (which could have been done very easily without disrupting the flow of the restaurant) and strangely wouldn't tell us how long the wait was. Â We left feeling confused and very unwelcome.
This is a nice Italian restaurant. Very busy with delicious food. I had incredibly tender, fatty suckling pig with nice crisp skin on top. Definitely recommend.
the best restaurant in clinton hill. food! service! aesthetics! ambience!
I'm reluctant to write this review, because I don't want them to get too crowded! A great neighborhood spot. Cozy and warm, with excellent food.
Great food, relaxed vibe and really nice people that work there. The fish dishes are cooked amazingly well and the steak and chicken are also quite good. Crispy asparagus is a must :)

Ugh? I was trying to take my father out for brunch on Easter, and they sure knew how to ruin the experience. You can't make some guests happy at the expense of others. Just some small place in public housing area, but they're as arrogant there as if they had 3 Michelin stars. Manager lays blame on a hostess, cuz "she's not really a hostess", brrr... You better not.
Wonderful place for a delicious romantic meal. Loved the atmosphere and their pasta dishes are DELICIOUS! great neighborhood spot.

Recently the neighborhood has become inundated with overpriced underwhelming eateries... Aita is NOT one of those, they are excellent - I recommend the trout. Â It's hard to imagine that it used to be and infamous drug spot but that was many years ago.
Love this place! Â I've been here several times, for both dinner and Brunch but, Brunch is my favorite. Â The Beef cheek hash is fantastic! as is the Salmon hash.

I think Aita is a special place. Â Authentic and delicious home-style Italian fare, mature and very well crafted cocktails, great atmosphere. Â I think what really sets Aita apart is the service; incredibly professional, yet friendly with a personal touch - it makes one feel right at home. Â  In Brooklyn, with so many good restaurants to choose from, Aita stands out to me as a unique and notable dining experience.
After a couple more conversations on the phone, I finally got my refund for the extra charge... Sloppy, but at least they care about customer service

TERRIBLE SERVICE! Â Waited over an hour for our food while watching everyone else who came in after us get served. Â Waiter never apologized and lied to our faces, blamed it on the kitchen being backed up even though everyone else was getting their food. Â We've been going to this place before it ever got popular, but the smug waiter ruined it for us.

This place is truly a great find. The fried fish sandwich is incredible for brunch. They also have pancakes and other more traditional brunch items. What makes this place special is the decor. Truly picturesque and one of the more beautiful restaurants in Brooklyn

I eat a LOT. And I have lived in Clinton Hill awhile. Last night, we walked into Aita for the first time. I ordered the Oxtail Ravioli and it was seriously the best pasta dish I have ever had. In my entire life. The bartender, Noah, is so sweet, and gave us nice, generous pours of wine. Order the Oxtail Ravioli. You will NOT be disappointed!!!

Finally, the dreadful Speakeasy is replaced! Although the food is relatively pricey, it is delicious. Their grilled octopus salad was splendidly served on a bed of bitter watercress along with a sweet yet sour tangelo. The oxtail ravioli was great, heavy with a thick sauce. Service was great, and overall, this is a warm welcome to Clinton Hill!

The meal was very good. Â First course was a Roasted Cauliflower, Radicchio and Chili Vinaigrette, with a glass of 2011 Occhipinti Alter Ego, a white wine version from Aleatico grapes -- fresh, unusual, delightful. Â Second course was the Garganelli, with Roasted Butternut Squash, Oyster and Shiitake Mushrooms, and a Leek Sauce. Â For the finale, a cup of delicious Neapolitan espresso with a biscotto was perfect. Â The hostess, Julia, was very accommodating, the ambience was lovely, and the food was well-done.
The atmosphere was really great and the food LOOKED great but sadly just didn't really taste good. Â Oh well.

We waited a LONG time for the Speakeasy successor, and we do have it at last! We went last Monday, the very first night it was opened, and our party of 5 (including a not-so-easy to please toddler, a finicky eater who literally devoured his bowl of custom made cheese cavatelli!) was very please with all their choices: a fantastic vegetable fritto misto, light as air, with a bowl of delicious minty yoghurt sauce, a lovely artichoke salad, a great salumi plate, and great pastas (their very personal twist on spaghetti alle vongole with shishito peppers, lovely oxtail ragout ravioli, and great orecchiette with kale and sausage. We hardly had room for dessert but the one we tried (almond cake) was moist and delicious.. Service was very charming, they have a full license and a small choice of interesting house cocktails, and what to appears a varied and interesting wine list (we had a very good Roero Arneis, a white from Piedmont) In bocca al lupo Aita! We'll be back!
very over rated!!!!food was ok.... needs help with customer service.

Went there tonight for probably the fifteenth time and this story sums it up. The owner meets my wife and me at the door and gives us a big hug, happy to see us again and when I try to describe how happy we are to be there she blurts out, " I know, you feel you are coming home." That's it-going to Aita is like going home, but to a chef that is so incredibly good, so innovative, that it is certainly not like the food I ever ate at home. This restaurant is what I need after a hard week at work. It is a five out of five and even more than that.

The interior is really cool. Speaking of cool it was too cool in there, they did not have the heat on when I went in for a late lunch. Â So I had a chill while I ate my food. Also I ordered a fish burger with a side of fries. Â The fish burger was suppose to be cod & salmon. Â It was probably 99%cod & 1%salmon. Â It was bland and pretty flat tasting. Â On the menu it said it was $14 but when the bill arrived it was suddenly $15. Â The fries tasted like they were the frozen fries you would pick up from a key food--generic, tasteless &reheated. Â I think this place is for the transplants(and there are so many now!) who have moved in to fort greene who maybe have a different palette/standards. Â As a native, I would not go back to this place or recommend it.

I've been waiting for a place like Aita to open up in Clinton Hill for a long time. Â Some friends and I went there for brunch recently and had a terrific experience. Â The space is filled with light and gorgeous touches like beautiful textiles on the banquettes and vintage sterling barware. Â The staff was gracious and mostly efficient--they're still working out some kinks (ketchup, hot sauce and salt and pepper should be de rigeur items on the table at brunch). Â I had the rich and divine fried oyster eggs benedict. Â A real treat and my friends had the frittata and the egg BLT. Â Everyone enjoyed their food. Â The bloody mary was a bit dull--I asked for spicy and no dice. Â But it was a big serving in a mason jar. Â Nice music, nice ambiance, a really good spot. Â I can't wait to go for dinner! Â Also, dig the mrs. murphy's soap in the bathroom too--it's the little touches that sometimes make a place feel really great.

So glad to have an excellent, reasonably priced restaurant in the neighborhood. Our food was perfection - oxtail ravioli (portion size a touch small for my husband for the price), cavatelli w. kale and sausage, and an amazing summer salad. Drinks were amazing! Great services, beautiful decor. Only concern - a touch small for us (tables close together). I can get over that though.

This place is amazing. So cute. Nice staff. We had the pancake/bacon/homefries combo and the chocolate french toast...and a side of the cannellini beans. All amazing. I am perplexed at the fact that no one has reviewed the chocolate french toast yet. This stuff is insane. IN-SANE. Although its definitely a dessert breakfast.....i couldnt finish it in one sitting. If you have a healthy brunch appetite...get two other entrees and then split this for brunch dessert. You CANNOT pass it up. Can't wait to go back for another brunch and give dinner a try at this spot!

Hands down my favorite restaurant in Clinton Hill. Â Admittedly is really convenient but there are a lot of restaurants in this neighborhood and I still find myself at Aita at least once a week. Â The bar at the restaurant is my favorite part of the place -- super laid back, comfortable to eat at, AMAZING drinks, great bartenders (especially Noah). Â It's the kind of place you want to stop into at the end of a good day, or a crappy day, to have a drink and relax. Â The food is also top notch and always changing. Â They typically have a Frito Misto appetizer which is an outstanding sharing item and the Mussels come in a creamy sauce with bacon that demands to be lapped up with bread. Â I tend toward the pastas and have never been disappointed. Â One of the owners, Giulia, is typically at the restaurant making sure that the guests are having a good time. Â I have never personally known a restaurant's owner but she makes you feel really at home and always says hello. Brunch is just as good but definitely get there early as the place quickly fills up. Â HIGHLY recommended.

I've only been here for brunch and the food is pretty tasty-- I enjoyed it! Â However, I did not enjoy being asked unceremoniously to go sit at the bar after I finished brunch to accommodate a large party when the restaurant was 1/3 empty. Â If you are going to hustle people out or to the bar, you're supposed to say something like "can I offer you a mimosa at the bar?", not just basically tell us to beat it. Â I would probably go back back again, but I am bit skeptical of the service.

I see Aita all the time on my way to work so I decided to pop in earlier today for brunch. I must say that I was pleasantly surprised. The brunch here is very good. I ordered the 2 scrambled eggs, with bacon, potatoes and a pancake and this meal had wonderful flavors. Everything was coked the way I like it. The pancake (my absolute favorite thing in the world) was very tasty. They definitely know how to make a blueberry pancake here. The prices are pretty moderate, but I do feel that the portion was a bit small. You only get one pancake which is more of the silver dollar variety and you barely get any potatoes. Granted I was able to overlook this because it tasted good, but I like to leave a pace satisfied, not looking for something else to eat in another hour. Most places either give you way too much or not enough at all and Aita unfortunately falls in the latter category. Another small gripe was the bacon; it was a bit overcooked which kind of sucked, but again a very small thing. All in all a pretty good place. I'd definitely do brunch here again.
very good place In Clinton hill fort greene, great staff goes a long way, very nice owner, good food and drinks, great date spot

I used to go to Fiore in Williamsburg, so I was excited to read that the same chef is involved in this place. Â  Â I was sooo happy to see one of my favorite dishes included on the menu -- the raw artichoke salad. Â (BUT, bring back the shaved parmesan instead of the parmesan "croutons.") Â  I ordered the canelloni and it was wonderful. Â I also had tastes of my friends' dishes and the fish special with the carmelized onions and roasted beets was fabulous, but the chicken dish was somewhat eh by comparison. Â I appreciated the fact that, while the place was lively, the four of us could easily have a conversation without having to shout. Â  The service was excellent / prompt & our waitress was charming and friendly without being overly friendly. Â  Â It was a little warm sitting by the window -- that was the only down side. Â On the the other hand, I'm the kind of person who would rather be too warm than too cold.

Lovely Sunday dinner with my husband and another couple this past Sunday. Very cozy and romantic atmosphere, my husband and I were seated even though our friends had not yet arrived, and we assured them they would be there in 10 minutes. Friendly staff, delicious drinks and a nice wine list by the glass. I had the best Old Fashioned I have ever tasted, it was perfectly mixed and the right balance of sweet and boozy. All of our food was delicious, especially my sun choke salad with mushrooms-heaven. My risotto was a bit on the sweet side for my taste, almost like a rice pudding with butternut squash flavor, but still well done nonetheless. The meal was well paced, the portions on the generous side (and certainly well priced), and the staff checked on our food and water glasses frequently. Â They also have a little bar in the back called Mayflower with a separate entrance which looks like a speakeasy, very nice atmosphere but I ordered the same drink and it wasn't half as good (different bartender). I'll be back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Outstanding and unforgettable dining experience at Clover Hill. We were blown away by the attention to detail, flavors, and execution of the menu. It's a small, intimate space perfect for a nice date (maybe not the first, make sure you like them ;)) or a group of 4-5. The service was also excellent and knowledgeable, considering there are 8-9 dishes per seating. I haven't been this excited about a restaurant in a very long time and hope they continue to do their thang!

What can I say. I had dinner at Clover Hill restaurant in Brooklyn Heights to celebrate Lizettes birthday. Â It was Michelin Star Chief Mitchell. I can say everything was 100 stars. Food. Service. Presentation. Staff = exceptional. Â If you want an experience, this is the place to go. He did his thing. The food was exceptional. Â Service was great. Pipper was our host and she was great. Very personal and engaging. Ambiance was awesome.

For all its great reviews and Michelin star, this restaurant was a disappointment. Â The food was what one might see in a Michelin level of distinction. Â Good, tasty, but not exceptional. Â And it was expensive. Â Two small rolls with butter was $15. Â The other dishes were about a 25 percent higher than most recent two-star and many of the one star restaurants that we have been to in the last three months. Â That would be about 12 Â restaurants.

Being totally honest, I came into this experience with lower expectations. I have had a few similar new one star restaurants in New York...especially Brooklyn that just seemed hype over execution. Enter clover hill. A (literally) hidden gem in an obscure corner of Brooklyn heights. Actually this block in Brooklyn is worth a visit alone. Chef charlie Mitchell is on his way to his second Michelin star very soon. He has taken fine dining and infused it with American spice and excitement. His delightfully filling menu is hit after hit. Once you enter the dark, moody, small interior you are greeted by a friendly and knowledgeable staff. The pace of the meal is just fine. The drink menu is streamlined but solid. If I have one note it is I would love some sort of menu to accompany meal service. Call me old fashioned but I like to read what I'm eating not just heat it. This is a seafood focused menu and I am fine with that. I'd even say no need to upgrade to the meat dish. Fish is what they do so go for the ride. The crab tart was a fun take on the dish and took me to summers on the boardwalk! I could eat that farro porridge every day! So delicious. Check it out!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Very exciting! Ambiance & food were just wonderful! Very refreshing and thoughtful dinner! Chef & team are very kind & sweet. Will be back
No comment
Very cozy little spot. On the slightly fancier side but every bite was delicious! Had the short rib cannelloni which rocked and was very happy with the madeleines. Would absolutely go back

Amazing. Don't know how else to describe it. What a hidden gem! We had brunch and dishes there are a revelation - it's innovative, delicious, and beautiful. I also love that the portions are not huge - they are just the right size to fill up but not overeat. The ambiance made my partner and I to own a place like that were we would take our friends and family to hang out. Beautiful decor. We are sad it's so far from where we live in Manhattan, but we will definitely won't skip it when we are next in the neighborhood.
Brunch was amazing! French omelette was fantastic. Melted in my mouth. The perfect balance for a brunch. My husband enjoyed the pork belly on the side. Will stop by again on the next visit for sure.
Excellent food, service and atmosphere. The tasting menu is very inviting and tastes incredible.

I walked in expecting just a really nice dinner and walked out experiencing culinary art. I was treated to what can only be described as a dining experience from beginning to end. The music was a whole vibe. The staff were wonderful to interact with. The food was outstanding!!! I cannot recommend this place enough. Worth every penny to eat in this wonderful space.

This meal was amazing. Great service too. We reserved the bar (which is a la cart) and we didn't realize, but was July 4th weekend, so was not busy and we got to sit at a table. The tables are normally for the tasting menu, but we had a choice. We did a la cart and loved it! I'm sure the tasting menu is fantastic too. Small Â cozy place with such a good vibe. Highly recommend.

We had the most delicious brunch here! We had the hen egg, omelette and pate. They were super accommodating to my gluten allergy. We even had a little dessert. The coffee was delicious, with espresso drinks as good or better than a high quality coffee shop. Will go again!

A lot to like about this place! Attentive waitstaff, creative dishes and nice coffee! I had a latte and the crushed potato with black pepper and fried egg. Everything about the dish was really, really nice though I guess I got kinda bored? Potatoes are awesome but it was really the focal point of the dish and after a while I was like...I just don't want anymore of this. A bit of bacon or pancetta would have maybe made up some of this ground? My girlfriend had the waffles with apple. She said the waffles were really good but the smoked apple was kinda weird. Would like to come back and try other things! The only slightly off putting stuff was some of the plants were dying and some of the waitstaff were dressed formally and others were very casual. I don't mind what you wear as a waiter, live your best life but it felt super Brooklyn hipstery which we never want.

This place honestly left a lasting impression. I'm looking forward to going back. The food was visually pleasing AND equally flavorful, which I feel is rare to come by! The staff was also very welcoming. Great place for a date night or even a nice dinner with friends. Def worth it!!!

Wow! Â Every bite was a special occasion. I went to a really famous Michelin star restaurant the day before and this was the place I would return to again. Quaint and charming local neighborhood restaurant but world class food.
What an incredible addition to the neighborhood. Clover hill combines a cozy neighborhood vibe with Michelin level food. Could not recommend the tasting more.
No comment
No comment

Beautiful restaurant with creative and elevated cuisine. Love that it's open for breakfast on the weekends - probably one of the only places in the neighborhood other than chains or diners open before 11am. We had the truffle potatoes and eggs (so rich and delicious!) and the toast with ricotta and pears and got to sit with our toddler in a lovely window seat overlooking the street. We were probably one of the only families so it's not overrun with children but also not unwelcoming to children either. =)

Brunch was absolutely outstanding, down to the perfect toast. The scone was served on cream, and was unbelievably flavorful. I would definitely order the bacon and the truffle potatoes and eggs again. Even the temperatures of everything were perfect.

I LOVE this new restaurant in the neighborhood. It's very welcoming, has a beautiful design, and everything from the cutlery to the sugar bowl is elegant! The music is not too loud so it's a great place to talk and you really feel like you can stay all day. The trout with beets is delectable! The service was very attentive and friendly as well. I love how open it is, it's great for a huge group or even for a more intimate date.
Amazing brunch food. Ordered the trout, monk fish, Apple and celery salad, and pistachio scone and all were excellent.

If you're looking for a warm inviting dining space to settle in and eat phenomenal food, Clover Hill is the place to go to. Exceptional service and a great place to spend time with friends and family who will enjoy themselves!

This neighborhood has been crying out for a restaurant of this caliber for years - ever since Iris Cafe closed. Clover Hill is cozy and approachable while serving up Michelin Star quality food in an affordable tasting menu style experience. They are BYO at the moment, so reservations are highly suggested so that they can steer your beverage purchase based on the nightly menu - another lovely and personal touch that makes it all the more worthwhile.
Masterful flavor combinations. Fresh ingredients. Above average plating. Cozy decor. Welcome to the neighborhood!
Just what the neighborhood needs! Really good, unique food. Cozy setting. Best brunch I've had in a while. The celery and apple salad was a sleeper hit.

This place is fantastic. The best brunch I've had in a very long time. Unassuming, yet very close attention to detail in all facets of execution - from high quality service to beautiful handcrafted plateware, high quality napkin linens, and phenomenal food. Will certainly be back for more. Try the pistachio scone w satsuma jam and the truffled potatoes and eggs.

This is a fantastic addition to the Brooklyn Heights/ Cobble Hill neighborhood -- the food is creative, carefully crafted, and delicious. Â We were very impressed with the quality and the plating. Every dish was something I had never had before... from scallops with salsify (the best scallops I've ever had), goat cheese dumplings with savory cabbage, etc. They change the dinner menu weekly, so it's clear they have a lot more tricks up their sleeve. Our server was very attentive, too. It's a quiet, charming atmosphere in a cozy townhome on a cobble street in Brooklyn. It should be a destination, and definitely worth a trip from Manhattan or elsewhere. The tasting menu at $95 was a good value but the dishes can be ordered off the menu too. And the BYO option makes the evening much more affordable. Really excellent. Michelin star worthy, if they don't have one already.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here on a Wed night at 7:30pm with a friend and waited about 30 min. I personally really liked the Gnocchi and Beef Wrap, but didn't find the Tonton Hot Pot to be very special. If I ever come again, I'd focus more on the small plates/appetizers. It's pretty pricey, but I'd say average for any place here in Midtown. The Gnocchi had a really strong mentaiko and sweet taste. And what I loved about the Yakiniku Wrap was that the wrap (similar to Chinese scallion pancakes) wasn't soggy as all. The Tonton Hot Pot is a good level of spice, but felt the portion was really small for the price. And, there wasn't anything impressive in the hot pot itself. Overall a good experience, but I probably wouldn't come for the hot pot again.

Came at prime dinner time and it was decently packed. Ambiance was chill but if you are a party of 5, they will squeeze you in a booth for 4. The hamachi was the best app but I would avoid the monkfish liver at all costs--it was extremely fishy, which it should not be if it were fresh. The Tonton hotpot was ok but it was honestly mostly cabbage or fatty organs. Not a huge fan, won't be returning. Servers were polite with extremely strong water game.
No comment

This was a fun place to go for tapas. If you sit at the bar, you can't have the hot pot option but that was okay for me and my friend. We liked the mentai gnocchi and the okonomiyaki. Since the okonomiyaki is a little salty, it's good with the fried rice with pork. The shake ramen was a cold ramen that was okay, and they shake it in front of you. The pink lady roll is good if you're craving sushi. Overall, the price wasn't bad and I would be interested in coming back to try other items.
