My date and I stumbled upon Hakata Tonton after a night of drinking and we were so glad we did! We wanted something light and delicious to satisfy our hunger and this place hit the spot. We ordered the Mentai Fried Rice, which was a tasty and savory dish that had the perfect amount of spice from the cod roe. We also got the Goma Hamachi, which was a beautifully presented dish with tender and flavorful sesame yellowtail. The service was friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere was cozy and inviting. We can't wait to go back and try more dishes when we're hungrier! Highly recommend Hakata Tonton for a satisfying and delicious meal.
No comment

Had dinner here on a Wednesday after work. We didn't have reservations so just opted to sit at the bar, which worked out since we weren't getting hotpot. Service was fast and efficient. We just wanted a quick bite, so opted to try a few of the app plates. We ended up ordering the citrus salmon, pepper chicken, roast beef rolls, and garlic pork belly. Everything arrived fairly quickly, portion sizes were good for sharing with 2 people max. I loved the brightness of the salmon citrus, that was my fave dish, especially with the roe! Second fave was the pork belly, you can't go wrong with either flavor. They have a nice assortment of specialty cocktails, along with beer and liquor, which we did not indulge in tonight but good to know for options. We enjoyed our dinner here and would come back to sample more plates!
No comment

The food was mid. The price was average for the location but you can go anywhere else for quality Japanese food. This was not worth the hype. The service was great and everyone was attentive. The karaage was cold. I've had better karaage at Raku. The pot stickers was tasteless and super oily. The almond pudding was better at Kimura.
No comment

Not only was the motsunabe satisfying, but the other izakaya food were also awesome. I especially loved the uni scallop and the tonsoku (pork foot). Could not decide which dessert to get so we got the platter and got to try everything. What a great time! No wonder there are so many Japanese salarymen there.
No comment

Came here for a casual date night with my boyfriend. We got the citrus salmon, pepper wings, and small Tonton hotpot. The interior looks very fun with neon signs and loud music; it's definitely a good place for some drinks and snacks. The food was delicious and fresh, and I specifically loved the hotpot, as they were quite generous with the pig feet! Service was quick and professional, and overall we had a great time! Highly recommend coming here for an evening out with friends!
No comment
No comment

The food at Hakata Tonton is like tapas/small share plates. Between myself and a friend we ordered 4 small dishes (forgot to take a photo, was so hungry!) and then shared the dessert plate. We ordered the ramen, baos, karage and truffle potatoes. The ramen we could have done without but everything else was delicious. My friend had to eat somewhere near Penn Station. Would recommend if you are in the area
No comment
Although the star of the menu is the hot pot, there are so many yummy small dishes that should not be missing.

I came here for dinner with a friend on a Thursday night. I was a fan of Hakata TonTon when it used to be downtown. I'm glad they opened a location in midtown since it's now near my work. We shared the pepper wings, the small Tonton hot pot (spicy miso broth, chicken thigh, pork feet, pork belly, dumplings, tofu, vegetables), and the green tea tofu dessert. The wings were crispy and the black sesame gave it a good crunch. The small hot pot was a good portion for two people. The broth was flavorful and had a good kick to it. My only gripe was that there were only two small dumplings and I wanted more haha. The green tea tofu dessert was the best dish. The tofu was so silky and definitely tasted homemade. Service was super friendly and attentive. The restroom was amazing, a decked out Toto toilet, floss picks, hair ties, mouthwash, Q tips, etc. I would definitely come back!
No comment
No comment

The wait wasn't too bad but I recommend making a reservation if they have. The portions are pretty small so I recommend ordering a lot. The okonomiyaki had cheese and that was probably the most filling item we got. The mentai gnocchi was good but too bad there was so little :(
No comment

Came here for my birthday and everything was delicious! The sashimi platter was fresh and the food was also cooked perfectly! The fried rice was delicious and a must to get. The katsu sandwich was okay, there was a hint of wasabi and I was hoping for more crunch, I would pass on this. I would definitely get the wrap over the sandwich as it was more flavorful and had a better texture.The potato was delicious, I really liked the combination with the subtle truffle flavor. Overall, a cute spot in Ktown away from the long waits. The portions are small but it is a tapas place so that just means more things to try! I would come here again as the staff were extremely friendly and attentive!
No comment
No comment

I couldn't find any reservations online and ended up waiting an hour when my friend and I came here at 6PM on a Thursday. We shared their Motsu Hot Pot Small ($35), Garlic Tonsoku ($12), and Wasabi Kanpachi ($16). The portions are a bit small for the price, but I really liked the appetizers. The garlic tonsoku was so soft and delicious. The wasabi kanpachi was quite good and refreshing and I thought that the flavors were pretty unique. There is a good variety of food in the motsu hot pot. While I also did enjoy that, I found it way too oily (especially towards the end of the meal).
No comment
Great they reopened. Thought it was one of the most tragic loss of restaurant closers during covid. Â It's back, better, and bigger.
No comment

Hakata TonTon is my favorite izakaya in nyc til date. I've been here twice and it never disappoints. The food is AMAZING and the servers here are quick and attentive. I've never fell in love with a restaurant so quickly but this was literally chef's kiss. Each dish I have tried exceeded my expectations. I always leave with a satisfied stomach and I even look forward to coming back. I've tried a third of the menu already within the two times I have went. I can't wait to come back again!
No comment

Soooo yummy!! Definitely did not disappoint. I went with some co workers expecting to wait a loooong time since there were no reservations open, but to our fortunate surprise-- no wait! We got an assortment of food and I got say I think my favorite was the hot pot-- so warm and filling and flavorful. We are three designers so we were also very impressed by the branding , the menu, and the dish ware!! The perfect spot for some friends to hang Nd catch up.

All their dishes had so much potential but just barely missed the mark. We ordered a number of dishes and the wasabi kanpachi and the okonomiyaki were the only ones we absolutely loved. Everything else was missing something. However, the prices were so reasonable that it's hard to beat! Â It's very busy here so make sure to get a reservation early to get a good table.
No comment
I thought that this place was very experimental and nice. Would recommend for the vibes

Loved this spot! Nothing on their menu disappointed. Everything had so much flavor and portions were decently sized! Service was great here as well~ They had a really extensive menu and I will definitely be back to try their other items! Highly recommend getting the yakiniku wraps & okonomiyaki !
No comment

The service here was superb, but unfortunately I wouldn't come back again. Â I originally was excited to try this place after seeing the glowing TikTok reviews. Â However, the portions are extremely small compared to what you see online in pictures and TikTok videos. Â When the sashimi platter came I was shocked by how tiny is it. Â For the price, you can easily order Japanese hotpot and sushi at places like Kimura in NYC.

My friends and I were so happy to finally see the return of Hakata Tonton since the pandemic, my absolute favorite NYC restaurant! We were also delighted that the original chef Chef Koji Hagihara has returned. We went opening weekend and he was there smiling and checking in with all the tables. All the staff were very friendly and seemed so happy to be back. The new space is a bit larger and more modern with more seating and a modern spacious ambiance. The menu includes about half old favorites and half new items with some improvements to old favorites as well. Everything was amazing as always! I missed the seaweed salad and salmon or tuna carpaccio but the Goma Hamachi, which was mixed table side, was my new favorite dish. The tonton hotpot was amazing as always, perfectly spiced melding of flavors and the pork and gelatinous cartilage melts in your mouth.
No comment

Hakata TonTon is a delicious new addition to Ktown! They were previously open before COVID and recently opened a couple months ago. We got the Ton Ton Hot Pot large ($61), which came with chicken thigh, pork feet, pork belly, dumplings, tofu, and veggies. I really enjoyed the flavor of the broth! Very savory and warming but not too salty. Docking a star because it was kinda expensive. Our waiter told us the large could feed 3, but the two of us easily finished the large and our rices and could've eaten an appetizer or two. Good addition to Ktown though!
No comment
No comment
No comment

We got the TonTon hot pot in large for 5 people and also ordered some other small plates like the karage, shake shake ramen, goma hamachi. It still wasn't enough food for me personally (I think l was just extra hungry that day) but I liked everything on the menu! I especially liked the shake shake ramen which they have in a big mason jar and they literally shake it in front of you to get all the yummy flavors mixed in nicely with the noodles and the sauce. It's a cold noodle with chicken I think. If you're in Ktown and don't want to spend money on overpriced mediocre Korean food, I'd recommend coming here instead.

column3: Central City, Salt Lake City, UT
column6: No comment

After we spent $550 for party of 5 you guys can try it and let me know. Let's see how's the business going. They never care customers when they think they are so popular. Food so suck. Try intestine hot pot.
Soup / stew was the best ... everything else was avg . I prob wouldn't come back . Menus very simple and small . services was great tho ! I think we liked the service more than the food
No comment
No comment
Good service, easy to make a reservation. I ordered the breaded pork cutlet don. Hakata gives you a free drink with check in
No comment
No comment

Great atmosphere, fast service, and fresh flavors! We got the hot pot, mentai gnocchi, and mapo tofu. The hot pot was so warm and comforting with a little kick of spice, but I wish it had less cabbage (there was a LOT of cabbage) and more pig's feet & dumplings. The mapo tofu had so much flavor and and comes with rice, probably my favorite dish from here! The mentai gnocchi was so unique; the roe adds a perfect savoriness to the pillowy-soft gnocchi. Great portion sizes, would come back here to try more appetizers!
The hotpot is sooo good! Very good service too! I live very nearby and would appreciate if you allow take out or delivery!

We had a reservation for a party of six, but one person couldn't make it so they stuffed our party of 5 into a table for 4. They aggressively refused to give us our original reserved table. To make matters worse, they seated a party of 2 at a table for 4 next to us. It was Sunday night and the restaurant was not crowded. Food isn't bad, but not worth the poor hospitality.
No comment
tastes good, the portion for a small hotpot is very large. The cocktail is a bit of a let down, but overall will visit with a friend next time.
No comment

The food was great. There were so many delicious menu items that i will definitely want to come back again to try them. Swevice was good. Bathroom was large and spacious and nicely stocked with extras like floss, mouthwash, etc.

Between the two of us, we ordered a drink each and 4 dishes to share. It was just enough food without being too heavy. The ankimo (monkfish liver in a yuzu miso sauce) was my favorite out of the bunch. The sashimi platter and okonomiyaki were nice apps and the recommended shake (x2) ramen was just okay. Would not order the ramen again. I would come again for the hot pot because that looked really good!

Stopped in here by chance and everything was hella good from the drinks, service, food, and dessert !! We got the uni scallops, liver sashimi, goma hamachi, and the chicken karaage. All the sashimi was fresh and top quality, the liver with the pajang sauce was an umami bomb! The best karaage I've had in a long time! So crunchy on the outside and juicy on the inside, we killed it! Didn't even get a picture. We got the kocha cheesecake and it did not disappoint, the fresh orange zest and homemade whipped was the best way to finish off the meal. The service was top notch every step of the way and the decor had a nice modern vibe. Will be back again the next time we visit New York!!

Service was great but I thought the food was ok. Got a sashimi platter and a scallop roll and citrus salmon and the fish was fresh. Mentai gnocchi was good and the Maru Maru potato had good truffle flavor. The garlic pork belly was very salty and the chicken ramen tasted a bit like shin ramen to be honest. Dessert platter was nice and cute.

We were lucky to get a table here on a busy Friday night! Drinks were a little pricey but worth it. I would come back to this place for the Â Maru maru potato alone. It was soooo good! Pink lady sushi roll was extremely fresh and high quality. I took off a star because the shishito peppers in the Kambu Green were undercooked.
No comment

Much more refined then prev location. Cute interior/menu. Service was ok, not superb. Presentation was great. Now taste~hmmm. beef intestine pot~underwelming. Chewing fat and rubber is not my idea of a goodtime, accompanied by only cabbage /chives doesnt help either. Maybe waitstaff should give a heads up about the texture. Â Bit salty on the miso pork stick. Wanted to take a pic with the stick on and the waitress insisted she have to take it out asap. so that was wierd. So i didnt the pic i wanted~boo. I Felt like its missing a hint of more personal guidance from the waitstaff and we be good, but Price is well worth it for another trip.
A good place to go after work with friends, I like most of the appetizers more than the pig feet hot pot. Recommend you choose a cocktail to have all those small dishes.

The pork feet is great. But the roast beef seems just from the refrigerator. The service is also problematic. I ordered the whelp salad with server A. After I finished all other dishes, server B came and said they don't have whelp salad anymore. So I ordered the gyoza. Before I got the gyoza, server C came and wanted to clean up my table.

Wow! I really enjoyed my meal here. Originally, I had booked reservations here because I'm an uni lover. I saw some uni dishes and I wanted to try it. I didn't realize that when I came for lunch, the menu was different. But I was pleasantly surprised at the meal. It was unique and different. The dim sum was delicious. The desserts were also really good. I tried the tofu with matcha sauce and the sesame ice cream. I like both but prefer the tofu and matcha dish more. It wasn't overly sweet. I recommend! Be sure to make reservations. I saw a couple walk in and the restaurants was booked up for lunch on a Sunday.

Nice place. Good taste. Creative fusion dishes with a good preservation of authenticity.

I loved this restaurant in west village. They finally opened in ktown with more items on menu. Updated interior and menu. I personally liked it more when it was in west village. The food tasted better and interior felt much more Japanese. Now it's like a fusion restaurant/bar.

Hakata TonTon was such a treat! The service was amazing, the bathrooms have bidets/toiletries, and the interior is clean and comfortable. The food was amazing - everything we tried was a hit. I would definitely recommend coming with 2-4 people so you can try as many izakaya small dishes! It's hard to pick a favorite, but I'd 100% get the fried avocado, dessert sampler, karage, and shaken ramen again. 10/10 for this place

The food was so AMAZINGThe staff treated our table very friendly. The wait time was under 0 minutes. The response to menu recommendations were all on point. I would rate this restaurant an 11/10 because it was phenomenal.
Really good small dish in a fresh space. Drinks selection is great too. Would recommend.

It was okay. The service was nice of course but food is a little pricy. Ordered the soup, uni scallop which was great and the truffle potato. Wanted to take out some food but since they don't have containers they don't do take outs.
